column1: Custom Talk Tool Isn't Purging MediaServer /catalog/podcast/ URLs
column23:
gav [9:06 AM]
{quote}Custom Talk sends `purgey` requests for the surrogate keys `catalog/show/###` and `v2/catalog/show/###` .  But not for `catalog/podcast/###` , which was added after this feature was added to Talk.
And mediaserver doesn‚Äôt add `catalog/show/###` to `catalog/podcast/###` requests, rightly so.
I‚Äôll prepare a change to Custom Talk to include these surrogate keys as well.{quote}
column83: 05/Feb/19 3:02 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Live in prod.

column1: Blank Cume Results in Schema Validation Error
column23:
In the Streams tool, there seems to be an error in the tool where if you try to update a station that has no data for the cume, it's throwing a schema error and preventing save.

 !image-2018-12-20-09-30-19-409.png|thumbnail! 

Cume should be optional - (returning a null value in the API if none specified)... or if a value is provided, it should be a number.

This was last worked on in IHRAR-5059, but something isn't working right anymore.
column67:
# Stream edit screen should accept either a number or blank value for the cume
# Blank values should be returned in the API as null; numbers should be returned as a number
column79:
https://stream-manager.radioedit.iheart.com/#/stream/edit/1829

Blank the cume value.  Attempt to save.

Check console and see schema errors as shown in the screenshot.
column83: 02/Jan/19 9:57 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Fixed and deployed before the christmas holiday break.

column1: Can't select path var in "Add more" section of collection block and "Add more" section using separate "query" field
column23:
Coast currently needs this functionality to exist for content filtering. Coast has article types (Show, Guest, etc..) and categories (UFOs, Ancient Medicine, etc...). We need to be to filter down articles which are tagged with "Show" and "UFOs".

We were told the way to do this is to add a custom query in the Advanced area of the collection block, but the block currently doesn't allow for the path var to be selected.
Also when we clear the tags from topic selection box and use the "Add More" box, it places the query in "query" field instead of using "@query". FiRE doesn't seem to look at query so it is never retrieves any articles.

This is currently blocking the Coast migration to FiRE
column67: Be able to select the path var and have the "Path Var Namespace" applied to the path var.
column83: 09/Jan/19 11:23 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;[~mbrown] or [~amamut], what are the implications of this on a local user who has access to Site Manager?  If they accidentally set a value here on a station site (because the fields are unlocked and not labeled in a way that local users would understand, eg help text), what impact would it have on their user-facing website?
column84:
09/Jan/19 2:00 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Discussed with Trey a bit.  This is another thing that we'll want to make sure local users don't touch in Site Manager.

As part of the redesign, I expect that we'll lockout "basic" users from the pages screen since everything can be customized in the other sections of site manager.  "Advanced" users who Tony/Paul/etc believe are trustworthy would have that access (to be able to re-organize their homepage) on a case by case basis.  

[~ccrbdl1mje] ^^ FYI

column1: Push New Item Format to Pubsub for Coast to Coast
column23:
Coast wants to ingest linked content to the new Content Tool. e.g. a Show page can be linked to multiple Guest pages. Currently the new tool doesn't allow via Publish API.

This is blocking the Coast/FiRE migration in a way where fake data is being used as placeholders which is the best to weed out any unknown issues.

column23:
Currently, the New Content tool is not sending linked content to PubSub. This is blocking Coast's FiRE templates needs to render linked data to fulfill intended user experience e.g. User lands on a show page and wants to click on a Guest link to read up on the Guest's bio..

https://content.radioedit.ihrint.com/content/5c12b8e4bb0da590dcf84d20 (guest that has a link to a show)

column1: Exclude Items That Aren't Published From Content Lookups
column23:
Found while testing IHRAR-5046.

The content embed block search returns results for items that are not published.  If an editor embeds one of these items and a user clicks on it, they'd get a 404.

We should update both the content embed and content link functions to only return items that are published.

Thinking we might be able to do this by setting the Status filter in the modal to Published by default?

04/Jan/19 2:20 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.  Not working as expected.  Now no results are being shown in the content lookup modal:

The same filter "test" has been applied to both windows - the modal on the left should show the ones on the right that have been published.

Confirmed that results for a given query match when the main list view is set to status = Published when adding a content embed block.

This doesn't appear to be happening via Quick Add.

column1: Creation of a preset does not work until preset effects loaded.
column23: Creating a preset on the content-add modal based on another preset doesn't actually create it unless you have visited the preset page.
column79:
Load content tool, should land you on content page.
Hit New Item
Hit Use Different Settings if applicable
Pick a preset from Use Preset
Check "save these settings as" and put in a name
Click Create Content

Problem is due to lazy-loading of modules, so preset effects and reducers etc do not yet exist until they are loaded for the first time by navigation to the "presets" area of the application.
column83: 21/Dec/18 9:01 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.  Followed the above steps to reproduce and did not observe any abnormalities.  This looks good to me.

column1: Remove "schema" feature and replace with bucket-wide json schema validation
column23: ObjectDB doesn't use the "schema" attribute except for client-side validation of documents on save. Mongodb 4.0 includes support for json-schema directly in the DB, so we can remove "schema" from everywhere and replace it with DB-based json-schema validation.
column83: 09/Jan/19 2:01 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;No product review here.  This passed engineering review, so closing as complete.

column1: Refine Refresh Presentation Upon Change Of Filter Settings In List View
column23:
Observed while testing IHRAR-5047 where the list view no longer scrolls back up to the top upon every filter change.

When a user is scrolled down on the page to be able to see the fields they wish to filter on, upon making a change, the list view blanks for a moment and re-loads.  It seems we're missing something visually to indicate that the results are being updated, rather than just blanking and showing an updated list.

Should we consider moving the loader animation that's currently in the list view column header to instead be centered (and larger) when the list view is blanked so that users know something is being updated/loaded?

column1: SPIKE: Need to add new IPV6 media proxy for comcast to our servers created by ADE
column23:
this is a proxy that works for all different types of podcasts no matter the redirects with full control of the media. This needs to be added to tv-client github repo -> develop branch. And integrated into Jenkins job.

The proxy itself is a straight Node app that uses the current Node 10 LTS as its base Node package. 

Then we use the following npm packages
    "config": "^2.0.1",
    "cors": "^2.8.5",
    "express": "^4.16.4",
    "http-proxy-middleware": "^0.19.0",
    "url-join": "^4.0.0",
    "winston": "^3.1.0" (logging)
  

We usually wrap these in Docker images to ease any OS issues. 

This is a pretty simple app and shouldn‚Äôt have any real hard OS requirements.
column67: Jenkins release pushes updates to this proxy to the correct directory on tv.iheart.com and tvstage.iheart.com
column83:
12/Dec/18 5:08 PM;PeterTeitelbaum@iheartmedia.com;[~tlong]- is this something you could host on RE? Ideally we'd be able to throw this docker container into kube, but that platform isn't ready yet.

[~1118371]- please weigh in with any thoughts you have on this as well. TV client environment is not currently running docker (runs Apache/PHP) and the new vendor has provided a node app in a docker container.

[~howella]- what's the time sensitivity on this?
column84: 02/Jan/19 10:48 AM;AdamHowell@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrlax1pit] It's holding up some integrations with Comcast's Xfinity products because they want more of our live streams and podcasts, but it is not an outage emergency.
column85: 02/Jan/19 10:49 AM;AdamHowell@iheartmedia.com;I think getting a plan together early this month and getting this out the door in Early February would be an adequate amount of time. Sooner would make the partner happier, but I can imagine there are a lot of early year requests :)
column86: 03/Jan/19 11:31 AM;eamonbd@iheartmedia.com;I have relabeled this into a spike ticket and we should be able to take this on in the next sprint.
column87:
03/Jan/19 12:32 PM;PeterTeitelbaum@iheartmedia.com;[~howella]- I had a quick chat with Trey earlier. He said RadioEdit can easily host this.

Would you rather we move this ticket into the RE queue, or do you want to sync up with Trey and create a new ticket?
column88: 04/Jan/19 10:33 AM;AdamHowell@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrlax1pit] sounds like this would require RadioEdit team time, which I am a bit concerned about. I will talk with Trey about this and then handle this ticket.
column89:
15/Jan/19 11:31 AM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;After discussing with [~howella] this looks to be two basic steps.

#1 SRE needs to move RadioEdit to Fastly's dual stack setup for IPv6 support.

#2 RE should use our existing proxy code to make a new service in go that can proxy traffic for this podcasts app.

The alternative to #2 would be to use an existing nodejs based app. However, since the proxy will have to actually manage all of the traffic between any podcast (or stream) and the consumer my recommendation would be to use Go for this purpose.
column90:
15/Jan/19 11:32 AM;AdamHowell@iheartmedia.com;current example of this app not on our platform works like this...
http://nprx1.weade.co/proxy?url=http://rfcmedia.streamguys1.com/MusicPulse.mp3
column91: 15/Jan/19 11:44 AM;AdamHowell@iheartmedia.com;this is the repo https://github.com/adiffengine/media-proxy For Access please contact Adam Howell

column88: 17/Dec/18 8:32 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;We shouldn‚Äôt transform the value- if there‚Äôs no display name, on FiRE we give them the actual tag name as is. In the case of the above example, ‚Äúmike-test‚Äù should be returned as that‚Äôs what the tag is (and there‚Äôs no display name set)
column89: 17/Dec/18 11:26 AM;AndrewVickory@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrnyc2msw], [~1119767], is there a qa/stage version of news.iheart.com?  If we aren't null-ing the display name, I'm trying to figure out what would go in the title field of a topic page.  Right now the tag name would get dropped directly onto the page, I could check if the display name is equal to the tag name, but surfacing that logic on the client isn't a great idea.  If we do it this way, would it be possible to surface a boolean that says whether or not the display name should be displayed?
column90:
17/Dec/18 11:34 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Not readily available due to an environment shortage. By design, all tag names should be user friendly, but there were some bad values imported from T2 that weren‚Äôt user friendly, and because the capacity to rename topics doesn‚Äôt exist, a display name override was determined to be the best solution. 

I don‚Äôt think we want to add logic to show or hide the display name, would prefer to fallback to the topic tag name if no display name override is provided, matching our other clients behavior.
column91: 17/Dec/18 12:01 PM;AndrewVickory@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrnyc2msw], in that case, this work looks good to me!  Thanks guys!

column1: Better validation on content editor
column23:
- see all errors displayed above the summary
- decorate tabs indicating that there are errors on that tab
column83:
11/Dec/18 12:55 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.

Observed that a new error message is shown at the top of the page upon a user's first load of a new content item.  Some notes:

1) We shouldn't show an error to users every time they try to create a new item.  Can this be changed to only appear when a user hits the save button?

2) "Required" text on individual fields is not consistent.  On the headline, it's all lowercase, on primary image and blocks, it's Sentence Case.  Please make this uniform.  I prefer sentence case.

3) Item has errors at the top does not show an error pertaining to the primary image not being present.  We should specifically call that out.

4) If you insert a block but leave it blank, "There was an unknown error" appears.  Please update this to be more specific.

5)  If you have multiple blocks that are blank/have errors, we should explicitly call them out.  Can we reference the block type and corresponding error?  Ex, Gallery Block - Missing Title
column84:
11/Dec/18 1:36 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;1. No, because we prevent save until the content item is valid
2. Will do.
3. Primary image is not marked as required in the template. The error you're seeing is just saying that the url is required in order for the image to be valid.
4. I'll look into it.
5. Right now, block errors are not bubbling down correctly. I wasn't sure how much time to burn on that.
6. Error messages can always be changed
column85:
11/Dec/18 1:48 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;#1 understood, but I'm not cool with displaying an error before a user even does anything.  Is there another way we can show it independent of the save button but not upon initial load?  

#3 - this is required in the old tool.  Do we need to make it required here as well?
column86:
11/Dec/18 2:52 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;1. We can hide it until the form is "dirty".
3. Sure, if that's what you want to do. It's a template change you can make yourself through the tool.
column87:
21/Dec/18 8:23 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Re-tested on stage.

#1 looks good, confirmed the warnings are only shown if you attempt to save with missing required fields
#2 Required is now consistent across the board.
#3 Primary image callout looks good
#4 Empty block looks good
#5 Block callout looks good
#6 save hover text looks good

All good to me, thanks for the attention to detail on this!

column1: Content Block Lookup Modal Doesn't Return Any Results

Console error:

column23:

Please move the Read Only text out of the title field to be hover text on the icon instead.

 !image-2018-12-05-08-46-42-782.png|thumbnail!
column83: 06/Dec/18 9:07 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage as svc-RadioEditQA2.  Confirmed removal of text next to the title and that the hover state of the icon is working as expected.  This looks good to me.

column1: Content Doesn't Publish The First Time
column23:
When you create a piece of content, save, and publish - the confirmation message is shown, but the content is in the draft list on the content list screen.

If you go back into that content and publish a second time, it actually goes thorugh.
column67: Content should publish the first time you go through the publish workflow, assuming you've supplied all required data points.
column79:
# Open stage content
# Create an item from a preset
# Supply title, image, and add a text block.
# Save, Publish, observe confirmation message
# Return to list view, observe content item is not shown
# Go to drafts tab, see that it's there
# Go into content and publish again
# Note that it is now showing as published in list view.
column83: 04/Dec/18 5:07 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Matt says this is already fixed
column84: 04/Dec/18 5:11 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;IHRAR-5032
column85: 06/Dec/18 9:10 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage as svc-RadioEditQA2.  Confirmed that content is now correctly publishing the first time a user attempts to publish.  This looks good to me.

Found that with all of the above, I'm both taken back to the top of the list and returned to page 1.

As noted in IHRAR-5015, when you do any of the above, the existing offset value is retained in the browser's address bar.  [~1120341], can you please confirm this is intentional?

column1: Can't Use A Preset That's Not In The Recently Used List
column23:
Found by [~ccrbdl1mje] on stage.

Presets you own or have access to are no longer usable in the tool.

If you haven't used any presets, you aren't presented with a way to choose a preset that's in the system upon creation of a new article.

if you have used presets, only the ones that you recently used are shown, there's no obvious way to use any of the others.

How can we allow users to search for/use presets that they haven't used recently/at all before?
column83: 05/Dec/18 10:24 AM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;The other presets you have permission to are accessible in a search box if you click "use different settings"
column84:
05/Dec/18 10:41 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;ah - ok.  

I think we could probably improve the UI so that it's a little more obvious that it's not just another field like the ones below it.  A number of us testing this completely missed it.  

Can we do something like this?

column23:

Can we switch the ingested icon from the current user-add to either plus or plus-circle to match the iconography used for the "new item" button (since that's what the user would do once clicking into one of these items?)

Or, is there another icon we should consider?  I just don't think Add User is the correct one.

The field (and predictive search/lookup) should show LastName, First Name - but we should continue to allow users to search by ID number if they happen to know it.

Try searching for content created by Bri Phillips:

 !image-2018-11-27-21-33-39-955.png|thumbnail!

Confirmed that you can search by both username and lastname, firstname.  Confirmed that results shown look accurate.

This looks good to me.

column1: Changing Filter Should Return You to Page 1
column23:
Originally reported that setting to Published or Not Published didn''t show any results.

[~mbrown] reported seeing this working before Thanksgiving, but upon further testing, it was still happening to me.

column1: Image aspect ratio selector is confusing
column23:
Users are going to be very confused by the new landscape/portrait/square chooser shown on the primary image field and in asset blocks.

Is this used to crop an image?  Need to clarify what these buttons are used for. Note, current front end is always 16x9, so no real reason for an editor to chose (or want to preview) portrait or square.

If this is used for preview purposes only, we need to clearly call this out with perhaps a title and maybe some help text.  And/or maybe an icon treatment instead?

From linked ticket:

{quote}Content edit - image block needs improvement (add "preview" text to thumb, explore minimizing unimportant text inputs){quote}

column1: Cleanup Streams Data That Doesn't Conform to Schema
column23:
While testing IHRAR-4903, we found a large number of circumstances where the existing data in streams did not match the new schema that was implemented, which resulted in non-descript error messages being shown to users when they attempted to save a change to the stream.

Although Alex was able to resolve some of these, the number that continued to pop up would indicate that we need to cleanup the data before we consider releasing schema to production.  

This ticket is to cleanup all existing data in the Streams tool to ensure the values stored 1) validate given the current business rules within the tool interface and 2) are consistent with what is required by the schema.

Any data that is not in the correct format should be updated.

This should be done in a way that both stage and production data can be cleaned up at the appropriate time.

column1: Quick Add shouldn't commit a LIVE version
column23: When an admin uses the quick add button it should save a stream object in RadioEdit and should show it in the stream list. Streams should not commit a "LIVE" version of the stream because it ends up going to AMP without mandatory fields. This causes AMP to error which is not good.
column67:
* Use quick add to provision a stream
* Check streams api to make sure it doesn't come through.
* Check explorer's commit history of the stream and make sure there are no commits marked as "LIVE"
column83:
20/Nov/18 9:49 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.  

Added stream 7216 via quick add.

Verified that this stream does not come in via the streams api end point.

Viewed in Explorer: http://explorer.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/smt/streams/7216

There don't appear to be any commits for this stream.  

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

[~amamut], is this expected?
column84: 20/Nov/18 9:51 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;Yes that's correct. When we quick add a "save" should occur so it should show up in the streams list. But there shouldn't be any "commits" on it, which is what happens when we accept changes. When a stream has a "commit" it is exported in the streams api which gets sent to AMP. We want to keep blank streams from going to AMP as it will error the process.
column85: 20/Nov/18 9:52 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Ok, cool - thanks.  This seems to be working as designed.  Moving to done.

Search Override tool needs homeceUrl in response
column23:
There is a radioedit tool that allows search terms to be overridden and instead return a keyword with links. My understanding is the override tool allows you to set these links. 

For example if you make this search call for "rock":
http://us.api.iheart.com/api/v3/search/all?keywords=rock&startIndex=0&maxRows=10&newSearch=false&track=true&bundle=true&artist=true&station=true&keyword=true&playlist=false&podcast=false

In the response the bestMatch would be "KEYWORDS" which looks like this:
   "keywords": [
      {
        "id": 325,
        "contentType": "link",
        "androidUrl": "ihr://goto/genre/12",
        "iphoneUrl": "ihr://goto/genre/12",
        "webUrl": "http://iheart.com/genre/rock-12/",
        "name": "Rock",
        "description": "Directory ‚Ä¢ Explore Rock on iHeartRadio",
        "imageUrl": "http://i.iheart.com/v3/re/assets/images/ca6d7e357b1578ce4c142335dc52db2a.jpg"
      }

Often these responses return a category like this web url: http://iheart.com/genre/rock-12/. This works fine for devices with screens but not for voice interactions like on Alexa which often error and would do better if the user is taken to a specific station.

We'd like add a "homeceUrl" as one of the returned parameters of the response of the keyword that could be set in the radioedit search override tool. Can we update the search override tool to accept a homeceUrl parameter?

column1: Option to Nuke On-Air Lineup
column23:
We need to think through the workflow when a station changes formats and clears house of the on-air staff.

*Example Use Case*

{quote}104.6 KISS FM is a top 40 station with Elvis Duran mornings, Jane Smith middays, Ryan Seacrest afternoons, and John Doe evenings.  The station is secretly planning to blow up the station tomorrow at 11AM; there should be no advance indication to listeners that a change is happening. Most staff members at the station will probably also be unaware that the station is being rebranded.  At 11AM on the day of the change, the station is turning into 104.6 The Bull (a country station).  Jane Smith and John Doe are laid off as they are top 40 DJs and we want them gone off the site ASAP since they are no longer in our employ.  Elvis Duran and Seacrest are still with the company, but aren't a part of the new station, so they should be gone as well.  Any reference to the KISS FM on-air schedule should be removed once 11AM hits.  The call letters of the station will remain the same after the change, so they'll continue to use the same site in Site Manager.{quote}

*Current Setup and Pain Points*

At the present, we get one dump a day from CORE that is processed during the overnight hours.  That means stations can either blank the schedule the day before (not preferred as the programmers feel it will show their hand), or deal with old station's on-air schedule continuing to be visible until the CORE import runs the next morning.

This schedule data is used to populate 1) the station homepage module, 2) the station schedule page, and 3) Flagship via WebAPI.

*Desired Functionality*

If a station changes formats at 11AM, we need the existing schedule to show until 11AM, at which time, we can go in and remove the schedule.  Realistically, if CORE can give us updates more than once a day, we'd want to show that, but in the interim, blowing out or hiding the existing data would be the way to go.

*Potential Approaches*

Do we add an option to suppress the schedule in Site Manager (where an admin would need to go turn it back on at a later date), or do we instead focus on blanking the schedule (that would remain blank until the import job next runs)?
column83: 12/Nov/18 2:40 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Groomed today.  Dumping the schedule data may be the most straight forward approach.
column84: 13/Nov/18 10:39 AM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;If the pending schedule changes are already in CORE but just not active, then this could be as simple as exposing an admin action to rebuild the schedule from the same day's dump (to pick up the newly-active entries and drop the newly-expired ones)

column1: Match Streams' schema with AMP's contract
column23:
{code:java}
case class RadioeditStream(
  id:          Int,
  streams:     StreamUrls,
  name:        String,
  description: String,
  freq:        Option[String],
  callLetters: String,
  band:        String,
  logo:        Option[String],
  provider:    String,
  cume:        Option[Cume],
  country:     String,
  isActive:    String,
  created:     Long,
  modified:    Long,
  genres:      Seq[Genre],
  markets:     Seq[Market]
)
case class StreamUrls(
  hlsStream:             Option[String],
  secureHlsStream:       Option[String],
  pivotHlsStream:        Option[String],
  shoutcastStream:       Option[String],
  secureShoutcastStream: Option[String],
  plsStream:             Option[String],
  securePlsStream:       Option[String]
)
case class Genre(
  id:        Int,
  country:   String,
  name:      String,
  sortIndex: Int,
  isPrimary: Boolean
)
case class Market(
  id:        Int,
  name:      String,
  city:      String,
  state:     String,
  stateId:   Int,
  country:   String,
  countryId: Int,
  sortIndex: Option[Int],
  cityId:    Int,
  isOrigin:  Boolean,
  isPrimary: Boolean
)
{code}

column1: Add News Checkbox To Publish Panel
column23:
As agreed with the Digital Strategy team, we're going to use a checkbox to allow authorized users to indicate whether a piece of content is "news" or not (which will dictate whether it shows up in the forthcoming news sitemaps).

To allow this, we need to add a checkbox to the publish panel in the Syndication box where a user can tag as "News Content".  Access to this checkbox should be managed in a similar way to how Apple News permissions.  

Followup tickets to this will include building a news sitemap that only includes content with this checkbox enabled... as well as potentially initiating a ping to Google upon publish to advise that new content has been added to the news sitemap.

column1: Hard code "mine" in presets for edit.
column23:
The setup is good except for the editing. Let's do an application level security patch that will show a readonly version of the preset if it's not yours.

This isn't completely secure, as it's just implemented in the app. But until application specific security gets us out of this DPD + "users" role stuff it's what we have.
column83: 13/Nov/18 2:37 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Followup from IHRAR-4869
column84:
26/Nov/18 5:58 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.  Confirmed that presets other than those created by the current user are read only.

However, noticed 2 quirks that may be outside the scope of this ticket:

1) There's currently no indication of who owns (and thus can edit) a preset.  Should we display the owner's name somewhere?

2) If a user is deactivated, the preset becomes orphaned.  Do we need to consider a system to purge presets that are owned by a user who's no longer with the company?  Or a way to transfer ownership of a preset?

I will review the above with [~tlong] and [~mbrown] after code jam.
column85:
28/Nov/18 2:51 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;#2 we will skip for now.

#1 I see no reason why we should restrict the author of the preset. Let's show it on the list/edit screens.

column1: Playlists Locked for National Users Upon Creation
column23: There's a bug in the permission system on playlists where a national editor can't immediately edit a playlist they just created without doing a hard refresh of the page.  Seems to be this is caused by the use of the "resource" tag to signify that a playlist can be editable by national admins... but you can't actually apply that tag in the editors field.
column67: # A national editor should be able to immediately edit a playlist they just created without having to refresh the page.
column79:
# Login to playlist stage
# Create a new playlist supplying required fields.  Do not set any editors.  Save.
# Observe on main playlist the newly created playlist is locked.
# Hard refresh the browser and observe the playlist is unlocked

My initial tests were not successful, with a local user (QA2) being able to edit a playlist created by a national user (QA3) with no specific editor tags applied.  This does not seem to be working.
column91:
15/Jan/19 8:49 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Alex and I took a look at this. Created http://playlists.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/playlists/playlist/%2F5c3de2a411b55c94af6c516b as QA3 which is a super user

Seeing all sorts of unexpected editor tags appear here:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Since this playlist was created by a super user, it should have whatever tag allows super users to edit everything (Providers/Playlist Admin?) and any other tags that may have been applied by the user at time of creation/update.  I don't understand where all these other tags are coming from or what their significance is.
column92:
15/Jan/19 11:49 AM;YehudaRosen@iheartmedia.com;For these two particular users, one is listed as a member_of another - http://auth.radioedit.ihrint.com/api/principals/user/ldap/svc-RadioEditQA3 - which is (one reason) why QA2 can edit QA3's playlist.

The AC in this particular ticket should be met, but I changed the order of operations when a playlist is saved so all those tags are visible in the editors field. We should look into removing this in favor of using actual taxonomy terms (e.g. brands, providers, etc) but as a quick workaround, would this logic work?

1) Playlist Admin users can read & edit anything
2) Everyone else can read everything, but only edit playlists they created
2a) I might be able to improve the editors field logic so that multiple people could be added without the other stuff, but I'm not sure how reliable that is without trying it out
column93:
15/Jan/19 3:48 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;1 looks correct
2 seems different than the editor tagging that's in leads/content (and has been the focus of all the tickets related to this work).  I'd really like this to match the brand/provider tag setup that our users and support team are accustomed to.
2a sounds problematic given the discussions we had around content presets and dpd's having the user permission so they could delegate permission to their staff (eg, a dpd would be able to edit any/all playlists that has anything from the user namespace tagged on it)
column94: 16/Jan/19 10:34 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;From what [~1113313] has told me the primary AC of this ticket has been addressed and deployed to stage. column1: Enable Author Permissions By User
column23:
Right now, author permissions are controlled via the editor tag which requires you to use a brand.

I suspect we need some additional granularity to allow permission by ldap user, so that for sites with a large number of editors (eg. Default) users can only use appropriate author tags.

Would want to make sure that this permission both applies to editing the author profile - as well as using the author tag within an article.

This is likely blocked by the app level permission improvements.
column83: 29/Mar/19 11:39 AM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;Might want to spike this. While it would be easy to allow user selection in the editors box, that would apply to all content types.
column84: 29/Mar/19 11:43 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;I think this is blocked by IHRAR-4580

column1: Adswizz Tool: Error upon Activation of Stream
column23:
Before we launch stations, we activate them here: http://adswizz.radioedit.iheart.com/#/

It seems that new streams are not being activating and returning an error (attached). I can manually create the HLS url given i know the naming conventions, but we'll need the activation functionality to work eventually. In the case where we launch a new broadcast stream, we'll need it. For digital stations I don't believe we serve ads on them, so the HLS url manually created should still work. 

Saw this today on ID: 7938
column79:
1. Search a stream ID in Adswizz Tool - in this case it's 7938
2. Check the activation box
3. Click Activate on Ccarp11
4. Error message will appear (blank)
5. Stream will not activate

Greg currently has a workaround to get us by until AdsWizz gets back to us.  We'll need someone to reach out to Alex D about this.

column1: Author Tag Field Persists Last Value Which Then Disappears
column23:
Not sure how this is supposed to work, but seems a bit wonky.

When you first create an article, the most recent author tag you used is available to select - but upon clicking elsewhere it disappears and never returns.

See attached video.

Is the previously used author value intentionally shown that it should always be available - or should we make that disappear?

API documentation:  http://docs.adswizz.com/domain-api/v2/

column23:
The collection block in Site Manager should support path variables so that content can be selected dynamically based on what the variable is.

This is a requirement of Coast category pages which lists content in a particular category (collection).

column1: Saving after a Publish followed by Unpublish throws out of date errors
column23:
If you publish a piece of content, unpublish it, and attempt to save the app thinks the content is out of date.
The mtime the server pulls when it checks is different from what's sent after an unpublish.

column1: Use new UI kit
column23:
We've always maintained a collection of UI widgets. Over time these things get out of sync, produce bugs and in general they are not maintained in the same fashion as the rest of the system. Recently, with changes from folks in the Angular community a few new UI kits are mature enough to handle all of our needs. We should use one of these new UI kits to skin the content app, separating it as a truly next-gen application.

Ng-Zorro, for the record.
https://ng.ant.design/docs/introduce/en
column83: 14/Nov/18 3:10 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Closing without product review.  To be reviewed once the UI Kit work is complete via full regression test.

column1: Add fieldsets to template editor
column23:
Right now you can group by fields with tabs. In addition to tabs, we need an inline option so that users can visually focus on particular sections of the form to help with clarity. The inline option we could call "fieldsets", it's a very common practice to do in forms. 

The blue flag we added to many labels as sort of a hack/compromise to get out of doing fieldsets. When the addition of fieldsets I think dropping the blue flag is appropriate.

column1: Improve Image Block with Aspect Ratio support
column23: The image block should enable the author to preview the image from mediaserver at particular common aspect ratios. Landscape, portrait and square. Right now it's very difficult to teams to know exactly how their media will look on the page. Further, the asset block *template* config should enable defaulting to a particular aspect ratio.

column1: Ingestion app token not valid for auto-publish app on stage
column23:
I was ingesting some content to the stage server using the content-xml-ingest app's token and I was successful up until I tried to use it for the auto-publish step at https://content.radioedit.ihrint.com/api/v1/create/article/from-ingest

The response from the call to that URL was 
"detail": {
        "status": "Forbidden",
        "code": 403,
        "reason": "{\"action\":\"read\",\"code\":403,\"membership\":[\"resource\",\"brands\",\"brands/COAST-PR (15194)\"],\"observers\":[{\"mem\":\"apps/content-xml-ingest\",\"cap\":\"sys:app-client\"},{\"mem\":\"apps/content\",\"cap\":\"content:auto-publish\"},{\"mem\":\"keywords\"}],\"reason\":\"Unable to obtain the required access\",\"text\":\"Forbidden\"}"
    }

so it seems like the content-xml-ingest app's token is not valid for that API but it should be.

column1: Spike: Define schema for Stream's apis, and create validation tests that are run each release
column23:
We've had four or five instances since the Streams tool was released where the schema was changed in ways that broke the consumer jobs.

Right now this is being handled informally and causing a lot of work for development and anyone that relies on the live station data to work.

This ticket is to formally define the schema that Streams will present in whatever manner is best, and create tests that will be run before changes are made to Streams in the future.

column1: Genre image showFUX and showDirectory are flipped

In new Streams for genres:

Secondary -> showFUX flag

New Streams tool should represent the genre data the way old SMT did.

column1: Return a 400 on slug conflict (autopublish)

Slug conflict is a user error. The autopublish endpoint should be catching user errors and returning the appropriate status code (and not reporting the error to Sentry)

column1: Presets Need To Be Locked Down
column23:
If a user goes into the Presets screen in content tool, they can see, edit, and delete everyone else's presets.

How can we update this so a user can only see, edit, and delete their own presets?

Perhaps related, but when a local user creates a new content item, they see everyone's presets.  Should those be locked down to only the current user's?

Login as this user on stageto see what's happening:
svc-radioeditqa2
Welcome1
column83: 25/Oct/18 2:17 PM;AdamRoberts@iheartmedia.com;This is the security behavior already built in to the content tool. Each user should only have access (via bucket policy) to their own presets and those of their delegates. Due to a misconfiguration of the bucket policy on stage and the fact that svc-radioeditqa2 has the "DPD" role, which contains the "users" membership, svc-radioeditqa2 has full access to all user presets. The bucket policy has been corrected, and removing "users" from DPD or using a non-DPD user for testing should result in the correct behavior.
column84: 29/Oct/18 9:40 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrbdl1mje] do you know if there's a specific reason we still need to have "users" available in the DPD role?
column85: 29/Oct/18 10:59 AM;MarkEscott@iheartmedia.com;That was so local DPDs can grant appropriate memberships and app access for other employees (both in and out of market).
column86: 30/Oct/18 8:33 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrnyc2msw] It sounds like this is working as intended.
column87:
30/Oct/18 8:47 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;I don't know if I'm sold on this.  As MarkE said, we need the users permission on the DPD role so that those users can delegate permissions in the Users app, however that's causing them to be able to see more templates than they should be able to in the content tool.  

To my knowledge, this is the only instance of a tool other than Users managing permissions at the user level within a tool.    

Is there another way we could tag a template to be available to "everyone" without having to expose the users namepsace?
column88: 30/Oct/18 9:37 AM;AdamRoberts@iheartmedia.com;Not to my knowledge. There are no tags that "everyone" has. We can certainly make one, but it will need to be added to each user who wants to use it. Perhaps you could tag it with the content app's tag? Each user will have to have that to access the content tool.
column89:
30/Oct/18 9:42 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Seems this is only an issue if a user other than " authenticated" is selected.  Would it be worth exploring only allowing authenticated to be the only user selectable (and all templates not for general use tied to a provider or brand that is only available to sysadms?

Or, do we look to tie templates into a capability similar to what we've done for individual fields within the tool? Maybe one for general use and another for limited/sysadmin?
column90: 30/Oct/18 9:53 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Do users *need* to be able to edit or delete other users' presets at all? Can we just limit presets to the current user instead of inheriting through ownership?
column91: 30/Oct/18 9:56 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrbdl1mje] may have an opinion here.  I suspect there are cases where a user's manager may be creating presets on their behalf - but unsure how critical that functionality is.
column92: 30/Oct/18 10:14 AM;MarkEscott@iheartmedia.com;I would expect presets access to be based on the brand tag in the editors field for those presets. I wouldn't want to remove 'users' permissions from local DPDs otherwise they would no longer be able to manage their local team permissions.
column93: 30/Oct/18 11:11 AM;AdamRoberts@iheartmedia.com;Just as an aside, "managing team permissions" is why delegates exist in the user system. "Users" gives access to the whole user catalog.
column94: 30/Oct/18 11:15 AM;MarkEscott@iheartmedia.com;yeah, the idea of delegates is good, but in practice has never worked great. when new hires came in we 'support' had to add the user as a delegate before they could manage. adding permission to all 'users' allows for more efficient self service.
column95: 30/Oct/18 11:59 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Per [~tlong], I'm just going to add a filter that allows users to limit their view of presets to the ones they created.
column96: 30/Oct/18 1:41 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Can it show the individaul user's presets by default (eg. if they want to see someone else's, they have to specifically request them?)
column97: 30/Oct/18 1:44 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;I can put that quick filter in the nav bar in the left hand nav so it is the default list view. They would have to select "All presets" from the dropdown to see all of them.

Confirmed that as a SysAdmin, I can edit anyone's presets. *{color:#14892c}GOOD{color}*

column1: Copied Content Isn't Treated As A New Item
column23:
When a user hits the Copy button in content tool, it clones the existing item into a new record.

There are several data points that are currently persisted from the original that should not be:

# Canonical/permalink
# Slug
# Created Date/user
# Published Date/user
# Start/End Dates
# Server Save timestamp from original content item

column1: Spike: Find a Better Way to Organize National Channels on iHeart
column23:
Each/most countries on iHeartRadio have a library of national channels that are available nationwide.

At the moment, we create a dummy digital market for each country (eg. CA-NAT, US-NAT, AU-NAT, etc) and set the primary/origin market to this market so that we can populate a page in Flagship that showcases all these streams, such as https://www.iheart.com/live/country/US/city/digital-nat-575/

Unfortunately, new Streams tool which is powered by ISO-sourced markets isn't conducive to this as there's no market called "Digital", so we have to make up a fake one... rinse and repeat for each new country we launch in.

How can we change things up to designate a stream as being national for a particular country without having to create a dummy market?

End goal would be to be able to generate a page organized something like http://iheart.com/originals where we return all national streams for a given country with some ability to sort by genre.
column83: 23/Oct/18 9:26 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Idea... in the markets module, add a "National Channel" checkbox that precludes the need to set a primary and origin market.  Then, create a new end point that would allow a query of only national channels.  We'd still want to be able to supply additional markets so that the streaming ops team can backfill markets that don't have enough local streams.
column84:
23/Oct/18 9:33 AM;GregCerchione@iheartmedia.com;I like the idea of this, but we would want to still use origin market to be sure of where the station is housed.and where the broadcast playout is. i.e, Origin Market for iHeart80's is New York, NY given it's on WLTW-HD2. 

I like the collection of iHeartRadio Originals as an area inside the markets tab, perhaps above all of the markets in general, but we'd still want origin in play.
column85:
23/Oct/18 9:41 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;iHeart80s currently has DIGITAL-NAT set as both the primary and origin markets:

http://stream-manager.radioedit.iheart.com/#/stream/edit/5060
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
column86: 23/Oct/18 9:45 AM;GregCerchione@iheartmedia.com;Correct, It's on my roadmap to change all of those values for Digital Channels.

column1: Solve for iHeart.com Artist Tag Requirements
column23:
iHeart.com visually displays the keyword artist tags on a content item at the bottom of page (linked to the artist profiles).

in the new content tool, we removed the ability to tag an artist in the keyword field (in favor of keeping all artist tagging in the Distribution section to eliminate the need for users to tag an artist twice (which was a big source of confusion)

We need to devise a way for iHeart.com to be continue to display artist tags via the keywords field in the old tool - and the distribution tag in the new tool.  

If we can solve for this on the RadioEdit side, we should do the work against this ticket.  If there are Web changes required, ticket and get on their radar.
column82:
http://content.radioedit.iheart.com/#/edit/597ca3ad27673e2ab9bba520?from_list=network

https://www.iheart.com/content/2017-07-29-live-nation-wants-to-ban-bootleg-merch-at-coldplay-concert/

http://webapi.radioedit.iheart.com/graphiql/?query=%7B%0A%20%20content%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20slug%28slug%3A%20%222017-07-29-live-nation-wants-to-ban-bootleg-merch-at-coldplay-concert%22%29%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20payload%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20keywords%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%7D%0A%7D%0A
column83: 23/Oct/18 8:19 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Should we pass any artist tagged in distribution into keywords in WebAPI?  Would we need to de-dupe to solve for legacy articles that have the artist tagged both in distribution and in keywords?
column84:
29/Oct/18 5:23 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrnyc2msw] Is this a reasonable reproduction test case? http://content.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/content/%2F5bd77970467677e69a16d110

First, you can absolutely add an artist tag in the keyword field. Are you wanting artist distributions to show up in the keywords field? Is that the goal?
column85:
30/Oct/18 8:10 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;One of the national editorial team's major pain points in the old tool was having to tag artists twice, so the artist namespace was omitted from the keywords field in favor of the distribution field.

How can we engineer this so users only have to tag an artist in one location, and use that tag to power both distribution to artist profiles and the topic tag shown on the content detail pages?

Re: example above, yes, that's a legit test case, except that the editor shouldn't have to tag the artist on 2 different screens.
column86: 30/Oct/18 8:35 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Then they should only tag artists in distribution, and we should legitimately remove artists from keywords. Do you still want me to combine artists in distribution with the rest of the keywords returned by webapi, though?
column87: 30/Oct/18 8:39 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Namespaces are template-controlled, so I removed the artists namespace from the article template in dev.
column88:
30/Oct/18 8:44 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Correct.  Now we need a way for a user who has permission to artists to be able to tag only in the distribution box, but populate the keywords field in webapi with those tagged artists so that the link to the artist profile is shown at the bottom of the body.

Example:

http://content.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/content/%2F5ba24303b9877bbc2669affd

^^ This is tagged with only an artist distribution tag

https://www.iheart.com/artist/cage-the-elephant-117804/?configOverride={%22radioEdit%22:{%22webGraphQlApi%22:%22https://webapi.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/graphql%22}}

^^ This is showing up no problem on the artist page because the distribution tag is used to populate this page

https://www.iheart.com/content/2018-09-19-artist-tag-test-on-new-content-tool?configOverride={%22radioEdit%22:{%22webGraphQlApi%22:%22https://webapi.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/graphql%22}}

^^ No topic tag/link to artist page is shown on the detail page since that currently keys off of the keywords value in WebAPI.
column90: 30/Oct/18 12:32 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;I think I can solve this by adding a new calculated field to the payload called artists, and grabbing any artists from either keywords or distribution. Waiting to hear back from [~1114558] on if non-artist keywords are used in iheart.com anywhere.
column91: 30/Oct/18 12:38 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;[~1114558] said they do use keywords for metadata besides artists, and that they also already have code to limit keywords to the artists namespace in places where they provide links to artist pages. It sounds like the ideal solution is to just add artists from distribution into the keywords field in webapi.
column92:

column1: SSL generation for all vanity domains
column23:
Steps:
1. Prune "vanity" list to a manageable list, we have an insane number of domains in site manager. If we could get it to sub 1000 that would be helpful.

2. Create a scriptable solution that generates, and renew, certificates using Let's Encrypt. This will require an understanding of the ACME protocol and how to validate the domains.

3. Output nginx configuration using SNI and TLS certificates setup for all domains. The only function of Nginx will be to terminate the TLS connection and issue a redirect.

4. Host nginx config within RadioEdit platform

5. Script dyndns updates to all domains so that we can point them to the appropriate A records.


SRE ([~1118371]) will need to be involved to insure a static IP access and other basic infrastructure requirements.
column83: 29/Oct/18 3:13 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Could we start with one ssl vanity domain per site while leaving the others to redirect non-secure?  If so, I would go with whichever the subdomain is (eg. z100.iheart.com -> www.z100.com and/or z100.com)
column84: 01/Nov/18 12:09 PM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;All current vanity domains (and script to print them): https://gist.github.com/mattucf/164b03bd2448bd29013d1952931b0a5b

column1: Option to limit asset types in asset fields [template]
column23:
We previously implemented the ability to specify which type of asset can be accpeted into each block type by group (eg. image/video/audio/document).  However, we've seen some instances with images where users are uploading stuff they're not supposed to:

# Users are uploading HUGE animated GIF images that are killing load time on the user-facing pages since we don't touch them with MediaServer
# A few users have uploaded WEBP images which is fine in supported browsers/devices, but shows nothing on unsupported ones - such as MS Outlook.

Can we get more granular with allowed/disallowed mimetypes per block so we can prevent the above?
column83: 24/Oct/18 3:34 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Thinking this might be post-MVP.  Only sysadmins can supply an external URL, and the number of users who upload audio/video/document content is minimal.
column84: 16/Apr/19 12:24 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Updated this ticket to focus on a few specific problem mimetypes since the top level audio/video/document/image functionality was implemented via another ticket.

column1: Resolve memberships for permission checks
column23:
In order for the permission hierarchy to work, we have to resolve the editor tags and include their member_of lists in the permission checks. We could do this at save time and store the expansion (which would require a migration), or resolve the tags whenever a security question happens.

This might be a good time to clean up the annotation/map code, esp. if we go the route of adding yet another async annotation step.
column82: To test this, select a particular market and create a few articles tied to individual stations in that market (in the editors list). Then grant the market (and not the stations) to a test user, and they should be able to edit those same articles.  On removal of the market, the user should no longer be able to edit the articles.

Removed the market access and found that the user was no longer able to deep link to an article.

So it seems we're in good shape on the actual article edit screen... we just need to figure out what's going on with content not showing up in list view.

I re-added the above 3 markets to svc-radioeditqa2 for troubleshooting purposes.
column85:
30/Oct/18 2:24 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Discussed with Matt on HipChat.  The issue i found above was related to the search index being behind.  Now that it's caught up, I see the 3 articles as qa2 no problem.

This looks good to me.

column1: Implement continuation token for streams api
column23: Streams API currently outputs all data at once which is taxing on RadioEdit as a whole. We want to switch the API to use a continuation token so that AMP can continue getting the next items in the list.
column67: Streams API accepts a continuation token in a query param to get the next page of items. The token will be in the response of the previous request.
column82:
[8:03 AM] Mike Woodruff: i see the example link in the comments, but am not sure what the continuation token there looks like.‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇcan you point me in the right direction?
[8:03 AM] Alex Mamut: It‚Äôs in the response of the request
[8:04 AM] Alex Mamut: It‚Äôs the next field.
[8:04 AM] Alex Mamut: You add &next= and put the token at the end
[8:04 AM] Alex Mamut: And it will get the next batch of items.
column83:
18/Oct/18 10:12 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;Example URL:
https://stream-manager.radioedit.ihrint.com/api/v3/streams?country=US
column84: 19/Oct/18 8:16 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;[~amamut] to create the AMP followup ticket for this - then I'll send over to that team to review in context.
column85: 19/Oct/18 8:51 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;AMP ticket: AGILEAMP-3840.  Discussing with [~mwalden] on HipChat.
column86:
19/Oct/18 8:57 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;[8:52 AM] Marcel Walden: i dunno when we could get it into one of our sprints but it very much is doable
[8:52 AM] Marcel Walden: that would be more of a laurent question
[8:52 AM] Marcel Walden: yah. nothing game changing that i can see going on.

column1: Search Override: Integrate with new AMP API instead of elastic
column23: The old tool manipulates items in elastic directly. AMP is currently working on an API to use instead and this should be used for the new version of the tool.

column1: Search-Override: Upgrade front end to Material / ng-zorro
column23: Use Material and ng-zorro module to build out the new front end of the app.

column1: Search-Override: Convert from JS to new toolset
column23: Rewrite Search Override tool from old JS to our new toolset: TS, yarn, NG6.

column1: SPIKE: Discuss how to validate and regression test ALL API endpoints
column23: Using JSON Schema perhaps, test system, config, proxy? What do we do?
column83:
24/Oct/18 4:21 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;Provide a service of some sort that can collection schema and validation information and either host, proxy or delegate to either json-rpc or graphql.

Should support documentation generation. Validation. Etc.
column84: 14/Nov/18 3:07 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Closing without product review.  To be reviewed once the UI Kit work is complete via full regression test.

Mike to supply initial list of what's needed on a track and playlist level.

In general, could be redone in 2-3 sprints without much hassle.

column1: Facebook Video On Apple News
column23: As a content writer, i want Facebook videos that I post in the content tool to be displayed in Apple News so that users who read my content on the Apple platform can see the videos that I reference in my story.
column67:
# Review of the Facebook video examples listed in the comments below in the context of their compatibility with Apple News
# List of which video types are supported
# List of which video types are not supported with explanation of why.
column83: 15/Oct/18 4:31 PM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;We're going to need samples of video URLs that work and that don't. It's surprising that any do work.
column84:
07/Dec/18 1:05 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;There are two ways that a user can get a video from Facebook:

*1) Copy video page URL.* Example: https://www.facebook.com/humanesocietydelta/videos/790653437932698/

Content Example: http://content.radioedit.ihrint.com/content/%2F5c0aaca9f6ab124537504b9b

In content tool, this seems to return a validation error:

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

*2) Embed code (under the ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢¬†menu).*  Example:

{code:java}
<iframe src="https://www.facebook.com/plugins/video.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fhumanesocietydelta%2Fvideos%2F790653437932698%2F&show_text=0&width=560" width="560" height="315" style="border:none
column85: 11/Dec/18 1:06 PM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;It's clear from the screenshots that we need to do better with the error reporting on the syndication feature. It looks like the first example should show a warning (because the provider from ohembed is "Facebook Video"), but doesn't. The other two warnings are correct: an arbitrary iframe paste into ohembed is not publishable to Apple News.  If their m.facebook hack actually works, I'd need to see an example article that illustrates it.
column86:
11/Dec/18 1:28 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Update... seems if a facebook video is part of a post... and you embed the post itself... it'll validate and show on Apple News no problem.

{quote}Matt Berger [1:09 PM]
Have a sec?

Take a look at https://content.radioedit.iheart.com/#/edit/5c0add847ed3541208004b10?from_list=network
Paul sent that as an example of the Facebook embed that works for Apple News ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a video that‚Äôs part of a POST and the POST is what‚Äôs being embedded. That is accepted.
So that‚Äôs the missing piece.

Mike Woodruff [1:10 PM]
excellent

Matt Berger [1:10 PM]
Embedding the video directly - doesn‚Äôt work. Embedding the video as part of a post, that‚Äôs their trick to get it to work.

Mike Woodruff [1:10 PM]
any chance you can get the value Lauryn used to add that in here?  I can add that to the ticket

Matt Berger [1:10 PM]
Once you‚Äôve seen the example, I want to remove the duplicate from the page.
Yes, I‚Äôll add it to my sample article

Mike Woodruff [1:10 PM]
sweet

Matt Berger [1:10 PM]
https://www.facebook.com/108997452563/posts/2158809157781239
facebook.com
After MidNite
Toby Keith & Cody Alan Can Toast To That! Watch:

Mike Woodruff [1:11 PM]
so just putting that URL into the embed block?

Matt Berger [1:15 PM]
Yes, using the direct URL to the post in the embed block. I just added it to my sample page for safe keeping. We‚Äôll see it once the cache clears. https://matt.iheart.com/content/2018-09-19-testing-facebook-embeds/{quote}
column87:
21/Dec/18 8:52 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Reviewed with Matt Brown extensively on Slack.  The issue is indeed that Apple does not support a straight up video embed, but does support when included in a post.  We've significantly improved the Apple News validation messaging to call out that this is not supported and steer users to include the video in a post- and then use that post in the article as an embed block.

In the course of this ticket, we also significantly humanized all the Apple News-related validation messages.  

At the moment, the Apple News options are not appearing on my test article (http://content.radioedit.ihrint.com/content/5c1ce8d76e37ceac11d26236) - Reached out to [~1119767] to see if anything's wonky.
column88:
21/Dec/18 8:52 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Mark Cahill [8:51 AM]
{quote}found a solution. if you kick it back, I‚Äôll put a PR up.{quote}
column89: 21/Dec/18 2:42 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;See linked subtask for exact error conditions to be tested.
column90: 02/Jan/19 3:12 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Ok, this is looking good.  Tested via the sub task all the Apple News errors - and with the exception of a missing title on the Scheduled blocks errors that will be resolved via IHRAR-5105, this looks good to me.

column1: Troubleshoot/Fix Getty Metadata
column23: As a content editor, I want to be able to upload an image in downloaded from Getty Images and have the appropriate metadata automatically extracted and shown to users so that I don't have to re-type information about the photo.
column67:
# Metadata embedded in a Getty photo should propagate to the asset record upon upload to either assets or asset selector.
# Metadata associated to an asset record should propagate to the appropriate fields in a content tool asset or gallery block
# Metadata applied to an asset or gallery content block should be furnished to all front end clients
column83:
18/Oct/18 4:39 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Four example images uploaded - two editorial and two royalty free.

Uploaded one into the asset tool, no metadata visible.  

I would expect the following mapping to occur when an asset is ingested:

Title << Headline
Caption << Caption/Description
Tags << Keywords
Source Credit << Creator
Agency << Provider

From there, once an asset is inserted into the content tool, I'd expect the following mapping:

Gallery Block:  

Title: Title
Alt Text: Title
Caption: Caption

Asset Block:

Title: Title
column84:
06/Dec/18 4:40 PM;AdamRoberts@iheartmedia.com;Uploading the first demo image into asset selector on dev seemed to produce the correct behavior. 

http://mediaserver.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/v3/re/new_assets/5c099601dfb79b721fc7335f?metadata=1

*EDIT:* After opening the photo in photoshop, there does appear to be some additional ITPC data not being returned by mediaserver. Warrants further investigation.
column85: 06/Dec/18 4:42 PM;AdamRoberts@iheartmedia.com; !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
column86:
21/Dec/18 10:58 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;My testing has focused on the Asset Selector which is what most of our editors use to upload images.

When upload to Asset Selector, none of the Getty-provided metadata included in the image is inserted into content... nor when I lookup the asset in the Asset tool itself:

 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

http://content.radioedit.iheart.com/#/edit/5c1d0ce71c0780a604f65397

column89: 26/Mar/19 12:14 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;For clarity, the metadata DOES seem to be making it to Assets... it's just not coming over to Content Tool.

Since the Assets side of this is working as expected, we're going to create a followup ticket for the Content side so that can be handled by the team that regularly works on the content tool.  See IHRAR-5484.

Moving this one to done.

column1: Spike: Discuss AMP Playlist Issues
column23: Need to spend some time with the AMP team to capture and prioritize the issues they're seeing with playlist data.  We'll ticket the requested changes to be worked on next sprint.
column83:
31/Oct/18 1:09 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;The problem is that there are multiple "masters" of this data. RadioEdit, as the curation tool should be the source of record.

The MAIN change we would like involves remote ID generation.

Right now we publishing a draft to AMP get am AMP generated id so that we can keep it in sync with AMP collections. We should instead generate ids on our own with AMP consuming them.

Will need to loop in MattF or Laurent.
column84: 31/Oct/18 2:05 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Followup ticket: IHRAR-4924

column1: Update Stale Mexico State Data
column23:
*1)  MX-DIF -> MX-CMX*

In 2016, Federal District became Mexico City.  Our state records in Taxo/Streams seem to be out of date.

How can we get this state updated to be the correct value so it's ready for the Mexico launch next week?

Old state in Taxo: http://taxonomy.radioedit.iheart.com/#/states/MX-DIF

Market using that state in streams: http://stream-manager.radioedit.iheart.com/#/market/edit/563


*2) MX-MEX*

Our Mexico partner has asked that the "M√©xico" +state+ be shown as "Estado de M√©xico"

http://taxonomy.radioedit.iheart.com/#/states/MX-MEX

This doesn't seem to match what's in https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:code:3166:MX, but i do see it reflected in other places online.
column67:
# Anywhere Mexico City (state) is shown in the flagship apps, the state should be MX-CMX/Ciudad de M√©xico
# Anywhere Mexico (state) is shown in the flagship apps, the state display name should be Estado de M√©xico"

Streams tagged with markets in these states should continue to be available to users.

column1: Invalid Date On Calendar Events Causes Event Pages To Not Display Any Data
column23:
Calendar event pages are not displaying any events when an entry's start date is defaulting to 0. 

We have not been able to determine a cause. 

I've fixed this particular example but I've taken screenshots. 

Reference error below. 

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/khayden/Sites/RadioEdit/fire/lib/radioedit/resolve.py", line 179, in resolve_item
    item.resolved = await Resolver(**data).resolve(self.site, view_name=self.view_name, block_id=item.id, path=self.path, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/khayden/Sites/RadioEdit/fire/lib/radioedit/resolvers/events.py", line 114, in resolve
    result["events"] = self.get_display_date(result["events"])
  File "/Users/khayden/Sites/RadioEdit/fire/lib/radioedit/resolvers/events.py", line 89, in get_display_date
    if item["startDateTime"].date() < now.date():
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'date'
column59: 10/Oct/18 1:47 PM;ccrnyc1jxe;Find Top Events  Concerts   Shows in Chicago  IL   BIG 95 5.png;https://jira.ihrint.com/secure/attachment/170942/Find+Top+Events++Concerts+++Shows+in+Chicago++IL+++BIG+95+5.png
column67:
Both start and end date should be validated to m/d/yyyy and should not allow you to save unless its in that format.
End date should be after start date.
This should be true for both new and existing events.
column79: Have not been able to reproduce
column83: 15/Oct/18 9:49 AM;TrinaKing@iheartmedia.com;This is a AR (Calendar Tool) ticket. Moving.
column84: 23/Oct/18 9:01 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Test instructions please.
column85:
26/Oct/18 10:58 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.  Confirmed that for the first occurrence a m/d/yyyy format is enforced and that an error is shown and save blocked until the date is set correctly.  Confirmed that the calendar chooser uses the correct date format.

However, tested the date field in the Recurrence Schedule box and found that it does not have the same error message shown to users.  The box does outline in red, but users should be shown the same Invalid Date format messaging. 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Can we add that in please?
column86: 29/Oct/18 9:15 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Re-tested on stage.  I'm now getting the message on all the date fields.  This looks good to me.

column1: Add Auditor/Viewer Role in Streams
column23:
Various iHeartRadio staff members have a need to see what's in the STreams tool - but not make any changes to it.

We should explore creating a limited permission role or capability for the tool that allows users to see everything but change nothing.

Unsure if this can be done globally - or if we should build support to only see certain countries/providers.

column1: Remove Character Restriction On Stream Names
column23:
I must've missed this in staging, but we have some streams that have this in the name, and will likely have others

We'll need to also add characters used by other languages. We have many streams that have other characters on top of the letters. Can we just remove the character inclusion logic here? There should still be a limit of the number of characters, but I don't think we can tackle all of the characters
column67:
# Users should be able to type any character into the "Station Name" field of a stream
# 30 character count should remain in place
column84:
12/Oct/18 10:27 AM;GregCerchione@iheartmedia.com;I can't think of any character that would cause some sort of Error in AMP or the clients wouldn't be able to read. I think the problem initially was we wanted to restrict it to characters that wouldn't cause problems for smart speakers/Home CE clients. With the addition of pronouncements and eventual work from that team to integrate pronouncements with their clients, we should be ok. 

Note that there are certain MX streams (~10) that have foreign characters in the name, and I can't update the format on those stations (related to Ads work) until we figure this one out. 

Thanks!
column85: 12/Oct/18 11:17 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;This has been updated and deployed to production.

column1: Streams: Royalty Alias Uniqueness should only be matched against active streams
column23:
In Streams, there is logic to present an error when there is a duplicate royalty alias entered. It seems like the logic is checking against inactive streams, which is a problem when there are older streams that were using a certain royalty alias. 

All of our special event channels are played out on specific -HD2 channels, and we reuse those values many times.
column83: 11/Oct/18 2:54 PM;TrinaKing@iheartmedia.com;Looks good in stage. Able to save royalty alias on an active station that is in use by an inactive station.

column1: Streams: Stream Alias and Royalty Alias should be searchable parameters
column23:
It seems as if when I search by stream alias i.e, (IEVN, IEVN-FL), or Royalty Alias (WMRR-HD2, etc) streams doesn't return any results. 

This is particularly important when finding old streams that were used on these locations and grabbing the ESID, among other retroactive actions.

column84:
17/Jan/19 1:28 PM;KrishnaGlick@iheartmedia.com;After investigating it appears block scheduling is broken.
Will require greater investigation as to why, and how to fix.
column85:
29/Jan/19 8:22 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.

Added a timed custom html module to http://site-manager.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/brands/microsite/8e8115b449cdc3b534b05447144bc53a/Imported/pages/detail

Set start date to 1/1/19 and end date to 1/30/19.  Saved.

Reloaded page, found that the specified start/end dates did not survive a save and reverted to starting now and ending never.

This doesn't appear to be working as expected.  

For this ticket to pass, I expect to see:
# I can set a start/end date/time and it survives a save
# I can change a start/end date and the change survives a save
# I can change to starts now/ends never and it survives a save
# I can delete the block and the delete persists after a save.

column1: Clean up bad ingest data in the mapper
column23:
Ingestion data is corrupted because the ingestion API doesn't enforce any validation. In order to conform to the proto definition for the data, convert all boolean-esque data to true booleans in the mapper. This should allow the following article preview to load: http://content.radioedit.ihrint.com/feeds/content%2Fozy-latest-updates-are-you-ready-to-do-the-time-with-an-ex-con-fitness-trainer

See ontent/src/server/api/adapters/ingest.ts lines 84.

column1: Searchd is missing the default-mapping setup
column23:
During a refactor in 2016, we missed a piece of code in search that sets up an "index template" in elastic search to provide proper mappings for all common metadata fields. This wasn't noticed until we switched elasticsearch clusters recently, and the default mapping was missing.

Add SetDefaultMapping() back to searchd.

column1: Streams: Create Ability to Localize Genre Picker Choices
column23:
POST-MVP not a streams blocker

Ideally, we'd like to be able to manually curate the genres that we choose for international. For example, if Mexico wants 80's and 90's hits to show up in their genre picker, we should be able to do that. The current state is that since it exists in directory for US/MX, we'd have to add it to the genre picker in both countries. 

Something on the UI would be like this: 

US - Show in FUX, Show in Directory
MX - Show in FUX, Show in Directory
CA - Show in FUX, Show in Directory 

etc 

This will make genre curation easier for international partners.

column1: Text Block Adjacent to an Embed Go Blank

column1: "Evergreen" Terminonlogy on publish panel is confusing users
column23:
In 2 of my 5 demos, users have had trouble understanding the "This content is evergreen" checkbox on the publish panel.  

I believe the confusion stems from their SEO training where they've been instructed to write "evergreen" content that remains culturally relevant weeks, months, or years after it was created.

Rather than completely re-working the publish dates module, thinking a copy change might do the trick.  Can we try "Live Immediately" instead?
column83: 15/Oct/18 4:59 PM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;It's not just live immediately. It also doesn't expire.
column84:
18/Oct/18 9:01 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on dev.  Looks good.

[~mbrown], noted.

column1: Feed List Date Sort By Chooser
column23: As a national content editor, i want the feeds list in Content Tool to have the option to sort by publish or ingest date so that I can quickly locate the content I want to publish to our network.
column67:
# Ability to choose whether content is sorted by publication date (from source) or ingestion date
# Same visual presentation to the chooser found in the Content list view
# Default to publication date.
column83: 08/Oct/18 3:43 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.  Confirmed that the chooser has been added to the filters panel and that it does change the sort order.  Observed that the published date is shown regardless of which date type is chosen - discussed with Mark and unsure if it's worth the effort to set this to update based on the date type.  I'm ok with shipping this as is
