column1: New Version of PubSub That Accepts The New Content Schema
Spike: How To Store The new Logic for "Where"
Push Content to Facebook Instant Articles
column83: 12/Oct/18 4:44 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;In order to test pushing an article to Facebook Instant, I need to submit a url for which I will be posting content. This relates to the domain that is included in the canonical url for each article. This submission process requires the site to have a minimum readership as defined by a minimum amount of outbound traffic FROM Facebook TO that domain. This means we can not use a test site for testing. I would need to write up dev/stage to the corporate iHeartRadio Facebook page, and just rely on environment variables to set development_mode=true to hide them from our Facebook users. This sounds shady as hell.
column84:
22/Oct/18 11:22 AM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;New strategy.

[~1119767] get with me to discuss.

We will use the national news feed (news.iheart.com) to create articles to FB IA. We can do this by understanding what "where's" are considered national.

The news.iheart.com page should have more than enough "viewership" to start a test.

After we master getting articles from our tools to FB IA then we can discuss further how individual pages get those articles.
column85: 22/Oct/18 11:25 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;For any changes made on the FiRE front end to support this, let's make sure we get WEB and WebAPI tickets lined up and prioritized since most of the content national creates is canonical (and redirects to) www.
column86: 22/Oct/18 11:34 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;That's a good point. Since www is the canonical url, the fire work to expose the page id needs to be done in web as well.
column88: 13/Nov/18 10:28 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;I need credentials for a user that has access to write to the production iHeartRadio facebook page.
column89: 13/Nov/18 11:19 AM;MattBerger@iheartmedia.com;[~1119767] Mark, I can add you as an admin of the iHeartRadio Facebook page. 7.3M likes so please tread lightly! What is the email address associated with your Facebook page?
column90:
13/Nov/18 11:38 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;mark@markandheidicahill.com

Our test page was rejected by Facebook Instant because it "violated TOS" due to low traffic numbers.
column91:
13/Nov/18 11:55 AM;MattBerger@iheartmedia.com;[~1119767] Thank you, you've been added as an admin.

Does Facebook provide any information on their required traffic benchmarks? The iHeartRadio FB page has had 89,163 Page Views, 24,453 Page Likes and 4,948,799 Post Engagements over the past four weeks (10/15-11/11). What are they looking for?
column92: 13/Nov/18 11:58 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;It's not documented, but from what I've read online the metric is 25000 shares per month to your canonical domain.
column93: 13/Nov/18 12:05 PM;MattBerger@iheartmedia.com;So are we at a standstill? Is there someone at FB that we can contact? From what I see at https://www.facebook.com/iheartradio/insights/?section=navReach our average shares are 3,675/day which would put us closer to 110K shares/month if I'm understanding that correctly. !Screen Shot 2018-11-13 at 12.02.18 PM.png|thumbnail!
column94:
13/Nov/18 3:06 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Yeah, which is why I needed access to the prod Facebook page instead of a test page. Our test page had 0 shares per month. Now that I have access, I can move forward with coding a solution.

We will still need to choose an editor for when this goes to production, or else once we start actually publishing Facebook Instant articles on the iHeartRadio FB page, I'll be listed as the author.
column95:
13/Nov/18 3:31 PM;MattBerger@iheartmedia.com;Okay, I currently see you listed as a Pending admin for the iHeartRadio Facebook page. You should have a Facebook notification to confirm that you'd like to be an admin.

I assume articles can be published with the iHeartRadio page listed as the author instead of one of the personal pages of our admins/editors.
column96:
13/Nov/18 3:36 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Confirmed, I can now post to the prod iHeartRadio Facebook page. Muhaha.

No, I need to use a user token to post Facebook Instant articles. It is one of my biggest complaints with the system so far. In a later phase, when we expose this in RadioEdit, we'll use an OAuth2 flow to allow any site admin to log in with their Facebook login as long as they have access to the station's Facebook page. However, in phase 1 we'll have to nominate someone to be the Facebook Instant editor.
column97: 13/Nov/18 4:04 PM;MattBerger@iheartmedia.com;You can use your own admin account or you're welcome to use my account. Let me know how I'd provide that token. When I look at Instant Articles in the FB app I can't tell how the user account is ever public-facing so I'm willing to take my chances.
column98: 13/Nov/18 4:08 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Yeah, I couldn't either. It's likely just for auditing purposes. However, if the employee leaves, I didn't want to break that integration when their access was revoked to that page.
column99: 11/Dec/18 12:17 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;[~tlong] We have a new blocker on this project. The urls being shared to the iHeartRadio Facebook page are from ihr.fm, a url shortening service. That means that when trying to register www.iheart.com as a canonical domain, it is being rejected for low traffic volume, because the metrics from the iHeart Facebook page are tied to ihr.fm. Even if we stop using this service now, which we likely should if we want to proceed with Facebook Instant, it would take some period of time for Facebook to consider www.iheart.com "worthy" of Facebook Instant. In speaking with [~mberger], he suggests talking to Paul Miraldi and Jeff Cucinell and working something out. The plan of action that makes the most sense to me is to switch the share urls, then try again in a month or so.
column100: 11/Dec/18 1:03 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;I'll discuss with Paul.  Thanks for digging into this.
column101: 12/Dec/18 10:37 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;I wasn't able to connect with Paul yesterday, but I've emailed him the overview and asking for the direction he wants to go in.
column102: 12/Dec/18 11:46 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Heard back from Paul.  Effective immediately, they are going to start sharing www.iheart.com links to facebook.  I've calendared a reminder for myself on 1/10/19 to check if there's enough traffic on that domain for us to be eligible.  I suppose we're blocked until then.
column103: 29/Mar/19 10:38 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Matt Berger advises we are unblocked, but there's a variety of errors we need to fix with the content we're pushing them.

column1: Show Users When A Content Item Was Last Saved
column23:
Content tool has two types of save... 1) autosave to local machine on a regular basis as changes are made and 2) server save upon specifically hitting the button.

At the moment, we don't give users any type of indication that we're saving locally... and we only show a server save timestamp AFTER it's been saved to the server.

How can we surface information about both save types?  Re-assuring users that the changes they just made have been saved locally - and whether or not their changes have been saved to the server (and if so, when that was last done or if there are any unsaved changes)
column83: 11/Oct/18 2:24 PM;TrinaKing@iheartmedia.com;Looks good on stage, screenshot attached.

column1: Bottom of Text Block Has Style Issues
column23:
At the bottom of the text blocks in content tool, there's no bottom border of the text block... the white text just continues into the block below.  This seems to have broken at some point in the past week:

 !image-2018-10-03-09-17-22-286.png|thumbnail!  

How can we tune up the block so it's clear where the text block ends and the next one begins?

column1: Add Adswizz Status Screen to Streams
column23:
In IHRAR-4673, we de-coupled AdsWizz from the stream change approval process and moved the adswizz changes to a separate job that runs every 5 minutes.

To save us from having to check server logs to see what has/hasn't been sent to adswizz, we need to add a screen to streams that shows the last time the adswizz job successfully run, changes that haven't yet been transmitted to adswizz, and any other pertinent information.

Exact execution TBD, based on what type of feedback we get from users once this goes live.

column1: Add topic support to timeline resolver, add pagination support
column23:
Web is implementing the news.iheart.com/news/ and news.iheart.com/topic/<slug> routes on www!  Currently webapi does not support pagination which is preventing us from implementing the "load more" functionality on those pages.  We're not picky about whether we get the results from webapi or some other service if this is the wrong use case for webapi, but we need an endpoint for fetching pages after the first.

Note that if this is implemented as part of webapi, the topics portion of this ticket will be blocked by: https://jira.ihrint.com/browse/IHRAR-4742
column67: # Ability to specify limit and offset for all instances in WebAPI where a list of results/leads/cards are returned
column83: 05/Oct/18 1:46 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Offset needs to be limited to prevent load on the database. Will throw validation error if limit * pages > 1000.
column84: 05/Oct/18 2:06 PM;AndrewVickory@iheartmedia.com;sounds good.  I'll make sure we cap our queries.
column85: 05/Oct/18 3:29 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Will use limit from site-manager, expose page as a resolver param, and calculate offset as page * limit. I'll validate that page <= 10, and that limit * page <= 1000.
column86:
05/Oct/18 3:58 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;[3:42 PM] Mark Cahill: it looks like the homepage doesn't currently support load more?
[3:43 PM] Matt Brown: I think there's a flag in the collection block for whether to or not
[3:55 PM] Matt Brown: My opinion is that web is not immune to site configs in any other scenario, so we should honor what's in them
[3:55 PM] Matt Brown: If they ask for a 2nd page, it's an error. We can indicate if there are more pages somehow, if that satisfies them
[3:57 PM] Matt Brown: (in fact that info is already available in the pubsub response, so the flag would just override it)
column87: 09/Oct/18 10:36 AM;AndrewVickory@iheartmedia.com;Looks good to me on https://webapi.radioedit.ihrint.com/graphiql
column89:
12/Oct/18 10:40 AM;TrinaKing@iheartmedia.com;[10:34 AM] Mark Cahill: so how it works:
[10:34 AM] Mark Cahill: - you can request up to 10 pages
[10:34 AM] Mark Cahill: - OR you can request up to 1000 item offset
[10:34 AM] Mark Cahill: so if you set limit to 1000 in site-manager, you'll only be able to request 1 page
[10:34 AM] Mark Cahill: but for most sites, we'll hit the 10 page limit first
[10:35 AM] Mark Cahill: our database has trouble with large offsets
column90: 12/Oct/18 10:40 AM;TrinaKing@iheartmedia.com;Looks good in stage.

column1: Flint Static Retirement: Load /pay/ Redirects into Site Manager
column23: As an iHeartRadio advertiser, I want a link to pay my advertsing bill loaded into each station's website so that I'm still able to pay my bill after iHeartRadio shuts off the old platform that currently manages the redirect.
column67:
# attached redirects are bulk loaded into site manager search overrides
# existing redirects with '/pay' or '/pay/' as the source should be overwritten with the new value
# all redirects should be flagged as 'permanent' with no end date
column83:
10/Jan/19 3:47 PM;MarkEscott@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrnyc2msw], since the link destination is reliant on the marketID (which exists in the core dump for onair data), does it make better sense to ingest the marketID is a non-editable site manager value, then set up a universal /pay page that redirects to https://iheartmedia.na2.onlinecheckout.com/guestpay/index.html?MarketID={marketID}?

that option would be better scalable than doing the hard search override redirects
column84: 10/Jan/19 4:02 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;I think that route was considered... based on my last comment in https://jira.ihrint.com/browse/AL-2359?focusedCommentId=523268&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-523268 it seems a transition from one bill pay solution to another was/is still in progress which is why I liked the search override idea.  That way we don't have to mess with building in logic to know if/when a station has migrated to the new solution.  If they need to update their /pay/ link, they can do it in site manager.
column85:
25/Jan/19 9:02 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Mark and I tested on stage.  Confirmed that the script removes the first /pay redirect that already exists on a given site (for those that have one), and then adds the new one with the correct market ID as specified on the sheet.

Found that for some reason, a few sites may have a second /pay source redirect, but this seems to be the exception rather than the rule.  Because stations can delete extra redirects - and fire uses the first one it comes across - and the old billpay site redirects to the new one, we're not going to solve for this.

We'll run this in prod in the next change window.

column1: A/B Admin a flag for feature overrides
column23:
Feature overrides, by default, take less precedence than eligibility control, as a result, for mutually exclusive tests, overrides can be ignored if the user is not eligible for the test due to mutually exclusive assignments. 
I added a new flag to the feature data, and an endpoint so that user can toggle this flag to set the strength of the overrides. 
Now when you call /features/{feature}/overrides, the data you get will include a new boolean field
`overrideEligibility`

And a new endpoint is added to toggle this particular field https://qa-ampinternal.ihrcloud.net/internal/api/v3/abtest/docs/swagger-ui/index.html?url=../../assets/swagger.json#/internal/setOverrideEligibilityIn

Would you create a checkbox in Feature overrides section to display this field and toggle its value based on user's check/uncheck action?
column83:
08/Oct/18 10:24 AM;YehudaRosen@iheartmedia.com;[~1110604] This is just a single checkbox in the Overrides box, correct?

Any particular label text you'd like?

And finally, when viewing a test, you have to click "New Revision" but overrides can be edited without doing that - does this checkbox need a new revision to modify?
column84:
27/Nov/18 11:01 AM;KailuoWang@iheartmedia.com;A single checkbox labeled as "overrides override eligibility control", and it would be nice if you can add a tooltip "eligibility control such as tags and mutually exclusive tests"
This one works the same as the overrides, i.e. it's not related to revisions and thus no need to click New Revisions

column23:

http://mike-dv.fire.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/content/2018-09-27-traffic-is-a-grid-lock-this-morning/

 !image-2018-09-27-14-18-28-416.png|thumbnail!

this is what old tool gives us
{noformat}
"attributes": {
      "@provider": "YouTube",
      "@query": "https://www.youtube.com/oembed?format=json\u0026omit_script=true\u0026omitscript=true\u0026url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DzsZHFQbQUgc",

column1: Allow for More Meaningful Help/Hover Text
column23:
In new content tool on dev, if you hover over the title of one of the meta data blocks, you get this help text:

 !image-2018-09-27-10-07-55-588.png|thumbnail!  

I'm not sure this would help our users too much... can we add an option in the templates screen to customize this text?
column83: 01/Oct/18 12:11 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;If you have something you want to add specifically, we can change it. I don't think this needs to pollute the template editor though as this probably won't even be a thing once the fieldsets work is done.
column84:
01/Oct/18 4:27 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;I'd like to have some type of help text/tool tip on each field to help guide users on what should be there.  I don't anticipate these to change super often, but there's always the chance we'd want to update.

I'm not committed to the hover text - the existing help text on the publish panel looks great too.  

Here's some initial text:

Editors: Only users who are a member of these groups will be able to edit this content.

Headline: Visual title shown throughout the website.  Also used as a fallback if an SEO and/or Social title are not supplied.

Primary Image: 16x9 aspect ratio thumbnail used when content is shown in a collection card - and when shared to social media.

Slug: Unique identifier for article, used in the URL. Automatically generated based on the headline and creation date, but may be customized prior to publication for evergreen content.

Author: Byline as shown to user on the content detail page.

Summary: A description of the article that it shown to users when shared on social media or featured in search listings.

Keywords: Used primarily for ad targeting and analytics.

SEO Title: Optional title that is used primarily by search engines.

Social Title: Optional title that is primary used by Facebook, Twitter, and other social networks.

Include Recommendations: The recommendations widget will be included on this content page if checked.

Allow Facebook Comments: Includes a Facebook commenting module at the bottom of this content page if checked.

Branded Content: Enables the paid content features built into the templates when checked.

Enable SimpleReach: Adds SimpleReach analytics tracking into this content page if checked.
column85: 14/Nov/18 3:07 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Closing without product review.  To be reviewed once the UI Kit work is complete via full regression test.

column1: Content Tool Mobile Preview
column23:
Feedback from my Sussex market visit:

80% of our users are on mobile, but the content tool preview only shows what it looks like on desktop.

How can we give a preview of how the article will look on a mobile device?

Can we make the mobile preview the default and force users to take action to see desktop size?
column83:
26/Sep/18 10:26 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;[10:24 AM] Mike Woodruff: i suspect it's just doing something in the preview pane with a switch to limit the preview window size to what a mobile screen would be
[10:24 AM] Mike Woodruff: ability to toggle mobile/desktop that just adds/removes the limited size
[10:24 AM] Mike Woodruff: defaulting to mobile
column84:
27/Sep/18 5:45 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Not sure if it makes sense to solve at the same time or not - but with the exception of the H1 headline, all the text/images/blocks/etc in the body of the page are right up against the side of the preview window - whereas when shown on FiRE even in a 1 column presentation, there's some padding.

We should see if we can get the padding on the rest of the page to match what is in the headline.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
column85: 01/Oct/18 8:11 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrnyc2msw] We're using the Fire preview directly now, so that would be a separate Fire ticket.

column1: Allow Distribution of Calendar Events By Market
column23: As a digital content editor, i want the ability to distribute a calendar event by using a market tag so that I don't have to search for and select each and every one of my stations for each and every event I want to create.
column67:
# Ability for editors to distribute a calendar event using a market tag
# All sites with that market tag associated should display an event tagged with it
# Still able to distribute events to individual stations
column82:
If I'm a local user and I have access to all of the tags below, i should be able to tag events for distribution such as:

NEWYORK-NY

or

WHTZ-FM + WKTU-FM + WWPR-FM

or

NEWYORK-NY + WSUS-FM + WNNJ-FM

Events should appear on calendar pages of all brands explicitly specified - and those inherited from their association with a market (eg. via the NEWYORK tag, i should see the event on WAXQ-FM, WOR-AM, etc)

column1: Require Blocks Have Cotnent Before Server Save
column23: This ticket added validation on blocks to make sure they have something in them before allowing save to the server.  Prior to that, changes are saved locally.
column83: 02/Oct/18 3:21 PM;AdamRoberts@iheartmedia.com;The original PR for this ticket was dropped because it brought up some issues with our validation system that were fixed in https://github.com/ihr-radioedit-apps/content/pull/652 and https://github.com/ihr-radioedit-apps/content/pull/653 along with the original fixes from KC's PR.
column84: 03/Oct/18 12:10 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Discussed with Adam and Trey.  A slightly different approach was taken where we block users from saving changes to the server if they have empty blocks.  Important to note that local saves still work. We'll be working to add improved messaging into the tools about when/how a content item was saved, but i think this ticket passes. Updated ticket name and description to match what was built.

column84: 27/Nov/18 1:38 PM;AndrewVickory@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrnyc2msw], as you requested, the conversation that spawned this ticket: September 24th in RadioEdit Support: Andrew Vickory: Hey, sorry to keep bugging y'all, I'm trying to figure out where the data for https://news.iheart.com/news/ comes from. I was using graphql, but just realized the topic links don't appear to exist in those schema (using the site -> timeline functions with the slug "ihm-ip"). Is that the wrong endpoint, or am I just not seeing something? 2:40 PM Link iHeartRadio News | iHeartRadio The latest pop, hip-hop, rock, alternative, and country music news. 2:40 PM Mark Cahill: @AndrewVickory what do you mean by "topic links don't appear to exist in those schema"? 2:53 PM Andrew Vickory: sorry, if you look at the page, there are these "Music News" and "Rock News" links with each news item 2:54 PM Mark Cahill: the eyebrows? 2:54 PM Andrew Vickory: yeah, the per news item ones 2:54 PM Keith Hayden: so I think he's looking for topic name to be part of the data for the articles payload, and like we do on fire, we generate link as /topic/slugified-topic-name 2:56 PM Keith Hayden: I don't think web ever needed topic before, so it's not in the schema, but now they need it 2:58 PM Mark Cahill: it *is* in the subscription. the raw tag at least: 2:59 PM Mark Cahill: subscription { tags } 2:59 PM Mark Cahill: for that first item, it ends up looking like this: 2:59 PM Mark Cahill: [ "brands/DEFAULT- (2135)", "collections/iheartradio-music-news", "collections/iheartradio-music-festival", "collections/trending-pop", "collections/National - Trending (Hot AC) (501921)", "collections/National - Trending (CHR Rhythmic) (501919)" ] Show full text 2:59 PM Mark Cahill: how that turns into this, I don't know: 3:00 PM Mark Cahill: Music News 3:00 PM Matt Brown: FiRE does it. 3:02 PM Mark Cahill: right, but how? 3:02 PM Andrew Vickory: yeah, parsing those tags seems like it could be tricky, if it isn't supported, I'm happy to move over to a different endpoint (whatever is populating those in the current implementation) 3:03 PM Matt Brown: It uses its own route table to build the URL 3:03 PM Andrew Vickory: for reference, the query I'm making 3:03 PM Andrew Vickory: query NewsDirectory($site: SiteQuery!) { site(select: $site) { timeline { payload { external_url is_sponsored feed_vendor permalink publish_origin keywords } summary { image title description author } slug } leads { title subtitle link { name description urls { device web } } background_color img_uri } } } Show full text 3:03 PM Alex Mamut: subscriptions seems to be in the contentFunctions but not in Sitefunctions? 3:03 PM Matt Brown: If web needs this data, please open a ticket 3:03 PM Mark Cahill: it looks like it's also hitting taxonomy for the tag name as well? 3:03 PM Mark Cahill: the display name? 3:03 PM Matt Brown: (ticket for webapi, that is) 3:04 PM Scott Wilkin: the eyebrow url is generated via a jinja template filter 3:04 PM Scott Wilkin: @mark yes, that's correct 3:04 PM Mark Cahill: @alex yeah, he's using the timeline resolver 3:04 PM Andrew Vickory: alrighty I'll ticket and just implement around the tags for now 3:05 PM Mark Cahill: @AndrewVickory yeah, so if you want to display eyebrows on iheart.com, you likely want to have us handle it in webapi. otherwise, you would have to hit taxonomy from web, which seems like a bad idea. 3:06 PM Alex Mamut: ahh I see it now 3:06 PM Mark Cahill: you just have the tag id, not the display name 3:06 PM Mark Cahill: which isn't enough info to display the eyebrow links 3:06 PM Andrew Vickory: sounds good to me. Thanks for all your help! 3:07 PM Mark Cahill: (thumbsup) 3:09 PM Andrew Vickory: here ya go! https://jira.ihrint.com/browse/IHRAR-4723 3:34 PM

column1: Prevent Single character keywords in XML Ingest
column23:
Found while troubleshooting the COntent XML tool's failures this week. We found that single character keywords are being ingested.  

We should ignore keywords that come in via ingestion that are less than 3 characters long.

column1: Add messaging when No Recently Used Settings (presets) are available
column23:
National editorial team feedback from Stage testing:

After I click on create new item, I get popup to choose the settings but clicking on recently used items does not do anything.

If no recently used settings are available for a user, we either should show some placeholder text "If you create publishing presets, you'll be able to select from your most recently used ones here" - or just collapse that whole section so the modal has the "Create New Item" title and the template selector.
column83: 01/Oct/18 3:10 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Discussed with Trey and KC.  The approach taken on this ticket is different from the description above, but I believe it will be ok.  If a user doesn't have any presets, we are now prompting them to supply origin, editor, and distribution settings - with the option to save those into a preset.

column1: Content Users Should Only Be Able To Use Appropriate Templates
column23: As a content editor, i want to only be shown templates that I can actually use to publish a real piece of content to a destination I'm responsible for publishing to so that I don't accidentally spend an hour creating a piece of content that isn't compatible the publishing destination that my readers see.
column67:
# Content Editors should only be able to create articles on templates that they are permissioned to use
# If a piece of content was created on a template that an editor no longer has access to, they should be able to edit what they already created
# SysAdmins should be able to access all templates
column83:
03/Oct/18 1:38 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on dev.  Saw the new "Allowed Users" field that allows you to specify editors (in the context of content tool) using brand tags of who should be able to use each template.

I'm not sure this works as is since here is no single brand tag that all editors have access to (nor do I know if that would be appropriate to do).

My first hunch is to give an option that allows template editors to specify whether a template is available to all users - or to just those from the tagged brands.  Adam had an alternate idea to allow access to everyone unless restricted to a smaller group (which I appreciate the code simplification, but worry about someone creating a test template and forgetting to restrict access).

We should talk through this with the team.

column1: Write GraphQL blog post
column83:
24/Sep/18 12:06 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Adam's feedback:
* You have a few places with things like "provide benefits such as providing" which could use some streamlining.
* I'm not entirely sure what your third diagram is showing me
* There are a few places you make reference to things which you expect your audience to know, such as "Facade pattern" which you provide a link to, but it might help to include a summary of what it is
* Similarly concepts like "resolvers" "schemas" "data loaders". You and I work with those day to day, but some interested parties may not know them by those names
* You have a section called "Documenting your apis" where you make reference to api docs, but then only talk about the playground. the graphiql app thing had a kind of interactive documentation of the params that the endpoint was looking for for different queries. I don't know if the apollo playground has something like that, but might be worth a mention.
* Your conclusion (always the hardest part) seems... I dunno, kinda clunky. Reads like a TLDR. I dunno, I just feel like I could not read it and come away with the same info.
* Another consideration is try to minimize blind links. You have things like "report errors" as link text, and I can assume it's going to documentation of that feature or something, but no real description.
In that particular case, maybe saying "GraphQL solves this problem much more elegantly by allowing resolvers to report errors to the client without terminating the entire request, [link] as documented here[/link]
* Also take a chisel to a few "wall-o'-text" spots you got in there. (Conclusion for example). Paragraph splitting needed.
column84: 01/Oct/18 3:13 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;GraphQL itself could use more explanation in the article.

column1: Keywords curation
column23:
1. Keywords field should not automatically add to taxonomy
2. Keywords field should not implicitly create tags when the user types something that does not exist. Instead there should be an option as the last autocomplete option to "Use Custom Tag".
3. Store usages for keywords not in the known keywords list so that we can present a list of common but unknown keywords to an admin.

column1: Features for first-class content authors
column23:
Authors field type:
The authors field type will in essence be a linked field with a unique display and memory suitable for selecting an author.

Can Edit Filter:
Ability to limit linked field lookups to only those which are editable. This will need to be done on the server, based on the user's token and coordinated with objectdb.

Additionally, an "editable" filter should be included on the normal list page (can be another ticket).

Created the following followup tickets while testing this that I'd like to see worked on before we introduce this functionality to users:

IHRAR-4913
AR-4916
AR-4921
AR-4922
AR-4923

column1: Spike: Content Authors: How To
column23:
Right now, the Author field is a plain text field.  Users can put whatever they want in there; we have no association between content created by the same author or the ability to show any metadata about a given author.

How can we maintain support for the existing freeform/throwaway author value (for legacy content), while allowing frequent contributors to tag using a re-usable value?

Some considerations:

* Author name does not usually equal AD user name
* One AD user may pen under multiple author names
* Multiple AD users may pen under a single author name
* We'll need permissioning so that users don't create content under the name of someone else without their consent
* We still need to support one-off values that aren't likely to be re-used such as a sponsor that provides a single piece of branded content - or ingested content (from billboard or the like) where it can be a slew of different authors that don't repeat often)
* It'd be a beast to manually create 2,500 author profiles - and a mess if we ask 2,500 authors who frequently typo to do it themselves

We'd want the ability to supply metadata for an author... things like email, twitter, facebook, phone, short bio, picture, etc.

What is the best way to organize this data and tool it?  What updates need to be made to the APIs and clients to support across all platforms (including Apple News, AMP, etc)

Once in place, what data service would be required to either show related content - or generate a page about that author, showcasing what they wrote?

http://content.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/content/%2F5ba26c7c0ccc53a90e47f0ed

column1: Update call letters in 'own_brand' value
column23:
The 'own_brand' value for the below stations do not match the slug call letters. This causes an issue with anything using that value from the api such as iHeart Daily newsletters which use this to pull in content from the Leads Tool.

These generally get outdated during a call letter change whereby we can update the slugs but not the own_brand value.

update the own_brand value for the following:

slug,brand
kdza-am,brands/KDZA-AM
kfoo-am,brands/KFOO-AM
kpwk-am,brands/KPWK-AM
kube-fm,brands/KUBE-FM (1040)
kfoo-fm,brands/KFOO-FM (15184)
katz-fm,brands/KATZ-FM
whty-fm,brands/WHTY-FM
katz-hd2,brands/KATZ-HD2
wbga-am,brands/WBGA-AM
kjaq-hd2,brands/KJAQ-HD2
wrgv-fm,brands/WRGV-FM
wgsy-am,brands/WGSY-AM
kolt-hd2,brands/KOLT-HD (15529)
kpez-hd2,brands/KPEZ-HD2
wrum-hd2,brands/WRUM-HD2
kyrv-fm,brands/KYRV-FM
wqrv-hd3,brands/WQRV-HD3
column67: Slug call letters should match the brand in the api's own_brand value
column82:
The brand switch code does the following:

1) Verify that no tag exists with the new name (and error if one does)
2) change own_brand value
3) add the old value to a new archived_brands field on the index record
4) clean up archived_brands if the new value also exists in the archive
5) create a tag with the new brand name and set metadata for the site
6) add the new value to segments and lookup structure
7) add the old value to segments

Also as with slugs, the user can remove archived brand names. Doing so does the following:
1) delete the tag associated with the old name
2) remove the old name from segments and lookup structure
column83: 13/Sep/18 1:23 PM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;This is not currently doable without orphaning all content published to those sites, and *also* it would cause all such content, leads, charts, etc. to no longer be editable (because the tag used for edit permission would no longer exist after the next brand tags update).
column84: 13/Sep/18 2:42 PM;MarkEscott@iheartmedia.com;we can chat about it in stand up or grooming, but this issue has caused a few different challenges we're trying to solve.

The Orlando crew is going to discuss in the office on 9/19 and see what the path forward could be to resolve the above list of mis-matches.

This is basically creating a new site, which is something the system supports and is a today solution.

changing a microsite's brand tag is going to cause its timeline items under a site to link direct to the site and not have the microsite as the eyebrow. If that's undesireable, we'll need an AL ticket to smooth that over.‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ(I'm going to be storing the previous brand tags used, in the event of a change, just like with slugs.

column1: Fix hostname tool to allow special webapp.CountryCode cases and not keep breaking them
column23:
The hostname tool performs validation that keeps hostnames like:

thing.type.country, for example iphone.mobile.us

Web had legacy hostnames that violate this:

thing.country, for example webapp.US

Web has continued their scheme this way, but the hostname tool can't cope with it and were getting problems of deleted hostnames in production.  The tool should allow this special case only for web to be editable in the tool.

column1: Added cache service with group invalidation to objectdb
column23: ObjectDB should grow a simple cache interface. It should support multiple "silos" of data and provide both TTL and multi-key invalidation.
column83:
02/May/19 9:55 AM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;{code}
Custom cache service:

Level 1 features:
	- HTTP interface (or HTTP/2)
		- What does this look like? How are complex commands done if at all?
		- HTTP is great for portability and client support, we just need a sane way of using it.
	- Group key invalidation, aka surrogate keys, aka cache tagging.
		- Done through abstraction with redis plus lua trash collection?
	- Easy distributed locks
	- Easy dogpile prevention (always on)

Level 2 features:
	- Callthrough caching (aka CDN mode)
		a proxy http request that is cached transparently. This is like a CDN, but local...
		- advantages:
			- doesn't have to go out to the world
			- doesn't depend on external services
			- can provide a keep-warm routine if it continues to be requested
				e.g. x-refresh-after header causes api endpoint to be re-fetched. Only happens once unless another request that has x-refresh-after set comes in.
		- disadvantages:
			- takes our resources

		Research and implement something like APQ from Apollo for this perhaps.
	
{code}

Will require some SDK support. Might need to be websocket based?

column1: Change postup data export source for 'format' value
column23:
Since Partners>Format no longer exists in Site Manager, some stations being exported to PostUp have no value for this. Change the export script to extract the format from site facets and strip "formats/" from the tag. For instance, WEBN-FM has these facets:

facets: [
"markets/CINCINNATI-OH",
"genres/Rock",
"brands/DEFAULT- (2135)",
"formats/ROCKACTIVE",
"facets/Local HPT 6/26-29/18",
"facets/Local HPT 6/30-7/6/18",
"facets/IHRMFContest",
"brands/WEBN-FM (1738)"
],

You'll have to cycle through and extract "formats/ROCKACTIVE" and return "ROCKACTIVE" as the value.

These options should be available to users without having to scroll back up.

column1: Show Paragraph Separation in Text Blocks
column23:
Users can hit enter/return to create a new paragraph in a text block.

Unfortunately, visually in the tool it looks like it's only putting a line break - instead of creating a new paragraph.  As such, users will inevitably hit the enter button twice so it visually looks like a new paragraph... which on FiRE and WebAPI will double and create huge gaps.

Hitting enter/return should create a new paragraph that visually looks appropriate for a new paragraph.

Added scope from IHRAR-4633:

Right now, the default presentation of a text block looks like it only supports a line or two of text.

Please make that taller as to invite users to write a masterpiece.

3x the current height by default?
column83: 04/Sep/18 9:47 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Groomed today.  See if enter can be new paragraph and shift + enter can be new line.
column84: 06/Sep/18 9:10 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Shift+enter is not supported by quill. If we want to add the dirty hack at the bottom of this issue, please ticket separately: https://github.com/quilljs/quill/issues/252

column1: Spike: Streams Depenencies on Adswizz
column23:
Upon attempted release of Streams 4.0, we discovered a dependency on Adswizz.  If Adswizz's servers are down (eg. 504/request timeout), it blocks users from approving changes made to streams.

We need to explore ways to make the Streams tool not dependent on 3rd parties such as Adswizz.  If upon approving a change, Adswizz is not available, the rest of the changes should go through, but users should be alerted that Adswizz is down and be given the option to re-try.

Would the solution we built for Apple News in the Content Tool work here as well?  There, upon publishing a piece of content that is intended for Apple News, the content is immediately published - and a request is triggered to Apple News. Users are shown that the Apple push is pending.  Upon successful transmission to Apple, we update the indicator in the publish panel as such.

Might need to have a list of changes that succeeded/failed transmission so that users can easily see what the delta is.
column83:
10/Sep/18 8:27 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;After taking a look I think we can remove the push to Adswizz all together in the app and move it to a backend process which will run every 5 minutes and attempt to push any changes queued up. If the attempt succeeds its removed from the queue else stays in the queue and moves onto the next item.

This would delay the Adswizz updates but not keep the user locked out of accepting stream changes. The user would not need to do anything extra and the change would get pushed eventually (as long as Adswizz API can process the request).

Ad Ops should be made aware of this change so that they know in the future if a station is tagged improperly, this may be the cause.

column1: imported shows from CORE do not start at the intended start date
column23:
As a Program Director who schedules new show begin dates, I would like my new shows to appear in the station site's on air module as well as the /schedule page on my scheduled start date instead of the day after.

site-manager-data-utils/blob/master/onair/model.py lines 28 and 29 have the greater than logic set up for the start date instead of equal to or greater

self.is_started = self.record["begin"] is not None and now > self.record["begin"]
column67: # adjust logic so imported shows start on the intended start date and expire at the intended start date
column83: 28/Aug/18 5:04 PM;MarkEscott@iheartmedia.com;For example, a show with a start date in CORE of 8/28/18 does not actually appear on the station's website schedule until 8/29. And a show that expires on 8/28 doesn't "fall off" the station's website schedule until 8/29.
column84: 31/Aug/18 12:08 PM;MarkEscott@iheartmedia.com;https://github.com/ihr-radioedit-apps/site-manager-data-utils/pull/34
column85: 07/Sep/18 3:25 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Not something that can easily be product reviewed due to the nature of how shows change.  The change that was made seems logical to me, because that's passed dev review, I'm going to move this forward.

column1: Cleanup User Lookup Fields
column23:
We need a standardized interface throughout the tools to search/display users.  All of the following have different visual presentations/functionality:

* Content Tool Creator Filter
* Site manager internal contacts
* User tool search results/Delegates screen
* Maybe more...

Users should always be shown as LastName, First Name.

You should be able to search by primary email, user id, firstname lastname, and lastname, first name

For example

I should always show up as Woodruff, Mike

You should be able to search and find me by any of the following:
Woodruff, Mike
Woodruff
Mike Woodruff
Mike Wood
ccrnyc2msw
mikewoodruff
mikewoodruff@iheartmedia.com

[3:19 PM] Mark Cahill: yeah, it's not
[3:19 PM] Mark Cahill: ideally we would implement it in regui so we show users consistently among all our apps
[3:20 PM] Mark Cahill: that's what the tag pill is for
[3:20 PM] Mark Cahill: it's probably a 1{quote}

column1: Spike: pubsub work for content refactor
column23:
Known issues:
- context-aware rendering of headings
- how will content be communicated to webapi?
column83:
19/Sep/18 2:47 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Context-aware rendering of headings is not required for parity, and the legacy output format already accounts for an h1 being present on the page. In the pubsub refactor, we will write the new format to pubsub, and the start heading can be communicated to pubsub in the content query.

For parity, the legacy format should already serve webapi's needs. If individual fields are missing from that format, they will need to be ticketed separately for parity. Once pubsub is receiving the new format, both fire and webapi will need to be altered to handle that new format.

column1: WebAPI Missing Schedule Linked Microsite Check
column23:
WebAPI returns on-air schedule data that is used in flagship to show which personality is currently on-air.

The default treatment is to just show the name as returned from core... but if the core show has been connected with a microsite AND the microsite is linked to the current brand, it is enriched with microsite data (eg. override name, add image, microsite link, etc).

It seems that WebAPI is missing the logic to check if the microsite is linked... it's showing a linked microsite in the on-air schedule regardless of whether that microsite is avialable, resulting in 404 links.
column67:
# Enrich on-air schedule data in WebAPI if core show linked to a microsite AND microsite is distributed to current site
# Else fallback to default treatment
column82: Need to check FiRE as well since there was logic previously built out on that app to handle this.
column83: 04/Sep/18 11:35 AM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;It would be better if Site Manager did this -- i.e. not set the associated_microsite in the on-air data if the microsite isn't linked to the site.

column1: Only allow readonly user's target updates if working copy is clean
column23:
Because we're maintaining an audit trail for every action on an item resource, we need to verify that the working copy has no unpublished changes before allowing a readonly user to add their targeting. This check should be done both when loading the resource and when the readonly user submits their changes.

As part of this ticket, we should verify that a commit occurs after every storage action (or logical set of actions).
column83: 05/Sep/18 2:26 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested various content items while logged in as different users in different browsers.  Confirmed that the tool shows whether there are unpublished changes before allowing a user to add read-only targeting.  This looks good to me.

column1: Require At Least One Content Block Before Publishing
column23: As found when testing IHRAR-4566, a content item can be published without any blocks provided, which would cause users to see a blank page.  Unless there's a specific reason we'd want no blocks to show up, we should require at least one.

04/Sep/18 9:17 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.  Confirmed that if there is not at least one content block that the following error is shown:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Looks good.

column1: Artist Namespace in Taxonomy Has Stale Records
column23:
We've seen a couple instances of artists in Taxonomy (as used for tagging in the content tool) offering up tags corresponding to artists that are no longer in the catalog.

These tags are used to generate links on iHeart.com content pages - and unfortunately when a tag from a removed artist is used, a 404 page is shown to users that click.

Need to figure out why these weren't removed as part of the weekly cron job and update.

Running list:

Travis Scott - 31010029
CMT - 209636
column83: 04/Sep/18 10:31 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Groomed today.  Likely resolved via changing an environment variable ([~mbrown] please specify which), to verify on prod.
column84: 04/Sep/18 12:06 PM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;MONGO_FAC_CONNECT is the connect string. For reference, the old one is in MONGO_FAC_OLD (in developer)
column85:
04/Sep/18 4:23 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;As of this afternoon, both of the defunct artists are still showing up on both stage and prod.  

From discussing with Matt on HipChat:


{code:java}
[2:57 PM] Matt Brown:
    |  PROD-Atlas-FAC-shard-0:PRIMARY> db.artist.findOne({_id: 209636})
    |  {
    |    "_id": 209636,
    |    "nm": "CMT",
    |    "fUd": ISODate("2018-02-11T07:46:29.619Z")
    |  }
[2:57 PM] Matt Brown: As long as it exists in the database, we're going to pick it up
[2:58 PM] Matt Brown: It's possible we're no longer using the right database. There are multiple choices:
[2:58 PM] Matt Brown:
    |  PROD-Atlas-FAC-shard-0:PRIMARY> show dbs
    |  catalog4               ‚Üí  9.588GB
    |  catalog_music_ihr_US_1 ‚Üí 11.175GB
    |  catalog_music_ihr_US_2 ‚Üí 12.676GB
    |  catalog_us_rhapsody_4  ‚Üí  5.936GB
    |  catalog_us_rhapsody_5  ‚Üí 13.169GB
[2:58 PM] Matt Brown: (the last one in the list is what we've used before, and I didn't change it)
[3:00 PM] Matt Brown: And actually the db name we're using in prod doesn't exist in FAC stage. So it may just be a matter of finding out which db to use. I don't even know who to ask
{code}
column86: 04/Sep/18 4:40 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Meeting set for 9/10 at 3PM to review with [~lvauthrin], [~1098562], [~1104800], [~mbrown], [~tlong], and [~mfielder].
column87:
10/Sep/18 3:21 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;Discussed with [~1098562] [~mfielder] [~mbrown] [~lvauthrin] and [~1104800]

Right Solution:
The FAC catalog we're using is no longer updated. Not to mention AMP would prefer it if we didn't look into the database directly as it's a complex set of data that they manage fairly carefully. The preference would be to use an existing catalog export system and add an artist export to that. Which would dump an easily parsable file to S3 that we could pick up periodically.

We were also asked to give an overview as to where and how the artist namespace in the taxonomy is used.

Fast Solution:
If this is a serious issue the AMP team can copy the current view of the data to the mongo database we've been using as a stop-gap measure.
column88: 18/Sep/18 10:30 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Trey is going to ping the group from last week to make sure the AMP work is moving forward.

column84:
23/Aug/18 4:59 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;[4:43 PM] Mark Cahill: ok, so I add a new call to fetch capabilities
[4:43 PM] Mark Cahill: this.default now has to be set asynchronously
[4:43 PM] Mark Cahill: this.createForm() will have already been called
[4:44 PM] Mark Cahill: sorry, this.disabled has to be set async

column1: Policy Framework
New Taxonomy Service
column23: Create a new taxonomy service in objectdb that allows for management of the full taxonomy tree including apps, policies, actions, and the traditional taxonomy. This includes the ability to use id-based tags with dynamic name resolution. id-based tags may be used for all or part of the full taxonomy.

column1: Policy: migration of existing observer/member security
column23:
New framework for scoped security

Create a migration script to convert existing user/app/bucket/resource policies into the new policy framework. This means creating policies to replicate the existing functionality and updating observer_of/member_of appropriately.

column1: Policy: app-specific tokens
column23:
New framework for scoped security

Update proxyd to generate app-specific tokens for new security policy framework

column1: Policy: bucket tool updates
column23:
New framework for scoped security

Update bucket tool to allow management of bucket policies under the new framework

column1: Policy: developer tool updates
column23:
New framework for scoped security

Update developer tool to allow management of app policies.

column1: Policy: user tool updates
column23:
New framework for scoped security

Update user tool to manage user policies under the new framework.

column1: Policy: objectdb evaluation
column23:
New framework for scoped security

Implement policy evaluation in objectdb for all resource and bucket access

column1: Add Permalink/View So Users Can See What They Created
column23:
After publication of a piece of content, there's currently no way for users to see their masterpiece on a live site or grab a link to it.

On production, we have this:

 !image-2018-08-23-11-58-13-020.png|thumbnail! 

Please add an option for users to view their content on the live site using the canonical URL.

Bonus points if we can also support ingested content to a location they can view it on platform (since the canonical is always the 3rd party source site)... or followup ticket if that needs more work.

23/Aug/18 3:20 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Original request:

In content tool, if you have not supplied all required fields, the tool disables the "Publish" button in the final publishing screen.  No indication is given to users of what value is preventing publication.

Users should be told which required fields are missing upon hitting publish, preferably by both a growl that calls out the fields - as well as highlighting those fields as required.

column23: Pronouncer data is moving from site manager to SMT. We need a proper block for the pronouncer data that can be used to power the listen page. e.g. https://xl1067.iheart.com/amazon-alexa-and-google-home/

column1: Update Heading 1/Heading 2 Text
column23:
Please update the Heading 1/Heading 2 text shown in the formatting dropdown of the text block.  The current setup will confuse users (since there's already an H1 on the page as the headline - and there's not the H3/H4/H5 users are accustomed to.

Heading 1 -> Section Title
Heading 2 -> Subsection Title

As i understand from talking with trey, the actual markup used on FiRE or included in WebAPI will be page aware to know whether there's already an H1 on the page and will start the sections in the html markup as H2 (whereas on a page that doesn't already have an H1, will start as such)
column83: 23/Aug/18 9:20 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;This should be a simple markup change. We can limit the options to h2 and h3 if you want, with the names provided.
column84: 23/Aug/18 3:16 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;May need to create followup fire ticket if a section header doesn't render as an h2.
column85:
27/Aug/18 10:16 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on dev at http://content.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/content/%2F5b8405cfb0847ad34b5b0d15

Observed an issue where this text is larger than what can be shown in the real estate.  Can we increase the allowed space?  Or, do we need to remove "Title" from each?

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Viewed on FiRE at http://mike-dv.fire.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/content/2018-08-27-test-for-ar-4559/

This doesn't seem to be rendering as expected.  

When you select Section Title, the text is being wrapped in an H1 (but should be an H2):

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

When you select Subsection Title, it's being wrapped in an H2 (but should be in an H3):

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
column86:
29/Aug/18 11:18 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Confirmed that section/subsection title text is no longer truncated in the tool on dev. However, FiRE is still rendering this as H1/H2... and WebAPI is also has H1/H2 hardcoded: http://mike-dv.fire.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/content/2018-08-27-test-for-ar-4559/ http://webapi.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/graphiql/?query=%7B%0A%20%20content%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20slug%28slug%3A%20%222018-08-27-test-for-ar-4559%22%29%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20payload%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20canonical_url%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20blocks%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%7D%0A%7D%0A {code:java} "html": "

Here's some intro text

This Is A Section Header

And another bit of intro text

Here's a sub section header

And some text

And another sub section header

and some more text

Another Section Header

Some more text

", {code} We need Section Title to be H2 and Subsection Title to be H3. How can we accomplish that?
column87: 29/Aug/18 11:20 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;[~tlong] Can you weigh in on this?
column88: 29/Aug/18 5:25 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;FiRE's rendering of the headings is not this tickets concern. There is another ticket IHRAR-4616 to change HTML output to be relative.
column89: 30/Aug/18 9:34 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Thanks.  Added some acceptance criteria to the linked ticket.  I'm ok with closing this out.

column1: Show More Meta Data On Embed Blocks
column23:
In the production content tool, when you add an embed block, the entire widget shows so that an editor can easily see what they inserted without having to preview an article.

On stage, we don't give any visual cues beyond a small thumbnail image which can be hard to see.

What else can we pull from Oembed to give users a better look at what they've inserted?
column83: 23/Aug/18 9:19 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;We specifically decided NOT to render the actual embed. What additional information would you like to see?
column84:
23/Aug/18 9:21 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;We need enough so that the editor can see what they actually embedded without having to hit preview and scroll down.

For example, if I embedded this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F5ehAGIGS-s

I currently get this:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

A title of the video in place of or next to "YouTube" would be helpful.
column85: 24/Aug/18 11:21 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;From Mike: "re: long titles... can we ellipse the text if it goes longer than one line"
column86:
29/Aug/18 10:21 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested the four most common embed types on http://content.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/content/%2F5b856fc415ed13da3c91659a

Confirmed that YouTube and Instagram look great.

However, Twitter and Facebook still don't show enough for a user to know the context.  Is there any additional data we can plumb in there?

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
column87: 29/Aug/18 10:22 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;No, unfortunately not. They just provide an opaque HTML block.
column88: 29/Aug/18 10:23 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Ok, thanks.  Will bear that in mind when I demo to users.

column1: Content Lookup In Text Block Needs Filter Options
column23: Need to add some filtering options to new content tool when doing a content lookup.  With so much similarly titled content, it's virtually impossible for editors to choose the correct thing.  We can use what's on production as a template (eg. filters for origin, editors, etc), but there may be other ways to do it.  Note, if the same content filtering as used in list view is used, it should NOT wipe the list view settings when a user returns to that screen.
column83: 28/Aug/18 10:11 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on dev.  Functionally, this delivers what is requested in the ticket, however, the search part of the screen is HUGE, you can't see any results without scrolling down.  Created IHRAR-4605 to figure out a more elegant way to do this.

column1: Content Lookup In Text Block Should Pre-Populate With Highlighted Text
column23: When inserting a content lookup link in the production content tool, when opening the content modal, the search box is pre-populated with the text that was highlighted in the text block.  The same should be done in the new version.
column83: 17/Sep/18 1:27 PM;TrinaKing@iheartmedia.com;Looks good in stage.

column1: Manual Link Insertion: Add Target Window Selector
column23: When manually inserting a link into a text block, editors should be able to choose whether the link opens in the current window or a new window.  New window should be selected by default.
column83: 23/Aug/18 9:17 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;This will require overriding the built-in link inline in quill, and recreating the UI from scratch. I don't even know how this will be possible.
column84:
11/Sep/18 4:01 PM;KrishnaGlick@iheartmedia.com;I'm with Mark here, unsure how feasible this would be.
https://quilljs.com/docs/modules/toolbar/#handlers
column85: 26/Feb/19 9:10 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Wonder if it'd be better to set relative links to same window and absolute links to new window?  I think iheart.com already has logic along these lines in the client, should we do the same on FiRE/Inferno?
column86: 26/Feb/19 9:16 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;That seems reasonable. We should be able to determine that using the URL library in ES6, and build up the link in the composed HTML appropriately.

column1: Add Exclusions Field to New Content Tool
column23:
Production allows users to exclude a brand/facet from recieving a piece of content.  For example, if something isn't appropriate for a single station - or if an alternate version of the content has been produced for a specific locale.

Please add this option to the new content tool.

 !image-2018-08-21-17-15-42-416.png|thumbnail!
column83: 23/Aug/18 3:12 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;0 point ticket for verification against IHRAR-4424
column84:
05/Sep/18 11:55 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on Stage.

Confirmed that the Exclusions box is visually presented and that you can add tags... however, found that when you click the "tag" button to narrow down which tags you want to see, if immediately publishes the article.

Can we make sure that selector box is de-coupled from the publish submit button?
column85: 05/Sep/18 3:02 PM;AdamRoberts@iheartmedia.com;This is a regui fix.
column86: 06/Sep/18 1:14 PM;AdamRoberts@iheartmedia.com;Latest regui has been included in refactor branch which includes a fix for this.
column87: 13/Sep/18 11:17 AM;TrinaKing@iheartmedia.com;Looks good in stage.

column1: Add Content Re-Distribution To New Content Tool
column23:
Production content tool allows editors to add an additional publishing target to the content tool in addition to the primary one.  This is used for distinct distributions where you want it to appear differently in different places; it's also used for non-editors to be able to make this content appear in a location that they manage (eg. local personality can tag a national article with their brand/topic for it to appear on their page)

We need to add this option to the new version of the content tool.

 !image-2018-08-21-17-13-55-685.png|thumbnail!
column83: 23/Aug/18 9:31 AM;AdamRoberts@iheartmedia.com;This work is already covered by IHRAR-4424. Some additional refinements are needed to the targeting model and interface.
column84: 23/Aug/18 3:11 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;0 point ticket for verification.
column85:
05/Sep/18 12:15 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.  Confirmed that the re-distribution blocks are present and that an editor who does not have permission to the article can apply a secondary distribution... however, clicking Publish seems to have no effect.  It just sits there.

https://content.radioedit.ihrint.com/content/%2F5b9000287712ab5c9d4200ff

Login as svc-RadioEditQA2/Welcome1 and try to apply an additional distribution and save.

Additionally,  noticed that the "distribution" field has been removed from the primary targeting section and is only available in the additional distributions.  Please re-add the distribution block to the main area so that the article can be distributed without a secondary distribution.

Further, noticed that a non-editor can change additional distributions that other users have applied to a content item.  Should those additional distributions be locked unless the user has permission to one of the brands associated with that distribution?
column86: 13/Sep/18 11:44 AM;TrinaKing@iheartmedia.com;Looks good in stage. Non-editor CANNOT change additional distributions also verified.

column1: Discourage Slug Change Once Content Is Published
column23:
Production content tool shows the slug as text with a button/link to edit... and then a warning about the bad side effects of changing a slug after initial publish.  Stage does not.

We need to make it a bit harder to change the slug after initial publish - and warn users with the same or similar messaging to what's in production today:

 !image-2018-08-21-17-09-08-268.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2018-08-21-17-09-30-421.png|thumbnail!
column83:
24/Aug/18 12:53 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on dev:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

This looks good to me.  Confirmed that cancel successfully aborts, and that edit makes the field editable.

column1: List View Sorting - Add Option To View By Last Modified Date
column23:
Content tool prod allows you to choose whether to sort by last modified date or publication date - and to choose ascending or descending.

New content tool does not give the option to view by last modified date, we should add that.

I don't know how critical it is to be able to change sort order, so probably can leave this out (eg. who wants to go back and see the first piece of content created in RadioEdit?)
column83:
30/Aug/18 2:49 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.  Found the Sort By option in the filters menu. Functionally this seems ok, although noticed that publication dates are not showing in list view for content created in the new tool.  Created IHRAR-4619 to address that.

It looks like instead of "Last Modified", it says "Recently Edited".  Can we update?

Also looks a little wonky having "Sort by" twice.  Can we show the actual selected value instead of that text?  Or, if not easily possible, lose the label text above?
column84: 05/Sep/18 12:17 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Update looks good on stage - thanks!

column1: Tune Up New Content Tool's Responsiveness
column23:
Need to finesse content tool so that it's functional on a mobile device.  Doesn't need to be perfect at this juncture, but does need some work to be shippable.

Pain points to focus on (as tested on an iPhone 8):

# -List view too wide even with left menu collapsed.  Move the pub date down below?-
# -Detail view - all blocks a little too wide.  Better but not perfect on landscape mode.-
# -Publish screen completely out of view-
# Feed view - probably the same as above
# -Help screen - too wide-

I suspect some of this could be solved via wrapping, others by zooming out a bit (i forget what the technical name for this that Trey mentioned was)
column83:
05/Sep/18 12:06 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage using the xCode emulator as an iPhone 8 - looking pretty good, but a few notes:

1) There is an issue with the publish tab.  When you have that open and swipe, the page behind moves - the actual publish tag is locked.  Please adjust so that when the publish screen is open, swiping affects that area

2) Content page scrolling, if you tap inside a text/tag field (ex. Editors), it scrolls the whole browser window down (eg. the left bar moves as well).  Compare against if you start a swipe outside of a text field where it just moves the content area.  Can we update so that if a user initiates their tap inside a tag/text field it behaves the same way as if they clicked outside of one?

Presets screen is a little wonky, but I'm not overly concerned with that at the moment.
column84:
06/Sep/18 8:33 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;1 appears to be a safari issue in general. I'll track it down.
2 is an iOS quirk. I'm pretty sure there's nothing I can do about that.
I don't see any wonkiness on the preset page. You're going to have to be more specific.
column85: 06/Sep/18 8:43 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;I've ticketed the scrolling issue separately since it is unrelated to responsive design: IHRAR-4660

column1: List filter router links
column23: Deactivate routerLink from active global link to prevent accidental clearing of filter params
column83: 21/Aug/18 3:53 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;preserveQueryParams pollutes the non-active links. You can assign routerLinkActive to a template variable on the a tag, but cannot use it in an ngIf else on the same element, or to set the routerLink to null for the current route if active. I can't think of another way to approach this, nor am I especially convinced that this is a problem.
column84: 27/Aug/18 3:38 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Can I grab some test instructions please?
column85: 27/Aug/18 3:42 PM;AdamRoberts@iheartmedia.com;The main problem addressed by this ticket was that clicking a link in the global navigation like "Content" while a user was already on the content list would clear the route params and therefore the search values, which would then be immediately saved in localstorage. The resolution to this was to disable clicking the currently "active" link in the global bar. Possible downsides to this are that you can no longer use the global navigation to navigate back to the list view from the edit view, though there still remains a standalone "back" link in the header of the edit page, as well as the back button in the browser.
column86:

column1: Saving a Broadcaster in Custom Talk is Resulting in Sporadic Missing Episodes
column23:
When an existing broadcaster is saved in the Tool, all active shows and episodes under that broadcasters umbrella will get messaged to AMP and search to all Licensees assigned to the broadcaster. I've identified instances where active episodes are not getting messaged and end up disappearing from the clients. I've also noticed that periodically a show will no longer be in search. 

Certain broadcasters can have hundreds, or even thousands, of shows under their umbrella, so saving a broadcaster can result in thousands of messages getting sent. I am starting to receive 502 or 504 after saving a broadcaster, so I assume the Offers process that messages AMP is timing out prior to all episodes/shows can be messaged, resulting in the missing elements in AMP.
column67:
1. Determine cause of dropped episodes/shows, and confirm if it is a timeout issue. 
2. Update Offers processing to ensure that when a broadcaster is saved in the Custom talk Tool, 100% of all active episodes are getting upserted to Mongo, takedowns are sent for non-active episodes, are active shows are sent to elastic for search. 
3. Work with Nate to test and confirm solution is working as expected.
column79:
1. Attempt to save a broadcaster in Custom Talk Tool staging and determine if a 504/502 error is returned. 
2. We may need to match Mongo with Postgres to determine if anything dropped. We can also review the front end to determine if episodes are missing from show pages or shows are missing from search following the save.

column1: Site Level Podcasts
column23:
Currently podcasts are specified at the page level - for any page that uses a podcast module.... Notably the homepage - but also a dedicated podcast page such as what FSR-PR has.

So that stations no longer have to go into the page screen - and so that we can create a podcast aggregate page by station without chasing 900 sites to go in and setup their podcasts a second time, and so that flagship can surface podcasts by station, we need to add a podcast field to the General tab (Probably right under Default Content Topics) where stations can specify their podcasts - and then on podcast blocks within single pages, add the option to use defaults or override (like we do for collection blocks).

From there, we'd need to migrate homepage podcasts to the general config - and set the homepage to use defaults (while keeping other pages using the overrides)

We'd want to make sure WebAPI has access to the podcasts as set by site.

After this is done, I'd probably use the master site to create a podcast page for distribution everywhere.. and in a followup ticket, add a view all link to the homepage podcast module pointing to the new podcast page.
column67:
# Podcast selector on General tab of site config similar to default content topics
# Podcast block in pages able to inherit site level settings (similar to collections)
# Script to move values present on homepage over to general tab
# Homepage podcast module set to inherit site level values by default

column1: Spike: Come up with final plan for scoped security system (BLOCKING SMT)
column23: This is a long, complex conversation.
column83: 23/Aug/18 10:40 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;[~tterry], I understand you are working on the followup ticket to this.  Please link to that ticket here.
column84:
23/Aug/18 12:09 PM;TravisTerry@iheartmedia.com;Epic: IHRAR-4580

phase 1 - new framework with scoped security
 * objectdb service(s) to manage policies generically (AR-4571)
 * objectdb to implement eval check on resource and bucket api calls (AR-4573)
 * user tool updates to manage user policy (AR-4574)
 * developer updates to manage app policy (AR-4575)
 * bucket updates to manage bucket policy (AR-4576)
 * proxy update to generate app-specific token (AR-4577)
 * migration script(s) to convert current observer_of security to policies for users, apps and buckets (AR-4578)

phase 2 - new taxonomy service
 * objectdb service(c) to manage new taxonomy, uses numeric id and allows rename (AR-4579)

column1: Markets, Providers, and Genres should display "display_name" instead of tag name
column23:
Markets, Providers, and Genres are linked to tags which can not be renamed. We need top add a new field called "display_name" to them and that is what should be displayed in SMT. This way when a market needs to be renamed it will update the display name and the market name will stay the same.

* Add display_name to market tags and populate them (script).
* Migrate stream, market, genre, provider data to include memberName and display_name
* Create custom tag-pill and tag-renderer component to include display_name and memberName.
* Update genre, market, and provider edit components to save display_name to taxonomy as well as SMT.
* Update edit stream component to display the display_name field while also saving the memberName to streams.
* Update AMP export APIs to use display_name and memberName accordingly.
* Update proxy APIs to take into account new field.

30/Aug/18 1:45 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Thanks Mark!

Did some further testing with MX selected as the country and found that live stations associated with a provider that is not available in MX (eg. Clear Channel) do not show up in search results for both Leads and Content.

However, it doesn't look like we ever built out country support for lookups in the Search Overrides tool.  That appears to be pulling the US catalog regardless of which country is selected (and there is no option to select a country in the search modal).  I suspect this is no better or worse than what is currently in place for CA that it shouldn't block launching MX.  As such, if you wanted to setup a search override for a catalog item that doesn't exist in US, you'd need to manually supply link/title/etc.

Created IHRAR-4614 to upgrade to the current catalog lookup, but given that I haven't heard any complaints from CA on this, not sure how urgent it is.  

Attempted to also test podcast, artists, and tracks - but as Mexico hasn't yet been setup as a country in Custom Talk Prod, can't test podcasts.  And from talking with Chris Graham, artists and tracks are not planned for MX, so unable to test those.

column1: Spike: Solve for www.iheartradio.com redirect requirements
column23:
On July 31st, we updated the fastly config for news.iheart.com to redirect the root to news.iheart.com/news via 301 redirect - and for all standard content detail pages to 301 redirect instead of the existing 302.

Unfortunately this had the unintended side effect of causing www.iheartradio.com to also redirect to news.iheart.com/news, since that is a secondary domain on IHM-IP... and the way FiRE is built, a secondary domain will always redirect to the primary domain before doing anything else.  This caused users going to www.iheartradio.com from marketing materials to reach the news page instead of the www homepage.  As such, the fastly update was rolled back.

Need to solve for the following use cases:

*+news.iheart.com+*
# root / should 301 redirect to https://news.iheart.com/news
# standard content detail pages should 301 redirect to the www.iheart.com version of the page
# all other pages should behave like normal fire sites (either loading the page or hitting search override)

*+www.iheartradio.com and iheartradio.com:+*
# root / should 301 redirect to https://www.iheart.com
# standard content detail pages should 301 redirect to the www.iheart.com version of the page
# all other pages should behave like normal fire sites and serve on IHM-IP/news.iheart.com... 

Worth nothing that for subpages on www.iheartradio.com, since this domain hasn't been primary in years, all links of value likely hit the redirect tool already - which can be done both on the FiRE side and on the www side. 

For transparency, the aforementioned fastly update hit on all of the above points except #1 for www.iheartradio.com/iheartradio.com
column67:
# Engineering review between RadioEdit and Flagship team to determine best approach
# Jira tickets created for any followup work needed to implement recommended solution.
column83: 22/Aug/18 3:48 PM;TravisTerry@iheartmedia.com;Create a fastly redirect for iheartradio.com and www.iheartradio.com to www.iheart.com. See SREONCALL-295
column84: 23/Aug/18 11:18 AM;TravisTerry@iheartmedia.com;Turns out SREONCALL is the wrong place for that ticket. [~ccrnyc2msw] please coordinate with SRE when you want to add update the fastly rules again.

column1: Site Manager Admin Screens Should Clear API Cache
column23:
Right now when you make a change to a single site, microsite, the master site, or master microsite, the appropriate caches are cleared so that users don't need to wait 12 hours for the changes to appear.

This doesn't appear to be working for changes in the "Admin" screen, notably Ad Positions, but quite likely Admin Overrides and Segments as well.

Upon saving a change in Ad Positions, Segments, or Admin Overrides, the appropraite CDN caches should be invalidated so that upon clear of the FiRE page cache, the updated settings are immediately reflected.

column23:

Support has gone through and fixed one at a time (by checking the "FCC Public File" checkbox in the Nav screen and saving), but I'm wondering if something went wrong in the SM update that caused a bunch of these to blank..

Unfortunately the SM export option doesn't include this data point, so I'm blind about how many sites are affected by this.

Possible to get an export of :

Slug, FCC Public FIle (checkbox under nav)

And if not too much extra work, the broadcast facility data?

column1: Distribution refinements
column23:
- Change publishing data in the content record to be a list of objects like:
[{id: "xyz", what: [], where: []}, {id: "abc", what: [], where: []}]
 
- When the server loads a content item it should annotate publishing records with editability.
[{id: "xyz", what: [], where: [], readonly: true}, {id: "abc", what: [], where: [], readonly: false}]
 
- When the content tool saves distributions it will send everything to the server to sort out.
 
- Add evergreen option in place of publish range, show publish range only when evergreen is unchecked.
 
- Targeting info should be saved during create based on preset. if !published { saveTargeting() } save()

- Change targeting to have single topic and origin. Origin is a combobox like it is today. Create a "Add Another Distribution" button which adds an additional set of topic and "wheres". Have some visible separations between sets of things to make it clear what's going on.
