column1: Change bad link logic
column23:
This is the followup ticket to IHRAR-4262, where we generated a bad list of links to circulate to the markets.

We need to make two changes to the original selection criteria (which I manually filtered out of the list we distributed to the markets after seeing a number of false positives):

/playlist/ criteria should be modified to exclude any that start with https://www.iheart.com/playlist (eg. leaving any relative links - or links on a single station site to be removed - we only want to purge /playlist/ links that aren't on https://www.iheart.com)
/photos/ should be modified to exclude any that also have /topic/ in the URL. So /photos/main/ should remain on the list.... but /topic/photos/ would be excluded from the purge.

column1: Enhancement Request: Presets in Leads
column23:
As a content creator, I would like the ability to have a preset field like in the content tool so I can set up my team with specific presets I've created for my different market uses.

From Wesley Sharp:

It would be awesome if we could set up presets, like we do in the content tool, for the leads tool. Especially since we are now using it for more than just the homepage.

Common Presets:            Home Lead ‚Äì All Stations
                                                Home Lead ‚Äì Specific station
                                                Daily Email ‚Äì Specific station
                                                Featured Promo ‚Äì Specific Station

That way station targeting and the topic will already be scheduled and all we need to do is upload a picture and add the title and links.

column1: Discontinue SoundCloud Auto Thumb Exraction
column23:
SoundCloud doesn't return an https asset in their oembed, so when we go to render it in a collection card, it throws a mixed content error and does not display.

We need to disable auto thumb extraction for SoundCloud embeds until they fix on their end.

This is pending a conversation w/ Paul Miraldi on what technical and legal limitations are present on thumbnail extraction.

https://soundcloud.com/oembed?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsoundcloud.com%2Fwalk-the-moon%2Fone-foot&amp

column1: Grab publish date for summary from mtime on live version, not publish date on targeting
column23: Right now the publish date shown in the content summary is misleading. Grab the mtime off the live version, not the publish date listed in the targeting record, which is actually the publish start date.

column1: Nav Cleanup - Purge Old Links
column23:
This is the followup ticket to IHRAR-4264, where we generated a bad list of links to circulate to the markets.

We need to make two changes to the original selection criteria (which I manually filtered out of the list we distributed to the markets after seeing a number of false positives):

# /playlist/ criteria should be modified to exclude any that start with https://www.iheart.com/playlist (eg. leaving any relative links - or links on a single station site to be removed - we only want to purge /playlist/ links that aren't on https://www.iheart.com)
# /photos/ should be modified to exclude any that also have /topic/ in the URL.  So /photos/main/ should remain on the list.... but /topic/photos/ would be excluded from the purge.

Once we have the final list, purge as follows at 2PM on August 2nd:

* If link in question is a parent/top level item, change the href value to # so that the label remains in tact
* Else, delete the entire navigation link/title/target.

Exclude microsite navigation for now.

column1: Search override edits are not retained
column23: Edits made to a Search Override redirect by RadioEdit users with DPD role or access to Site Manager are not being saved/retained.
column67: Edits made to a Search Override redirect are retained after saving.
column79:
1. Log in to Site Manager (using a DPD account)
2. Navigate to a station's Search Override tab
3. Create a new redirect and save.
4. Make an edit to the redirect (change the date or make permanent) and hit save.
5. Original settings are retained instead of saving the edit.
column83: 31/Jul/18 4:28 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;The method we are using to make atomic updates to redirects, a $set by id within an array, will not work when the user is not an admin because it is already searching by id in order to enforce permissions, and mongo gets confused. Due to this limitation, we will need to find another way to make atomic updates to redirects. [~mbrown] suggested doing a $pull by id, and then a $push to add the updated version of the redirect.
column84:
01/Aug/18 3:26 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage as RadioEditQA2 which has DPD access with WKTU-FM. 

Created a redirect and confirmed it successfully saved.

Edited a pre-existing local item and confirmed the changes saved.

Deleted a local item and confirmed the changes saved.

Customized a national item and confirmed the changes saved.

Restored a national item and confirmed the changes saved.

Excluded a national item and confirmed the changes saved.

This looks good to me.

column23:

An issue came up from the editorial team where they wanted to embed a video reply to a tweet - but couldn't include the parent tweet as there was profanity in it.

column1: Microsites Missing Domain In Canonical and Sitemap Links
column23:
Now that Google is crawling our new sitemaps, seeing quite a few microsites where the canoncial url of the microsite on Fire pages and the linked sitemap xml files are missing the primary domain.

As a result, Google is logging errors with our sitemaps and because there is no valid canonical URL for the microsite pages in question, it can't index them.

Unsure how widespread this is, but for stations that have a dozen or so microsites, it seems to be happening to half of them.
column83: 13/Jul/18 11:15 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;I generated a list of urls, put them in a bash forloop, and had bash open one at a time in chrome. then I clicked the save button 190 times. This seems to have resolved the immediate issue. Matt has a query that will allow us to check in a few days if this is still happening, or if perhaps it was a bug in the old system.
column84:
13/Jul/18 11:17 AM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;db query used for the listing: 

db.metadata.sites.sites.find({schema: "index", "object.type": "microsite", "object.microsite.primary_domain": {$in: [null, ""]}})
.forEach(r => print(`${r._id}, ${r.object.slug}, ${r.object.microsite.primary_site}`))
column85: 13/Jul/18 11:30 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Thanks guys.  The examples above and a few i've spot checked in Google beyond these look good now.
column86: 17/Jul/18 10:45 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Checked again today and no more records have occurred.

column95:
31/Oct/18 2:24 PM;NateTobin2@iheartmedia.com;If it would be helpful, this is the sql I use to check the cron status of an individual show:

SELECT
pt.partner_name,
s.show_id,
s.show_title,
q.trigger_name,
q.next_fire_time, qt.cron_expression,
TIMESTAMP '1970-01-01' + ((prev_fire_time/1000)-14400) * INTERVAL '1 second' as last_fired,
TIMESTAMP '1970-01-01' + ((next_fire_time/1000)-14400) * INTERVAL '1 second' as next_fire,
now() - (TIMESTAMP '1970-01-01' + ((prev_fire_time/1000)-14400) * INTERVAL '1 second') as time_since_last_fire, s.last_modified
FROM talk.show s
left join talk.qrtz_triggers q on s.show_id = cast (q.trigger_name as int)
left join talk.production_status p on s.show_id = p.production_id
left join talk.broadcaster b on s.broadcaster_id = b.broadcaster_id
left join talk.qrtz_cron_triggers qt on q.trigger_name = qt.trigger_name
left join talk.partner pt on b.partner_id = pt.partner_id
where  
 s.show_id = 27577861

column1: Exclude Microsite Timelines From Sitemap When There Is No Content
column23:
We're currently including a timeline sitemap for all microsites, regardless of whether there is content owned by that microsite.

Google sees the blank linked sitemap xml and flags as an error.

Need a way to suppress the timeline from a microsite is that site doesn't actually have any content to show.
column67: # Microsites that don't own any content should not have a timeline.xml included in the sitemap.
column83:
17/Jul/18 8:42 AM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;It is very expensive - no, I mean, VERY expensive - to test the publishing system on every page load for a sitemap that no one sees.

Since the ask surrounds the fact that Google errors on a blank sitemap, maybe a much more reasonable approach is to just make sure the sitemap is never blank.

To make sure the sitemap is never blank, we'll add topic pages. When we have the closed topic list we can add them all, but for now we'll just hardcode one popular topic into the list. 

This will cause google to not barf on the sitemap and it will save us from destroying the publishing system.
column84: 17/Jul/18 8:44 AM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;Instead of a blank topic page, we'll combine pages and content which will insure the sitemap is not blank.
column85: 17/Jul/18 8:48 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;I like that solution!
column86:
20/Jul/18 9:01 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage, generally speaking, this looks good as there are no blank linked sitemaps.

However, this will break the planned sitemap for Default which will be proxied from www.iheart.com.  We need to still have /sitemap/timeline.xml for the site level distinct so as non-content pages do not exist on www.iheart.com. (eg. default.fire.iheart.com/sitemap/timeline.xml will be proxied over to www.iheart.com/sitemap/timeline.xml)

Can we keep the microsite timeline/pages sitemaps merged as they are now - but split the site level ones back out?
column87: 20/Jul/18 9:02 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Sure.
column88:
25/Jul/18 2:33 PM;TrinaKing@iheartmedia.com;Looks good in staging: https://mike-dv.fire.ihrint.com/sitemap.xml 

Compared against linked microsites in Site Manager, and against prod sitemap.xml.

column1: Local Search Overrides Should Trump National Ones
column23:
In production today, local admins can setup a search override which will override a national one with the same source URL or search term.

Unfortunately in the refactor, locally created search overrides are getting appended to the bottom of the list - and since FiRE seems to use the first one it comes across, the national item is being used.
column67: # If both a local and national redirect/search override are setup and active for the same url/path, the local item should take priority
column79:
http://site-manager.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/brands/site/994c6f17688f2ee84dccfc4bbd409aa7/Imported/keywords

there's a national redirect for /honda (pointing to the microsite), and a local redirect (pointing to honda.com)

On FiRE, the national redirect is the one that is used.
http://wktu-fm.fire.radioedit.ihrint.com/honda
column83:
12/Jul/18 3:54 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on dev at http://site-manager.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/#/brands/site/658578cd8ac639c767a6a54cbf16cdf7/Imported/keywords

Changed the nationally setup /honda redirect to point to https://www.honda.com

Change the national "Jungle Hack" search override to point to https://www.yahoo.com

Used the omit function to remove /jingleday... confirmed that it turns black, but strangely moves to the top of the list (when the bottom would be a better place for it.  Created IHRAR-4382 to adjust).

Omitted /festival and re-activated it.  

No problems observed in the tool.

Tested on front end using all of the above on mike-dv.fire.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com.  All looks good.

column1: Running Dedupe Process through Custom Talk Tool returns 502 error
column23: As podcast content manager, I want to ensure duplicate episodes are removed. Shows periodically repost episodes on their RSS feeds, resulting in duplicates on our end. The Custom Talk Tool has a feature that reports all current duplicates and then has a takedown option to remove the older duplicates from our service. I've been attempting to run over the last couple of days and each time I get a 502 error.
column67:
1. Determine what is causing the de-dupe process to error out. 
2. Resolve issue so we can continue to identify and remove duplicates.
column79:
1. Open Custom Talk Tool in production and select the 'Episode De-Dupe' link in the left hand menu. This will trigger the generation of the duplicate report. 
2. Confirm that a 502 error is returned rather than the report.

column1: Expose gui and introspection on graphiql link
column82: Load /graphiql and view schema explorer: https://v-e7e23a04.radioedit.iheart.com/graphiql
column83:
10/Jul/18 12:41 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Discussed with Mark on HipChat.  This ticket is to update the graphiql interface to a newer version at the request of the web team.

While testing this, found it quirky that you need to manually set the request.credentials value, which seems like a steps backwards to me.  As this was an engineering-requested change and engineering is the primary consumer of this interface, I'm ok with shipping as is - with the understanding that once the underlying issue is resolved (https://github.com/prismagraphql/graphql-playground/issues/741), we would update to no longer require a user to change request.credentials.  

{quote}[11:08 AM] Mark Cahill: open settings, and change this:
[11:08 AM] Mark Cahill:
    "request.credentials": "same-origin",
[11:09 AM] Mark Cahill: it's a one-time setting change that it won't allow us to control from the server, try as we might{quote}

column1: HTML Sitemap API Spike
column23:
What APIs need to be changed in order to support a NY TImes-style HTML sitemap where we can segment content by year/month - with a list view pointing to individual detail pages?

http://spiderbites.nytimes.com/
column67:
# Discussion of steps needed to get API support for the above
# Jira tickets created for next steps
column83: 09/Jul/18 9:34 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;This is to think through which APIs need to change to support an HTML sitemap... how to return content segmented by month/year to generate pages similar to what the NY Times has.
column84: 18/Jul/18 3:13 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Pubsub will need a new parameter for pub_start $gte, potentially called pub_after. Fire will generate two levels of static HTML pages for year and month, and will then reach out to pubsub to grab that one month's content for that site. On the site's HTML sitemap, there will be a link to the microsite's HTML sitemap for each of its owned microsites.
column85:
18/Jul/18 3:47 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;I want to make sure we're hitting all the technical points from the SEO audit.

From page 60:

{quote}Recommended HTML Sitemap Format

Technical standards for developing an HTML sitemap are:

* The sitemap can be organized by date or topic

Fire change: AR-4401

column1: Build System - Switch to Internal Version Numbers
Country admins should be able to create new markets
column23:
Country admins currently do not have access the markets collection so they are not able to create new markets in taxonomy.

We need to expose a service in SMT which adds tags and updates metadata for a tag.

We also need to turn off ability to rename markets in SMT because renaming a market recreates a tag in Taxonomy which unlinks every resource using that market tag. This is a security issue.
column67:
* Country Admins should be able to create new markets
* Country Admins should not be able to rename markets
column83:
24/Jul/18 1:43 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage using RadioEditQA3 which is a country admin for Canada.

Confirmed that I can access the create market screen, however, this user does not have sufficient access to complete all required fields:

# Market Name is required but the field is disabled
# State is required, but no options are available

Unable to test the creation process at this time as I am blocked from saving the new market.  

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
column84:
25/Jul/18 8:15 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;Market name is required and generated from city and state. There is nothing to be filled in by the user.

As for states being blank for Canada, it seems the states taxonomy in stage is missing Canada country to state controlling relationship. Meaning when a country admin has access to a country they should have access to the states by relationship. For some reason the relationships were removed but I have added them back in.
column85: 25/Jul/18 12:39 PM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;Updated script to add controlling country tag to states.
column86:
30/Jul/18 2:14 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Re-tested on stage with RadioEditQA3.

Successfully created a market "NEWCITY-MB".  Confirmed that I can see the new market in the list view and edit.

Having a field for market name in the current presentation doesn't make sense to me since it is never editable.  Created IHRAR-4438 to address.

Also noticed we're still referencing "Arbitron" throughout the product, despite the fact that Arbitron became Nielsen in 2013.  Created AR-4439 to address.

column1: SMT 4: Country Admin Genre Creation
column23:
Brand should not be a required field for new genre creation, not all genre's have brands. i.e, Pride. 

Also, countries is not showing when creating a genre -- wouldn't this cause a data error? Should the country admin have access to countries list but limited to just their country?
column83:
23/Jul/18 8:40 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;I'm ok with removing brand as being required.

As for countries, this field is what determines whether a country sees this genre in their list. This needs to be disabled (at the moment) because it will allow for country admins to remove other countries from the genre.

What I can do is if its as new genre allow for the user to add their country. But once they save its disabled for our global admins to modify. We can create another JIRA for better handling this scenario in the future.
column84: 23/Jul/18 11:09 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Clarification... it would be disabled for country admins... but global admins would still be able to, correct?
column85: 30/Jul/18 10:21 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;correct
column86:
13/Aug/18 11:28 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage as RadioEditQA3 which is an NZ country admin.

Confirmed that I was able to create http://stream-manager.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/genre/edit/130 without supplying a brand.  This seems to be good to me.

[~1119007], can you give a look?
column87: 13/Aug/18 11:35 AM;GregCerchione@iheartmedia.com;This looks good. I created a new genre w/o brand, and successfully applied it to a station without error. Also, country was limited to just NZ - which is perfect.

column23:
Observing errors when creating providers as a Canada Country Admin. 

They are not able to add originating country, or country in which the genre should appear. Can both of these dropdowns be limited just to Canada for each? When i try to save without these values and just the name of the provider, it gives me an invalid data error.

*Please note: The workflow here should be the same for all Country Admins (AU/NZ, etc)*

08/Aug/18 12:54 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage using RadioEditQA3 which is setup as a NZ country admin.

Successfully created a new provider (http://stream-manager.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/provider/edit/56) and confirmed that only permissioned countries (for this user, NZ only) appear for both the countries and originating countries fields.

Went to the providers list and while the new provider wasn't shown there initially, upon a hard refresh, it did appear.  Unsure if this workflow is used often enough to justify troubleshooting why the new provider didn't appear on the screen on initial load.

column1: Site Manager Value Not Saving Properly
column23:
When I try to update a field on a page's block, Site Manager says it's saved, but a refresh of the page show that it isn't the case.

This is happening in dev and stage.
column79:
Specific case:

1. Open up site manager.
2. Bring up "WRUM-FM".
3. Click on "Pages".
4. Click on "Home Page" (i.e. "/", the root page).
5. Scroll down to the "main:events" block.
6. Enter a value into the "Title" field (e.g. "Eventos").
7. Click "Save Page".
8. Note that site manager confirms the successful saving of the page.
9. Reload the page.
10. Note that the value as entered in step 6 is missing.

column1: Genre, Feed, and RDS Pi Code Changing to Default Values Upon Save
column23: In SMT stage, when you go into a stream, the Primary Genre, Feed, and RDS Pi Code values are not correctly reading from existing values and are populating with defaults.  Upon save, those default settings are being stored instead of the correct values.
column67: # RDS Pi Code, Feed, and Primary Genre should not be changed to default values upon saving in SMT stage
column79:
# Login to SMT Stage and select a station that hasn't been recently edited
# Note that RDS Pi Code is blank, primary genre is default, and Feed has defaulted to a stream-based value
# Change another value somewhere else in the tool and save
# Go to changes tab and see that in addition to the field you changed, genre, feed, and RDS Pi code have also changed.
column83: 13/Jul/18 10:25 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;After some testing it seems the issue is rds_pi_code. It wasn't being set in the edit stream screen so it always showed as blank. Genre and feed are properly being compared in the change requests screen. The default genre was done with the stream migration script.
column84:
20/Jul/18 10:17 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage by updating http://stream-manager.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/stream/edit/109

Confirmed that RDS Pi code is populated, primary genre is default, and that feed has a URL.

Changed the description to add an exclamation point at the end and saved.  Confirmed that save was successful and I was taken back to the stream list.

Confirmed that the description change shows up and that the RDS Pi code no longer shows as changed.

However, genre is still showing a change from Country to Default... when this value was not changed in the tool.  Is there a reason the changes screen shows that the genre has been updated?

Also seeing that the changes screen indicates that the Feed value was previously stored as null, but shows a change to www.iheart.com/live/109/ - even though this value was not changed in my edit.

Is there a reason the changes screen is showing values that weren't actually changed?

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
column85:
20/Jul/18 10:40 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;I think we were talking earlier about a migration that went bad and put the streams into a bad states. The Primary Genre is set to default but default is missing from the genres array. The app is fixing the issue.

I would try editing a stream, approving the change request, and then editing the same stream. You shouldn't see the same issue again.
column86: 24/Jul/18 10:10 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Discussed on standup today.  My goal is to make sure that when we release to prod that we don't have these issues.  Wherever we need to update/verify, let's do it.
column87: 25/Jul/18 1:18 PM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;Found the issue. Trying to keep the script atomic and allowing for the script to be run multiple times, on subsequent runs fields which were integers are now strings. When typecasting the field to int I did not check to see if the field was a tag causing the typecast to return 0 which is the id for genres/Default. This is why all of the streams were updated to genres/Default. I have made an update to the script which should not cause this again.
column88:
31/Jul/18 9:32 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage at http://stream-manager.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/stream/edit/1981, updating name and description.

I am still seeing the Primary Genre as default upon load.  

Saved station and am still seeing the genre as changed in the changes screen.  Feed is also changing values despite how no changes were made in the tool.

As of right now, I can't verify this ticket.  

Discussed with Alex, once he resolves the 500 error on the API, he's going to take another look at this.
column89: 07/Aug/18 10:28 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;I took a look and fixed the feed field. The others should be working fine now. LEt me know if you run into any other issues.
column90:
07/Aug/18 11:57 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage using http://stream-manager.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/stream/edit/1985

Upon initial load, observed the primary genre is still shown as default, even though in the API it's classic rock:

 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

Changed description and saved.

Went to changes screen and observed that the feed is no longer showing as a changed value... but that the genre which was previously Classic Rock (even though it wasn't shown in the tool) is now default.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

I still don't think this is working.

If the existing genre is Classic Rock, that's what should be shown on the Stream screen.  Updating another data point on the stream should not cause the genre to change to default.  

Note, feed and Pi were not an issue on this test.

column1: Show Call Letters In List View
column23: As a digital stream manager, i want the call sign of a station to be shown in the stream list view so that I can easily see which station I want to work with if I don't know the stream ID or station name.
column67:
# Call letters of a station shown in list view next to the ID number

Eg:
ID: 1234 | WZZZ-FM
ID: 9876 | WAAA-HD2
ID: 555 | WMN-AM
ID: 7 | IHRTEST-FL

column1: Country and Brand dropdowns should be open to admins
column23: Admins should be able to choose any brand and country when using SMT. We shouldn't have to add countries and brands to their account because this opens up some security concerns in RadioEdit.
column67: Admins can choose any country / brand but doesn't have countries and brand attached to their accounts
column83: 03/Jul/18 10:07 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;The way to test this is so have stream-manager:global-admin set on the account and not adding "countries" and "brands" to the account. The user should still be able to choose any country and any brand.
column84: 05/Jul/18 10:51 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Reviewed with Alex.  He's making a change to address how a user setup with the above permissions (RadioEditQA2 on stage) can't currently access any brands they haven't been explicitly permissioned to or access any of the market tags.
column85:
06/Jul/18 8:18 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Re-tested on Stage using QA2.  Confirmed that I can now apply a market and brand to a stream even if I don't have permissions to those in Taxonomy - based on the global-admin permission.

Removed the global-admin permission and confirmed that I can't access any streams - and can only create streams for brands and markets that I have permission to via user manager.  However, noticed, that even with permission to a market, I can't see streams associated with that market (eg. gave NEWYORK-NY market permission, but don't see any of the streams that are associated with that market in my list.  Not sure that this is a common use case as stream management isn't really done at the market level.

Added country-admin to the same user and confirmed that without a country permission, there are no functional options within the tool.  Add countries/US and confirmed that all US streams are visible - as well as changes/markets/etc.  Also confirmed that within streams I can add any US-based market or brand (but not any canada brands or markets).

Found an issue where provider admins cannot currently apply markets to their stations, which blocks them from saving.  Discussed with Greg whether the preference was to allow selection of any market - or to individual permission markets to each provider's admin and decided on the former.  Created IHRAR-4316 to address, but that's not a blocker for launch as domestic provider admins aren't getting access to this tool immediately.

column1: Content Tool Bulk Change Operations
column23: As a digital support technician, i want to be able to perform bulk operations on a number of content items at the same time so that I can quickly respond to takedown requests by legal or local staff to make updates without having to engage the development team.
column67:
# Ability to select content to be affected by a change by any combination of origin, topic, author (AD ID), content type, and/or publish date window
# Content to be affected by the proposed change should be shown in a list with a link to view the content; and a total count of affected items
# Ability to batch change the origin, publication status, and TBD
# Functionality should be limited to Digital Support staff members and sysadmins.
column83: 29/Mar/19 10:43 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;This seems like a fairly large ticket, and should probably be broken down further. I would estimate that it would probably be more than 8 points, and I don't think one engineer could implement this entire feature in a single sprint.

column1: Go To Edit Screen After Creating Partner/Ingested Article
column23: As a National Content Editor, I would like to be taken directly to the edit screen for a piece of partner content I created so that I can immediately edit and publish the article without having to search for it in the content tool.
column67: # Upon hitting "create" on a partner content article, the editor who created the content should be taken to the edit screen for the piece of content they created
column83:
09/Jul/18 8:16 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Original Notes:

Current workflow
- click into partners tab in Content
- select article I would like to ingest
- enter in Editor value in popup
- Content Article listing, default My Content list shown
- change Origin filter to either Only Feed or Show Both
- Select Article I just ingested
- Make target/module/content changes and publish

Proposed workflow enhancement
- click into partners tab in Content
- select article I would like to ingest
- enter in Editor value in popup and click Continue
- Content article edit screen for article I just selected to ingest
- Make any target/module/content edits and publish
column84: 23/Jul/18 11:53 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Yes, upon clicking create on a feed item, you are placed in the content editor with an unsaved draft of a content item that has been created from that feed item.
column85: 23/Jul/18 2:20 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on dev.  Confirmed that upon selection/creation of a piece of ingested content that I am immediately taken into the edit screen for that piece of content.  This looks good to me.

column1: Content List View No Longer Remembers Filter Settings
column23:
Upon release of the catalog/content lookup functionality in the content tool, the list view (main screen) no longer retains your filter settings when you return to the main screen.

This functionality is highlighted in several pieces of documentation about the Content tool, and has generated a stream of negative feedback since that functionality disappeared.

We need to find a way to allow users to search for a piece of content to insert via a link, but retain the ability for a user to get right to the list of content they're interested in upon arriving on the main screen/list view of the content tool.
column67:
# Filters set for an individual user/browser in Content Tool list view should be retained until cleared or edited by a user
# Choosing to insert a content link or block should not default to the filtered settings, but should allow a user to do a one-off filter to find the content they are looking for
column83:
27/Jun/18 2:47 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;This was removed from the old tool because it was buggy and broke the page.

In the refactor we can attempt to implement this again.

Sources of data should be URL and Local Storage.
column84: 09/Jul/18 9:10 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;From Trey: "we should store the filter data in local storage. read it from the URL if it's there, otherwise read from local, always store it"

column1: Spike: What do permissioned users see in Playlists?
column23: As a product manager, I want a review of the playlist tool to determine what changes are needed to accommodate various user types so that I have an idea of how we'll make that change
column67:
# Engineering and product review of existing playlist tool permission capabilities and limitations
# Review of proposed user levels and exploration of best way to achieve desired permissions in the tool
# Followup tickets created to implement recommended solution
column83:
05/Jul/18 11:08 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;George and I discussed this morning.  The goal is to base permissions on what we currently have in Content and Leads where one or more editor tag is applied to a playlist.

Playlists editors could be brands or providers just like leads... we'd also look to add a namespace for record labels (eg. so that we could allow Universal or Warner Records to create a playlist in the tool.  Down the road, we'd also think through using artists as an editor namespace (eg, if we wanted to give the ability for individual artists to create and manage their own playlists).  

Unsure that we need to a country admin as providers are country specific.

Need to think through the relationship between brands and providers.  For example, how could the playlist guy at Bell Canada change any playlists of brands from that provider without us having to dole out individual brand permissions.  

Would still need global admins (eg. Kavi) who could adjust anything.

Upon initial rollout, we'd need to batch apply permissions to existing playlists.

Sample User Levels:

# Global Playlist User/Admin - ability to create and adjust all playlists app-wide - both dynamic and manual playlists
# Provider Playlist User - ability to create and adjust all playlists where that provider is an editor - or by any of the brands associated with that provider.  Ability to specify whether these users should be able to manage dynamic playlists and/or manual playlists.
# Record Label Playlist User - ability to create and adjust all playlists where that label is an editor (or, down the road, any artists that are associated with that label). This use case would be manual playlists only
# Market Playlist User- Ability to create and adjust all playlists where that market is an editor, including owned by sites/microsites associated with that market.  Ability to specify whether these users should be able to manage dynamic playlists and/or manual playlists.  (initially, it would be manual playlists only)
# Brand Playlist User - Ability to create and adjust all playlists where that brand is an editor, including those owned by microsites associated with the site brand.   Ability to specify whether these users should be able to manage dynamic playlists and/or manual playlists.  (initially, it would be manual playlists only)

Note, out of scope for this ticket, but to be solved in Q4 is the locale-specific distribution and customization of playlists... eg, which are available in Canada, what needs to be translated, solving tracks that aren't available in a given region.
column84:
11/Jul/18 1:43 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Discussed on the phone with George today.

There's two separate components... how we tag playlists - and how we know what to show users.  

Tickets: 

# One for adding editor tagging at the playlist level (first ticket)
# Playlist visibility (both in list and detail view) to only show playlists that a user has access to.  Need to figure out how to show playlists by taxonomy.  Mirror after the current leads setup. (second ticket)
# Taxonomy for Record Labels. Is this in a new taxo bucket, or do we tack on to vendors or providers? (may not be required for MVP)

First two should not be in the same sprint.  3rd may come later.

Questions: 

# If we have an outside user (eg. record rep or Cumulus employee), is there any additional permissioning we need to have to keep them out of other areas - Is support allocating the correct permissions in user manager enough?

column84:
27/Jun/18 4:50 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;Short Term Solution:
SMT will have to proxy or manage taxo lookups on the server based on the user's security. Right now, linking country to markets will break leads and invalidate much of the security held there.

Long Term Solution:
1. Extend taxo relationship data to have a name. Names can be either "bucket:<bucket_name>" or "user:<whatever_string>".
2. ObjectDB should stop using general purpose relationships (unnamed relations) for security. Instead it should limit tag relationship lookup to include the name "bucket:<bucket_being_accessed>" or "bucket:<prefix_of_dotted_bucket_name>".
3. Taxo application should represent multiple relationships and allow editing of those.

This will give us the ability to maintain separate permission hierarchies per bucket. We cannot do this per application because there is no secure method for determining which application a query is for. With separate permission hierarchies per bucket and with objectdb selecting the current buckets permissions we can more tightly control where the meaningful relationships are.

column1: Switch brand spec to use test brand instead of KTU
Ensure that only tag objects are selected when ObjectDb expands memberships
column23:
When resolving tags for membership expansion, ObjectDb is only filtering on non-deleted and memberName. Relationship objects (which are not tags) also have an object.memberName property.  We can't make ObjectDB simply exclude relationship objects without incurring a performance hit (i.e. would have to do {"schema": {"$ne": "relationship"}}).

Possible solutions:
1) move relationship objects to a new bucket
2) change structure in relationship properties so that the ObjectDB tag query doesn't match

Both are roughly equivalent in effort, because they require a migration and changes to both the taxo and taxo-ingestion apps
column82:
This change largely can not be verified by a platform user, except for a couple checks that can be performed:

1) view the "taxonomy" bucket in explorer and verify that there is no ".related/" folder at the top of the list.
2) In the taxonomy tool, add and remove a related tag, refreshing in-between actions to ensure that the change really took effect.
column83:

Removed the same tag and saw the same thing... it's still present in the list, but it does not immediately disappear.  Hard refreshed the page and found that the related tag is still there, so this does not appear to be working.  

http://taxonomy.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/collections/mike-test
column84: 19/Jun/18 10:27 AM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;Looks like my test notes weren't awesome. When you make a change to related tags in the tool, we purge Fastly cache for the affected tags (and listings), but there is still a browser cache of 1 minute. So if you have the chrome dev tools open (which disables cache), you *may* see updates right away, but it's not guaranteed, because a CDN purge isn't instantaneous.  Waiting a minute or two and then refreshing should always show that the changes happened.

column23:
In site manager's "Linked Microsites" and "Distribution" screens, you can see a list of all associated sites.  Users who have permission to one of the linked brands shown should be able to click into that site's SM page directly. column1: [A/B Admin UI] JSON editor for overrides
column23:
* UserId is a string now, and yes we need to change field validation to accept free strings.

* Would you enhance the UI so that it can also take in a String of json object to represents multiple overrides to be added? One of the requests from our users is the ability to batch create the same set of overrides for multiple tests. If they can simply paste the same long list of users overrides json it will make their life easier.
column83:
25/Jun/18 12:35 PM;KailuoWang@iheartmedia.com;seems you made it an empty array by default. This endpoint actually takes in an object like { ‚Äú12314‚Äù : ‚ÄúB‚Äù , "32562": "A"}
so an empty object {} might be a more appropriate default value? other that it looks good to me.
column84: 25/Jun/18 12:47 PM;YehudaRosen@iheartmedia.com;That's intentional - the app-side API wants an array of them, so that it can group by feature, validate, etc before sending it to the abtest server in the format you mentioned.
column85:
29/Aug/18 2:48 PM;YehudaRosen@iheartmedia.com;[~1110604] This is back up on stage, ready for your review.

As discussed previously the format used by the UI is a little different from what is sent to the endpoint, but it's transformed between the two formats within the app.
column86: 04/Sep/18 9:51 AM;KailuoWang@iheartmedia.com;looking good to me.

column1: SMT API endpoints sending inconsistent data
column23:
After working with AMP to test api outputs some data is off and throwing errors in AMP. The following needs to be fixed:
* Genre meta image urls can't be null
* NZ streams aren't showing state ids in api output
* Genre sort orders can't be null
* Market export can't have null state ids
column67: AMP should no error

column1: ResolveMembers needs to make sure members being applied to resources exist
column23:
Right now it's possible for a non-existent tag to be applied to resource memberships by virtue of existing in the memberships of some other tag. This ticket is to close that loophole.  (Reminder: verify that all membership methods including bulk behave properly after)

Exception: membership_remove and membership_remove_many should allow non-existent members as input.

column1: Content Cleanup

column23:
The following fields should be locked down when logged in as a local user in Site Manager (eg. national admin only):

Analytics -> Parsely Checkbox
Analytics -> Parsely Account ID
Contact -> Show Employment Info (note, fields underneath that should remain open)
Partners -> National Programming
Ads -> Facebook Ad Tracking Pixel
Ads -> Facebook Ad Tracking Pixel ID

The following fields should be unlocked so that local users can edit:

General -> Site Name

column1: bucket_create should disallow uppercase characters in names
column23: When creating a bucket in buckets tool or object DB, make sure it's all lowercase and isn't a duplicate.  The main benefit of this is solving for what we're seeing in Coast to Coast AM where there's two buckets with the same name but different capitalization.
column83: 11/Jun/18 9:58 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Discussed on grooming today, not particularly urgent, but an easy fix.
column84:
12/Jun/18 8:55 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage at http://buckets.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/

Confirmed that the tool will not allow you to create a bucket with any caps - nor will allow you to create a bucket with a name that's currently in use.  However, found that the help text has not been updated to reflect that only lowercase characters are permitted - and that the field validation does not highlight the name field red for these two new conditions the same way it does for the existing business rules.  Can we please update the help text and validation to ensure a consistent experience?
column85: 12/Jun/18 9:21 AM;TravisTerry@iheartmedia.com;This ticket was for the API update in ObjectDB to disallow uppercase letters. Updates to the UI should be a separate ticket.
column86: 12/Jun/18 10:08 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Created IHRAR-4235 to update the tool.

column1: Rejecting Changes From Quick Add In Queue Giving Error
column23: rejecting change requests after "quick add" gives error
column67: Is is expected behavior for these stations to go into the change requests for approval? It seems like they are going into the queue as blank stations.
column79: Click "Quick Add" and fill in station information, then save the station and try to reject the changes in the queue
column83:
25/Jun/18 3:56 PM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;[~1119007] New stations via quick add have to be saved in order for them to show up next time you load SMT. By default all saves are categorized as "updates". When you accept a change request it's categorized as a "commit". Rejecting a new station will try to revert it to the last "commit" but since it has none, it errors. We may need to change the workflow for new stations.

SMT also doesn't have "delete" functionality so deleting a quick add station isn't currently an option. 

Let me know how you would like to handle this.
column84: 27/Jun/18 10:24 PM;GregCerchione@iheartmedia.com;[~amamut] Is it possible for stations in quick-add to bypass the change queue and be auto approved? We're thinking this purpose will be use to get stations ready for editing later, which those edits will go into the change queue for approval. This may solve the issue?
column85:
29/Jun/18 8:54 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage at http://stream-manager.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/changes creating a station with call letters "MIKE" in the corporate market.  

I am shown an on-screen confirmation message, however, when i go back to the streams page and refresh, I am not able to find the station searching under "Mike", or by filtering down to the Corporate market.  I also don't see the station appearing in the change list.

[~amamut], is there another way I should be testing this?
column86:
29/Jun/18 9:52 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Reviewed with Alex.  The symptoms I observed aren't related to the work on this ticket - created IHRAR-4295, AR-4296, and AR-4298 to address that.  To find a quick added station, you need to sort all streams using the descending option at the top and the newly added stream will be at the top.

[~1119007] ready for your review.
column87:
03/Jul/18 9:38 AM;GregCerchione@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrnyc2msw] [~amamut] I'm still receiving an error when i reject the quick add change in the queue. Is there no way to bypass this?, Additionally, is there a way for the quick add station to be searchable by the call letters? 

For instance, I created a quick add station -TESTGREG-FL, it went into the queue and I approved it, then when i went to search it it did not return. I had to find by Mike's method. Now, this isn't a *huge* issue, but it may get confusing if we quick add multiple stations. Since it seems the quick add function is only available for Global Admin, this may not have to be fixed for launch. Totally up to you guys.
column88:
03/Jul/18 9:45 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;The change was to bypass change requests for quick add stations. Stations currently in the change queue are a byproduct of the code prefix.

After Mike brought it up to me I noticed that quick add doesn't set the call letters on the stations which is what the search field looks at. I think this should be ticketed and updated.
column89:
03/Jul/18 11:58 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Thanks!  Created IHRAR-4308 to address that.

Also created AR-4309 to address how the call letters aren't currently shown in the list view.

column1: Force Users To Latest Version of App
column23: As a user of the RadioEdit family of apps, i want to always get the latest version of the app I am using so that I can do my work using the latest functionality available.
column67: # Users accessing a RadioEdit app should be forced to use the newest version of the app that has been deployed to production.
column83:
30/May/18 1:25 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;From Spike done in IHRAR-4016:

{quote}Transition v-id to app-build numbering scheme.

Implement application based atomically incrementing numbering for builds.

Enable per build number aliases e.g. master or beta.

RadioCTL to print all valid urls to the new build.

proxyd to enable on demand application starting with cool interstitial.

proxyd can track LRU application list and issue shutdowns if the application record allows it.

Inject application id, build number and build date into application environment.

Create regui component to track if a new build has occurred and display a notice. Automatically refresh the browser if it's been more than 24 hours.
{quote}

column1: Memory leak in Fire
column23: There is a significant memory leak in prod fire. Find it. Stick your thumb in it.
column83:
05/Jun/18 10:02 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;{quote}[4:39 PM] Travis Terry: I forgot to include the ticket number in the PR title
[4:39 PM] Travis Terry: https://github.com/ihr-radioedit-apps/fire/pull/1363
[4:40 PM] Travis Terry: I moved the event_loop.close() call from @after_request to @teardown_request

column1: Members not added to occurrences
column23:
Production: /events/59bc0d4c8c13998c07cc10fc

Occurrences for this event have mismatched permissions. 3 of the 4 occurrences didn't have the proper permissions attached to them.
column83:
24/May/18 1:39 PM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;It seems that there were 3 different people attached to these occurrences so I predict that there was a disconnect in permissions.

I think what we need is a list of rules for these calendar events. Content items have a set of editors on them which is carried over to the event. Since content allows you to read any piece of content no matter who created it, this creates an issue where some of the editor tags may not belong to the user creating the event.
column84:
24/May/18 1:54 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;This event?  http://calendar.radioedit.iheart.com/#/edit/59bc0d4c8c13998c07cc10fc

it looks like WBZY-FM is the editor group, so i would expect anyone with permission to that brand could edit/delete the event.  

Might be worth allowing additional editors to be added from within the calendar tool- that way if a content item is brought in that the calendar editor doesn't have permission for, they can add a permission to the actual event so they could edit later.  Block saving if current user doesn't have permission to any of the currently tagged editors (with appropriate error message shown to users?)

Should we also check permissions within the tool to ensure that non-premissioned users can't make changes?  If multiple occurrences were saved by a user that didn't have permission to make a change, that's a little troubling.
column85:
24/May/18 2:13 PM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;# I understand that anyone with WBZY-FM should be able to edit/delete the event, and that's how it works now.
# Adding editors is a good idea but doesn't solve the main issue. You are able to attach ANY piece of content to an event no matter who is able to edit it because of the nature of content tool. People without permissions to edit the content can still view it. When the content is attached to the event, calendar tool is carrying over the edit permissions from the piece of content to the event. But its setting these as both read and write. So a user can create an event, attach a piece of content they don't have permission to edit, save the event and then its lost to them forever because they can no longer access it.
# No one without permissions to edit an event can even see the event so that's fine.
column86:
29/May/18 10:18 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;Went over this with Mike, after trying to attach content which has editor tags that user doesn't have access to tool displays save error. So user should not be able to lose visibility of event after saving with bad tags.

Looking further into production issue where occurrences lost members, I could not find a way that this would occur unless there was an objectdb issue.

I'm not sure I can update any code which would help with this issue.
column87:
30/May/18 8:55 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;As there's no user reports of this happening attached to the ticket and there's no clear engineering approach to take, I'm going to close this out as unsolvable.  

If we find this happens again, we should create a new ticket with detailed steps to reproduce.

column1: Turn off amp when current site doesn't match publish origin
column23: The spirit of IHRAR-3893 was to only have amp enabled for a single site's version of a content item. However, if we start using webapi to serve fire, the logic specified on that ticket will no longer work. I think that work should be reversed, content should take a site slug as a parameter, and amp should be disabled when the current site doesn't match the publish origin.

column1: Update Live Profile WebAPI To Support Partner Content
column23: As an engineer working on iHeart.com, i want the permalink value in a live profile timeline to return the correct location for partner content that is to be viewed in-network so that iHeart.com knows where to link to when that content is presented on a live profile timeline.
column67:
# Permalink value should be generated using the following logic:

* If content item is ingested and the associated XML feed has "External Content" option enabled, set to content's original location
* Else, construct a /content/slug/ path
** If site is disabled (via deactivate or hide site) in SM, set domain to www.iheart.com
** If site is active SM, use site's primary domain
column83: 18/May/18 4:36 PM;DavidNaeder@iheartmedia.com;I think we'll need a field to let us know if the content is "Partner" (or not). We were keying off of 'feed_vendor' field, but Bell (which is for Canada) is not supposed to be considered a "partner". Happy to chat about it more!
column84:
31/May/18 12:57 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;When generating the permalink, the external_url is already used if it is available. I believe this fulfills this acceptance criteria:
bq. If content item is ingested and the associated XML feed has "External Content" option enabled, set to content's original location

Right now, we delegate creation of the permalink to site-manager. I can bypass this process for inactive sites and generate an iheart.com url. This seems to be the only new behavior. This should fulfill this requirement:
bq. If site is disabled (via deactivate or hide site) in SM, set domain to www.iheart.com

Site-manager already does this for us:
bq. If site is active SM, use site's primary domain
column85: 31/May/18 5:00 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;[~1113379] FiRE is also using feed_vendor to determine if a piece of content is "partner content".
column86:
06/Jun/18 12:14 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage by creating two pieces of content - one that is original, one that is partner/ingested.  Tested using HLS-FM which is setup as a regular station site - and HLSQA-FL which mirrors the Digital Channel setup (with the SM checkbox set to show editorial content on www.iheart.com)

Looking at HLS-FM:

column1: Deleted Microsite Casuses Meta URL/Canonical Issues
column23:
When a microsite is deleted, any content that has the origin of that micoriste appears to become orphaned.

Notably:

1) URLs shown in meta tags become invalid
2) Canonical URL field disappears from the admin tool

This is throwing AMP errors for content pages that are still indexed - and likely other issues.

Need to determine how we want to handle orphaned content.  Change origin to parent site?  Unpublish content? Something else?

* ability to revert to a previous version

column1: Revamp Search Experience
column23: As a playlist programmer, I‚Äôd like my search experience to be improved so that I don‚Äôt have to use the Web app or the iPhone app to find the content I need. Currently, it‚Äôs hard for me to search for music on specific albums and oftentimes the result I need does not come back in the search UI.
column67:
* Add additional metadata
** explicitLyrics (T/F) GET /api/v3/search/all
** ReleaseDate (Date) GET /api/v3/catalog/album/{id}
** album version
** Publisher (String) GET /api/v3/catalog/tracks/{ids}
*** strip the ‚Ñó from the display 
** album cover
** track version
* Add search filter parameters to make it easier to whittle down the result volume (similar to iHeart.com search)

column1: Flag playlists with >0 non-OD tracks in left-hand window
column23: As a playlist programmer, I‚Äôd like to see a playlist-level indicator in the left hand window that flags whether or not any given playlist contains one or more Non-OD tracks so that I can know to go into and modify it.
column67: * a playlist-level indicator exists in the left hand playlist window that warns users if a playlist contains more than zero non-OD tracks

column1: Schedule playlist publish for future
column23: As a playlist programmer, I‚Äôd like to have the option to schedule my playlist publish so that I don‚Äôt need to wake up at midnight in order to publish a New Release playlist that has fresh tracks available starting at midnight
column67:
* UI is made available for Admins and Curators to optionally choose to publish their playlist draft at a future Datetime
** still should be able to maintain the ability to Publish Now 
* Made available only a single playlist publish (not bulk)
* Made available only on Manually-made playlists (not dynamic)

*Extra credit:* be able to force product_ids into the playlists that have a future StartDate (haven't been released yet)

column1: Curator Playlist Assignments
column23:
As a manager of playlist programming, I want to have the ability to assign playlists to specific curators so that the work can be divided appropriately and given to the subject matter experts

*Use Case:* iHeartRadio station DJ's need to be able to go into the tool and modify their own playlists.
column67:
* Curator role is permissioned in the tool and is given the features below:
** Able to be given specific playlist assignments by the Admin
** Curators assigned to playlists are viewable and editable by Admin
** Curator role only has view/edit access to playlists they‚Äôve been assigned
** Curator role can create their own playlists
*** When creating their own playlist, they should be assigned to the playlist by default and full permissions also given to the Admin role

column1: Add querystring directive to mediaserver to add surrogate keys
column23:
A lot of mediaserver links are lookup & redirect links. When we redirect we lose the ability to add surrogate keys to the response and therefore don't have a good way to invalidate images in the final location.

Instead, add a querystring surrogate key flag to mediaserver image calls that will always add the keys from the querystring to the media call.

This will enable complete invalidation of any catalog image no matter how it's accessed and should allow us to remove the unnecessarily short surrogate cache control headers.
column83: 07/Jun/18 11:12 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;[~gvilches], please provide test instructions.
column84:
07/Jun/18 2:48 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested with Trey's assistance:

{quote}[2:39 PM] Trey Long: request a catalog image, and look at the redirect
[2:40 PM] Trey Long: should have a querystring param "surrogate" on it
[2:40 PM] Trey Long: when you get fetch the URL from the redirect with Fastly-Debug:1 you should see surrogate keys that match the ones (or a superset of) from the original request.
[2:41 PM] Trey Long: 1. Request catalog URL with Fastly-Debug:1
2. Note surrgate keys in response headers
3. Lookup URL specified in Location header
4. Should have a "surrogate" query param
5. Requesting the new URL with Fastly-Debug:1 should produce similar surrogate keys
[2:42 PM] Mike Woodruff: ok, so https://i-stg.iheart.com/v3/catalog/artist/4688

column1: Populate summary from usedFor on template
Add linked microsite resolver to webapi
column82: This was functionality that existed before, that we took away when we stopped automatically resolving microsites. Now if you requested linked microsites in the query, we will use the ids that came back from the site's configuration call, and request each of those microsites' configs by id, then filter down to the data you requested. In the comments is an example query. We don't know if anyone was taking advantage of this before, but since it was possible, we didn't want to introduce a regression.

[5:06 PM] Mark Cahill: What do you normally do to verify a webapi release?
[5:07 PM] Andrew Vickory: I've got a query param that sets our site to look at the new webapi url and I run around testing all of the functionality that relies on it

I'm leaning towards spinning up another server on another port, and have that read fixture files. I should be able to support playback/record mode like fire, as long as you're in a radioctl shell.

column1: membership_remove not working properly on tags
column23:
Example:
http://taxonomy.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/api/v1/providers/GreaterMedia?include_related=true

This provider tag was being controlled by a number of "countries" tags.  All were removed successfully and "AU" was added after the remove but the other countries stayed in the member_of field:

 !image-2018-05-01-11-34-58-241.png|thumbnail! 

Also adding related tags using the SMT token was not possible. Still received a tag response without the tag added.
column67: When a control tag is removed the member_of perm should be removed as well.
column83: 17/May/18 9:51 AM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;This is an objectdb issue: when membership_remove (and possibly membership_remove_many) run, they keep back tags that are controlled by one of the other tags in member_of. If the document is itself a tag, it has itself in member_of, which causes all of the current memberships to be kept and nothing is removed.

column87: 01/Jun/18 8:50 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Thanks for testing Alex!  Back to you [~mbrown].
column88: 06/Jun/18 2:57 PM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;That's because there are also US states in the list. You can't remove a tag if there's something else in the list controlled by it.
column89: 07/Jun/18 11:23 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;[~amamut], can you test again in this context?
column90: 07/Jun/18 11:34 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;I never added states or markets to the list only countries. Were the states and markets added when the country was linked since its a controlling tag?
column91: 11/Jun/18 10:43 AM;AlexMamut@iheartmedia.com;We can mark this ticket resolved. The tag which wasn't removed had extra controlled tags on that resource. All other tags were removed just fine.

column1: SPIKE slug, primary site, and primary domain changes wrt canonical url
column23:
For detail pages, the canonical URL is stored in pubsub. If the site's primary domain changes, or if a microsite's slug or primary site change, the canonical URL in pubsub no longer points to the new canonical location. The existing canonical URL should redirect to the new location, but it would be more desirable to update the canonical URL. 

READY, FIGHT!

column1: Optimize and share S3 storage by only saving unique binaries
column23:
Currently, we store working copy binaries using a name based on the hash of the resource id. Versioned binaries are stored based on a hash of the contents of the file. If we change working copies to also be based a hash of the file, then we can combine the three environments into a single S3 bucket and not have to store 3 copies of 1.3T of data. This will also make copying data between environments easier because we can copy the DB references from prod to stage/dev without having to copy the S3 resources.

In order to prevent orphaned binaries from accumulating, this feature would also require a database collection to track reference counts for binaries. Any time a binary is saved to S3, we would increment the reference count. When a new binary is uploaded to an existing resource, we would decrement the old reference count. A periodic task can look for 0-count binaries and remove them from S3.

1. Create a new service to manage S3 binaries and reference counts.
2. Update objectdb to use the new service to manager reference counts when binary data is attached to a resource.
3. Copy all binaries to a new bucket using the new content-hash bashed filename.
4. Write a cron job to periodically remove orphaned S3 binaries.

column1: SMT 4: Users permissions levels
column23:
As an admin of SMT, I would like to manage the level of access we grant to different users depending on their needs/roles.

Roles:
1) Global Admin
2) Country Admin
3) Provider Admin

Role definitions/specs: 
1) Global admin has access to all data and can perform all functions within SMT
2) Country admin has access to all data and can perform all functions within SMT for their designated country only
3) Provider admin has access to add/edit/delete streams for designated provider only, but cannot:
* accept changes
* create/edit markets, states, countries, genres, providers
* edit/view CUME field on stream form
* access sorting functionality

column1: Microsite Slug Change No Longer Redirects Former Slug
column23:
Originally built in IHRAR-3391 and AR-3498, editors can change the slug of a microsite in Site Manager- the old slug is retained and traffic arriving via the old slug is 301'ed to the new location.

It looks like at some point between November when this was built and today this stopped working.

column1: Enhancement Request: Allow Re-Ordering of Publish Panel Tags
column23:
As a national content creator, I would like the ability to change the listing order of an article with many targets in the Primary Topic targeting field to change how it is displayed in the article eyebrows.

From Dave Basner: So for most stories I do, I need to include many topics. I have a preset for it. Sometimes the stories i do fit in weird news while other times they are entertainment news, so that is typically the only topic I add. While that topic should be the catchall one, because putting it at the top would require me to delete all the others then re-add them after entering the catch-all topic, it winds up not being at the top. Then what happens is stories that should be a category in particular, and correctly fall into that category on the home page feed, show the wrong topic on the article level (see screen shots). Is there any way to fix this? I don‚Äôt want to have to switch between two pre-sets. Ideally the topics would be draggable. Is that possible?
column83: 29/Mar/19 10:51 AM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;Recommend spiking this. Reorder capability on the publish panel just to work around FiRE's eyebrow behavior sounds awful. We could provide another form field for eyebrow if this is important, but that sounds kinda crappy too.
column84:
01/Apr/19 11:23 AM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;We mentioned many times how relying on the order of the tags field was a short sighted and limited solution that could bite us in the future.

The real solution is creating a first class "category" of some kind and having things key off of that.

column1: Disable Recommendations By Microsite
column23: As a digital content editor, i want to be able to turn off Taboola recommendations on a particular microsite off so that when I have a feature where an advertiser has been promised 100% share of voice, we don't have any competing ads appearing.

column83:
25/May/18 11:38 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage.

Verified that the checkbox is found on the general tab, but think we should update the form text to reference "microsite" instead of "site".

I'm unsure if recommendations needs its own section, thinking it'd be better to combine this and SimpleReach into a Partners box to avoid repetition of titles and limit how long the page gets.  Or is there a reason to have in its own box?

column1: Logical page configuration
column23:
Add a "logical" page configuration in site manager so we can refer to the "homepage" in links but that designation can be configured to go to different actual pages.

Example: onair links to a microsite's "homepage". On most sites, that is "home". However, on brokered show pages, they use "about" as the homepage. Fire should link to "homepage", and site manager should allow the user to determine what actual page they want.

NOTE: Initial ask is just for "homepage", but the implementation of this ticket should allow for additional logical page designations to be added in the future.

column1: Normal Shows in CORE with Notes are Being Skipped
column23:
Reported by KRPC-AM - the show they had on at 3PM Sundays was being omitted from the schedule... based on working with the CORE team, they believe that because this show had a value in the Notes field.  They've blanked the notes field and expect the show to appear the next time the .dat file is generated, but we should see if there's an issue in the way the dat files are being processed.

The notes field should only be checked if the show type is brokered or public service... else it should be ignored and the show processed as usual.

column1: Remove multi-query feature of collection blocks
column23: Multi-query was intended for sites to put additional content "below the fold" in the earlier today block. Only three sites use this. 23 other sites have added additional queries to the trending block where it would have been better to just use multiple topics in a single query. We don't need the complication of this feature for just three sites. Remove the multiple queries and migration existing multiple queries into a single query.

column1: Lookup failures should be handled appropriately
column23: In REST calls, a failed lookup should result in a 404. In RPC calls, the error should be of the type that the proto middleware understands.

column1: Modification of KML in SMT
column23:
As a Projet Pivot stakeholder, I need polygon KML files ingested into SMT on a per-station basis and exposed to AMP, so that AMP can determine when a listener is within the boundaries of a station's polygon.

Need to ingest station-level KML polygon files as provided by IHM Radio Engineering (sample attached).  All KML files are available for download from the following S3 bucket (includes all radio stations, including IHM and non-O&O stations):

bucket name: ihr-kml
secret : esTKh39O8W1uhxRrNXX8uB4r7z7rkv/r5k3SyD2v
key : AKIAJCLFO7N6JNO43YVA

Each KML filename follows the naming convention:   <STATION-FCCID>.kml

Once ingested into SMT, KML files need to be accessible by AMP.

[EDIT]

This ticket is to track future work for editing KML for a station. When KML modification is desired SMT will ingest the KML file for a station and then expose fields for modification. Once saved it will generate new KML for a station and save it on streams/metadata and be exposed as an api call for that station: https://stream-manager.radioedit.ihrint.com/api/v1/kml/1234

column1: Move Page Logic from FiRE to SM to Support Sitemap Generation (AR)
column23: As a search engine, i want Site Manager to handle page logic so that those pages can be included in the sitemap.xml file I reference to crawl the sites.
column67:
For microsites:
# XML sitemap file for each site containing pages inside all microsites owned by the current site
# Only pages that are not path variable dependent should be included
# Changefreq should be hourly for any page that has a collection block on it, else monthly
# Microsite pages should be contained within the site manager-powered section of the sitemap and not mixed in with content

For sites:
# XML sitemap file for each site containing pages on the current site
# Only pages that are not path variable dependent should be included
# Changefreq should be hourly for any page that has a collection block on it, else monthly
# Pages should be contained within a dedicated site manager-powered section of the sitemap and not mixed in with content

column1: Create content only google news style sitemap output
column23: As a search engine, I want a news sitemap that lists all recently created content for each FiRE site so that I can include relevant content that stations produce in the Google News product.
column67:
# News sitemap built for each station including content owned by the current site following spec detailed in SEO audit
# Partner/Ingested and Branded Content should be suppressed from the news sitemap
# Ability to exclude certain topics/collections (eg. contest-rules) from the news sitemap
column83:
11/Jun/18 9:04 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;From SEO Audit:

{quote}Google News Sitemaps
Much more so than general XML Sitemaps for Web Search, Google News XML Sitemaps are critical for competing in Google News. Creating and maintaining a Google News sitemap is one of the most important factors in Google News success. The Google News Sitemap is based on the XML sitemap, but has additional news-specific tags.
iHeart struggles to compete for Google News traffic. Part of the reason for this is that its news content is hard to discover. Google News crawling and indexation is known to be much more frustrating than its Google Search cousin, making it critical to lead it to the right content.
Best practices for News Sitemap creation:{quote}


{code:java}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<urlset xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9"
xmlns:news="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap-news/0.9">
<url>
<loc>http://www.example.org/business/article55.html</loc>
<news:news>
<news:publication>
<news:name>The Example Times</news:name>
<news:language>en</news:language>
</news:publication>
<news:access>Subscription</news:access>
<news:genres>PressRelease, Blog</news:genres>
<news:publication_date>2008-12-23</news:publication_date>
<news:title>Companies A, B in Merger Talks</news:title>
<news:stock_tickers>NASDAQ:A, NASDAQ:B</news:stock_tickers>
</news:news>
</url>
</urlset>{code}

{quote}While not a public recommendation, there has been some guidance given to major publishers from Google News to include image locations, as well. The formatting for that is:{quote}

{code}<image:image>
<image:loc>
http://www.example.org/image-name.jpg
</image:loc>
<image:caption>This is your caption</image:caption>
<image:title>This is your image title</image:title>
</image:image>
{code}


 !image-2018-06-11-09-04-15-318.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2018-06-11-09-04-33-298.png|thumbnail! 

https://support.google.com/news/publisher-center/answer/74288?hl=en&visit_id=1-636643182415291437-9068720&rd=2
column84: 11/Jun/18 9:50 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Discussed in backlog grooming.  Need to get some more info from the editorail team on what content should or shouldn't be classified as news.  May need to wait until the content refactor is done.

column1: Add content listing to XML sitemap output
column23:
As a search engine, i want an sitemap.xml output of all content owned by an iHeartRadio site so that I can index all the content available and serve up that content to users who are searching for it

Protocol documentation:
https://www.sitemaps.org/protocol.html

we want all of the hrefs for two different things:
# all content whose origin is the site
# all content whose origin is the microsite for every microsite whose primary-site is the site

The API will likely be an rpc call that lives in site manager. It has the data needed to find the content, and it has the brains to generate canonical urls. This differs from the timeline query in that it *only* cares about content whose origin is the site. We aren't doing the general-purpose timeline query. 

Since there is a limit of 50K urls per sitemap, we will use what's called a sitemap index to list each sitemap, and then create a sitemap for each day for which a site has published content.

There is debate on whether or not we should calculate the sitemap live and cache it, or calculate it offline and store it somewhere. Do some performance testing on the query to see what response times look like before building the entire solution. This needs to be exposed via fire, which does not do any rpc calls today. Just something to keep in mind.
column67:
# All published/live content canonical to a site included in sitemap.xml
# loc, lastmod, changefreq, and image for each item 
# Sitemap should be limited to 50,000 items
# Content should be appended to/linked to existing sitemap.xml content
column83:
05/Jun/18 12:03 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;In order for fire to have a list of urls by publish origin, we need to ask site manager, which can generate canonical urls for content. It must query pubsub, which currently does not expose query by publish origin. We'll need to add publish_origin to the pubsub object, add it to search indexing, and then modify the publishing system. Pubsub does not calculate any fields today, so we would need to modify the publish call in content.

We likely want to cache the query result in pubsub, and the xml output wherever it ends up living, at a minimum.
column84: 05/Jun/18 12:54 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;In order to generate the query, we will need to iterate through linked microsites and identity which microsites are owned by the current site, and send the site brand and microsite brands as an $in for the publish_origin on the pubsub records. This will require a new endpoint in pubsub that accepts an array of brands and returns content items that match by publish_origin.
