column1: Updating content item does not publish to iheart.com
column23: As a content editor I want to be able to make certain edits to an already-published content item and have those updates publish correctly to iheart.com
column67: # Any update to a content item is properly published to iheart.com
column79:
# Create a content item normally using DEFAULT as the origin
# Publish and view the content on iheart.com
# Make an edit to the content article author or insert an image asset block to the body without making any other edits
# Publish the changes. After an hour notice those updates do NOT appear on the iheart.com URL (the updates do appear on a FiRE website though)
# Edit the content item again but make an update to a rich text block (add or edit some text).
# Publish the changes. After about 15-20 minutes notice that all your changes are now on iheart.com
column83: 30/Mar/18 2:27 PM;MarkEscott@iheartmedia.com;Reported by Editorial team who routinely edits already-published content items changing areas like Author or adding image asset blocks. They notice those changes never appear on iheart.com. The only way to force the update is to add or edit rich text within the content body.
column84: 16/Apr/18 1:38 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;This only affects national (iheart.com) and not local sites hosted on Fire, which seems to indicate an unexpected cache behavior in webapi.
column85: 16/Apr/18 5:51 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Upon further investigation, this absolutely affects fire because there is a whole page cache. Fire is caching pages on fastly for 15 minutes, and webapi is caching for an hour in memcached. Editing author or body contents does not clear either of these caches, and you must wait for expiration. Please advise.
column86: 16/Apr/18 6:33 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;webapi serves a lot of requests, if we want to reduce the amount of time for things to update we're going to have to be very careful about reducing TTLs. OR, we're going to need to work out an invalidation strategy
column87: 17/Apr/18 11:24 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;While I don't fully understand why, it appears that when [~mbrown] fixed IHRAR-3811, it appears this behavior went away. After talking with [~ccrbdl1mje], we're going to consider this as resolved until such time as the editorial team reports they are still seeing it.

column1: Suppress amphtml link for content owned by other sites
column23: As a content editor, i want the ampEnabled flag in WebAPI to be set to false if the content's origin is not an iHeartRadio flagship site so that Google doesn't get confused by seeing multiple amphtml links for the same piece of content.
column67:
# In WebAPI, set ampEnabled to false if origin is anything other than IHM-IP, default, or Master Site
# Content owned by microsites should be set to false if the parent site is anything other than the above
# Existing logic to determine ampEnabled status should be retained (eg. non-compliant blocks, partner content, sponsor content, etc)
column83: 30/Mar/18 8:46 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Discussed with Trey on HipChat.  This should be done in the WebAPI and not in the actual web client.  Moved to AR.  This is a sprint 9 ticket according to our Q1 plan.
column84: 15/May/18 10:33 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrnyc2msw] to add some test examples.
column86: 15/May/18 4:19 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Brand whitelist will be maintained in the content adapter for now.
column87: 16/May/18 1:35 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Thanks for the above test cases!  Looks good to me.
column88: 21/May/18 8:46 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;I suspect that the proposed solution doesn't meet the goal. It seems like you would want web to pass in the site the content item is being displayed on in order to test if it matches the publish origin. I would think that original content only published on a non-flagship site _would_ have amp enabled?
column89:
21/May/18 9:26 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;The goal is to only have the amphtml link present when content is viewed on the canonical domain.  Google has been confused by the "mixed signals" (as our SEO consultant put it) by having each site promote an AMP page on each site the page is viewed on.  While we could update these amphtml link values to always use the canonical location, that wouldn't work for stations sharing content via social media (notably twitter who uses the AMP pages frequently) as the shared page would not be in the station's brand - and thus the station wouldn't get credit for the traffic.

The solution was then to only populate an amphtml link when content is viewed on its canonical domain.  If viewed elsewhere, Twitter would not see the AMP link and would just return the regular version of the content page.

This functionality is already in production on the local sites via AL-4193 - this ticket is just so that iHeart.com knows whether to show an amphtml link or not.
column90: 21/May/18 9:29 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;Yeah, I don't think this accomplishes that goal. The logic that I've implemented based on the description of the ticket is to only show the amp link if a national site was the original publish origin. Amp will still be enabled on every site that syndicates this content.
column91:
21/May/18 10:32 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Hmmm, that's not currently the case in production:

https://z100.iheart.com/content/2018-05-21-chrissy-teigen-in-mesh-underwear-reveals-her-post-baby-body-on-instagram/

This content item is owned by Default - the amphtml link is properly suppressed when viewed anywhere other than www.iheart.com

This probably does open up a can of worms if/when we switch the FiRE sites to pull content via webapi.
column92: 22/May/18 10:56 AM;DavidNaeder@iheartmedia.com;Verified updates here: https://www.iheart.com/content/why-may-22nd-matters-in-rock-history-2018-05-22/?configOverride={%22radioEdit%22:{%22webGraphQlApi%22:%22https://v-4b98e458.radioedit.iheart.com/graphql%22}}

column1: Review CORE Changes for Brokered Show Enrichment
column23:
The CORE team has made some change to the way Brokered and Public Service shows are returned in the dat file we retrieve each evening.  The goal is to be able to associate them with a microsite for enrichment purposes (and have the enriched data appear on the homepage and schedule page as appropriate.

This ticket is to review the implementation that the San Antonio team did to support this, ideally to load the attached .dat into Stage so we can verify the functionality end to end.

If everything looks good, we're done.  If something's off, some collaboration with the San Antonio engineers to get it where it needs to be.

File is attached.  

Background provided with file:

{quote}Hi Mike,
 
Please find attached revised file with the below changes
 
a)      For all brokered/public Service shows where show Key is null ‚Äì the show Key =   StationKey + StationScheduleDataKey
b)      For all brokered/public Service shows where show Key is null  - Show =  Note; if note is null as well then we pad it with space ‚Äú ‚Äú
 
Please review
 
Thanks
Nagesh{quote}

column1: Implement idle connection timeouts in proxyd
column23:
If a client misbehaves and doesn't close the connection to radioedit, proxyd will keep a socket open and use additional system resources. Playlists had a bug that caused it to not close connections, and the socket count for proxyd grew until the system ran out of sockets.

Implement an idle timeout so that long lived connections that aren't sending data can be killed and the system resources recovered.
column83: 21/Mar/18 1:44 PM;TravisTerry@iheartmedia.com;IHRAR-3858 contains useful system socket counts related to the problem.

column1: Proxyd holding on to (or leaking) mongodb connections
column23:
Proxyd is holding on to or leaking mongodb connections. Our total connection count was close to 6000 and caused alerts. I checked netstat on all of the front end reapp hosts, and proxyd had an excessive number of connections open to mongo. After restarting proxyd on all hosts, the total number of open mongo connections dropped to ~1500 and the alert cleared.

{code}
$ pssh -h hosts-prod.txt -P "sudo netstat -plan | grep proxyd | wc -l" | grep net:
reapp101.ihrprod.net: 184
reapp104.ihrprod.net: 837
reapp107.ihrprod.net: 87
reapp106.ihrprod.net: 147
reapp109.ihrprod.net: 203
reapp105.ihrprod.net: 401
reapp102.ihrprod.net: 1959
reapp108.ihrprod.net: 304
reapp103.ihrprod.net: 196
reapp112.ihrprod.net: 174
reapp111.ihrprod.net: 484
reapp113.ihrprod.net: 206
reapp110.ihrprod.net: 218
reapp115.ihrprod.net: 479
reapp114.ihrprod.net: 339
{code}
column83: 19/Mar/18 10:23 AM;TravisTerry@iheartmedia.com;Turns out these weren't all directly proxyd holding mongodb connections. On 102, there were a very large number of connections from the playlist to proxyd. Unfortunately, I didn't filter the count to be proxy+mongo only. I will do that again and see if we can narrow it further.

column1: home-leads Cards Should Alternate Local/National
column23:
Dynamic Leads cards should alternate local/national to ensure that the cards from one particular source don't bunch up (eg. all 4 local cards before the first national one is shown).

For purposes of this ticket, local means anything tagged and included via a station/market/brand tag... and national means anything tagged with default, a format, or a genre.  Custom segments are somewhat of a grey area, but I'm inclined to think of them as national.  

The first card should continue to be the "DL0" slot which should always be shown first regardless of what local/national cards are available.

column1: [A/B tests admin GUI] new creation API and workflow
column23:
Current the GUI uses two endpoints to create / replace new tests 
1. *PUT tests/* used by "REPLACE tests"
2. *POST tests/*  used by "Create tests"
But the PUT endpoint will not allow a user to create a new revision of a test that is scheduled after the last test ends, in which case user will have to use Create test functionality but it could be cumbersome and error prone to the settings from the existing test. 

I created a new endpoint *POST tests/auto* that can be used combined with the *POST tests/* to enable a new unified workflow for test creation/replace. (This new endpoint will be deployed to staging soon)
The swagger doc of the new *POST test/auto* is here http://stg-abtest.ihrcloud.net/docs/swagger-ui/index.html?url=/assets/swagger.json#/routes/createAuto

So here is the new workflow that should be used for both test creation and replacement, this new workflow has multiple steps. 

step 1, gui uses "POST tests/" to post the data of the test to be created. (same as the current create new test action)

step 2, gui gets the response from server. If the response is 200 OK then creation succeeded, no further action needed, if the response status is 409 (means conflict), GUI should display a confirmation modal window, asking if the user wants to terminate the existing conflict test (whose information will be given in the response json body). if the user choses no, creation should be aborted, otherwise go to step 3.
If the response status is either 409 or 200, gui should display the error message and abandon the creation. 

step 3, if the user choose to proceed with terminating conflict test, GUI should use a different endpoint to post the same request, this time it should use "POST tests/auto", go to step 2


The "Create Replacement" button should use the same workflow above as create a new test. The "PUT tests/" should be no longer used by the GUI. 

Also "Create Replacement" label should be renamed to "New Revision".

column1: The unthinkable has happened: bugs in ... ObjectDB
column23:
There is a bug in save where you can add memberships to a resource that you currently should not be able to write.

1. In a bucket that restricts writing to "common membership," create a resource as a non-privileged user.
2. Remove all of your memberships. Writes should now be blocked.
3. Call save() on the resource with a membership that your user has. The call *should* return a 403, but instead, the membership is added to the resource.

Related: if you are able to write to a resource, you can save any valid membership on it.

1. Create a resource.
2. Make a second save call passing a membership list with a membership that you don't have.
3. The call should fail, but instead it adds the membership.

HT [~amamut]

column1: Spike: 3rd Party Ingesetion Duplicate Articles Across Multiple Brands
column23:
We have 3rd party XML feeds setup for all of the Bell Media stations in Canada.  Like iHeart, they centrally produce national content that is white labeled to each of their local stations.  This content is shown to listeners on each of the iHeart.com live profile pages; when users click the link, they're taken to that station's website to view the content.

Based on how we're currently handing these XML feeds (see comments below for my review with Alex), if there's an article published to all 120 stations' feeds, we're ingesting it on the first one we see it on; and then because that article is already in the system, it's getting skipped on the other 119 feeds as a duplicate.  As such, only 1 of 120 stations gets the desired content.

How can we adjust this setup so that if a piece of content is distributed to more than one Bell station, it will appear on each applicable live profile page, linking to view the content on the individual station's website?
column67:
# Engineering and product review of best ways to facilitate multi-station distibution of 3rd party ingested content
# JIRA tickets created to implement best solution
column83: 28/Feb/18 10:38 AM;RobRowe@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrnyc2msw] possible to get someone to look into this? Not sure exactly where the discrepancy is. If there's something wrong with the feed we're getting, happy to communicate that back to the Bell Media team.
column84: 28/Feb/18 10:41 AM;RobRowe@iheartmedia.com;https://webapi.radioedit.iheart.com/graphql?query=+query+LiveProfile($site:+SiteQuery!)+%7B+site(select:+$site)+%7B+summary+%7B+heroImage:+hero_image+heroColor:+hero_color+sms:+sms_number+phone:+request_phone_number+facebook:+facebook_name+googleplus:+googleplus_name+twitter:+twitter_name+instagram:+instagram_name+youtube:+youtube_name+snapchat:+snapchat_name+pinterest:+pinterest_name+%7D+schedule+%7B+current+%7B+...scheduleFields+%7D+upcoming(next:3)+%7B+...scheduleFields+%7D+%7D+timeline+%7B+payload+%7B+external_url+is_sponsored+%7D+slug+summary+%7B+image+title+%7D+%7D+leads+%7B+title+subtitle+image:+img_uri+link+%7B+urls+%7B+web+%7D+%7D+%7D+%7D+%7D+fragment+scheduleFields+on+ScheduleEntry+%7B+name+core_show_id+start:+start_time_12+stop:+stop_time_12+destination+%7B+href+thumbnail+%7D+%7D+&variables=%7B%22site%22:%7B%22slug%22:%22chum-fm%22%7D%7D
column85:
28/Feb/18 11:13 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Confirmed that the content shown on iheart.com matches the content shown in Content Tool:

http://content.radioedit.iheart.com/#/network?sort_field=1&sort_direction=1&publish_status=0&from_feed=0&collections%5B0%5D=collections%2FCHUM%20FM%20Feed&page=1
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

It seems no content newer than 2/28 at 7:01am is being ingested.  

Comparing the RSS feed with the content that was ingested, everything is off by a day.  

Checked ingestion history and found that nothing has been ingested since 7:31am yesterday: 

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

Confirmed that the source XML feed validates.

There are four items that seemingly are availbale for ingestion but have not been:

{code:java}
              <link>http://www.iheartradio.ca/chum-fm/music-news/pentatonix-announces-new-album-tour-1.3652198</link>
              <description><![CDATA[The a cappella group will be in Toronto in September.]]></description>
              <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3652198</guid>
              <pubDate>Wed, 28 Feb 2018 12:58:17 +0000</pubDate>
                            <enclosure url ='http://www.iheartradio.ca/image/policy:1.3652201:1519822665/ptx.jpg?a=16%3A9&amp
column86:
28/Feb/18 12:39 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Reviewed with Alex, the way the ingestion tool is setup is that it checks the content title and publication date, and uses those values to create a slug.  If it find that the same combination is already in place, it sees it as duplicate content and does skips.

What's happening here is that the Canadian stations are including identical content as per the above criteria in multiple XML feeds.  It's getting ingested on the first station it sees it on, and then skipping the rest.  

Depending on how prevalent this is, we'll likely need to explore ways to either allow duplicate content to be ingested - or perhaps if a piece of duplicate content is found from the same vendor, upon processing the second or subsequent instance, it instead applies an additional brand/topic tag to the existing content item.
column87: 12/Mar/18 9:40 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Converted ticket into a spike to determine best way to facilitate ingestion of 3rd party content where the same article should be distributed to multiple brands.
column88:
15/Mar/18 1:23 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;If we want to keep the content unique in the system (we do), and if we want to have separate feeds setup for groups of stations within the ingestion tool (seems like we do) then what this is is a change in behavior when a duplicate is detected.

If this is already within the content system, instead of saving it again update the targeting then re-publish.

So when these duplicate feeds get run over, the Bell stations will be augmented with the publishing parameters in the ingestion config.
column89: 16/Mar/18 9:51 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Another element that Rob and I discussed... each canada station has its own branded website, and they want their version of the content to open on the detail page that has the station's branding.  Very similar to what we're solving in IHRAR-3804 where we want national articles featured on iHeart.com to open in the station's website.
column90: 21/Mar/18 6:23 PM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;Feed content should be considered distinct if the same date and title haven't appeared for that feed.  A way forward would be to change how ingested articles are stored, where the resource id is a hash of feed config id (or some other identifier for the feed), publish date from the feed, and title. No content api change would be required.
column91: 22/Mar/18 9:52 AM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;A potential issue with any fix that allows the same article on multiple feeds to be ingested: if the slug and date are the same across multiple feeds, then the content create API will fail to publish all but one of them. Content's create API should do a pre-check before auto-publishing and respond with 400 if the slug is in use, then ingest would have to alter it with a random string or some such.
column92:
11/Apr/18 11:50 AM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;The only feasible way that we can think of to do this is to implement the following:

1. Do not de-dupe content from different feeds based on slug.
2. Prefix or Affix text onto the slug generated from all ingested feeds to make them unique per feed.
3. Publish all content from all feeds into pubsub.

The thing to look out for here is that we'll have 100+ copies of the same article inside of the content system. Additionally, if ingestion publish settings between two feeds were to ever overlap you would see duplicate entries in a station's timeline.

column1: Nationally Editing Overrides Doesn't Override Local Overrides
column23:
Followup ticket from IHRAR-3697.

Steps to reproduce potential issue:
* Locate a national override on a local site
* Edit that override
* Edit same override on national site
* Return to local site and refresh, note that the local value is still there.

Tested against production workflow, found that this functions the same as it does when creating a new override deletes and recreates the override and that the changes do not propegate to sites that have locally overridden.

column1: Social Titles- How To Handle Content Items That Don't Have One
column23:
The iHeart.com team is requesting in WEB-10848 that they not have to build client side logic to determine whether to use the new social title field or fallback to the regular title if one is not specified.

It looks like newly created content has a social title applied automatically, but what do we do about content created prior to this field being added to the tool?

DB script to apply a social title - or logic in WebApi to supply a fallback title?

I believe on FiRE we have logic in place already to fallback to  the normal title if no social title is specified.

Example:

http://webapi.radioedit.ihrint.com/graphiql/?query=%7B%0A%0A%20%20content%7B%0A%0A%20%20%20%20slug(slug%3A%222018-02-06-billboard-test-stage%22)%20%7B%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20payload%20%7B%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20social_title%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20summary%20%7B%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20title%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%7D%20%20%20%0A%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%0A%20%7D%0A%0A%7D%0A

column84: 22/Feb/18 9:33 AM;MarkEscott@iheartmedia.com;[~ccrnyc1rar]?
column85: 22/Feb/18 10:29 AM;RobRowe@iheartmedia.com;If the RE team would like to do it a different way, that's fine, but adding an external_url is currently the only way www.iheart.com will link out to an external URL instead of displaying the content in www.iheart.com.
column86:
05/Mar/18 3:28 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;It sounds like there are three use cases we need to solve for:

# O&O station that has its own website where content should open on that station's site.  Example: Z100
# O&O Digital Channel that does NOT have a website and content should open on www.iheart.com or news.iheart.com.  Example: Hit Nation
# 3rd Party station where a content reference is ingested that should open on the 3rd party site.  Example: CHUM-FM

Assuming the above is correct, we currently deliver on #2 and #3 but not #1.  

I don't know if there's any differentiation in Site Manager between #1 and #2, I think historically that difference has been made on the iHeart.com side based on the website value returned from SMT... for stations that don't have a site, the website is set as news.iheart.com.  

Likewise, i don't know that there's a differentiation between O&O stations and 3rd party stations in Site Manager... but on the SMT side, the provider is Clear Channel vs Bell Media.  However, i suppose it's possible that content created on RadioEdit could eventually be published to a 3rd party site (eg, and article about Festival).

Concurrently, we know there is an ask from the Advanced Product Marketing team to start leveraging an external URL for ingested partner content to override the canonical link tag throughout the platform, so I don't believe that basing the WebAPI logic on that field is the way to go.

I think we need a switch in either SMT or Site Manager that allows selection of how to handle external content, either to open on the linked FiRE site, or at the external URL. (content without an external URL could always use a link constructed through the domain from SMT and the slug from WebAPI.)  I could see arguments for doing it in either of those tools.  SMT could be the logical place since it's something iHeart.com specific, primarily to support 3rd party sites... but that would require the addition of logic to iHeart.com since they pull SMT data from AMP and not via WebAPI.  Likewise, Site Manager could be the best place to do it because the links could be constructed by the API... but that arguably is not a "site" function since the stations that use it don't have proper sites... which could potentially create additional overhead in the tool and FiRE that the bulk of sites wouldn't leverage.  

[~ccrnyc1rar] [~1113379] [~tlong] what do you guys think?
column87:
15/Mar/18 1:36 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;Your use cases seem right to me Mike. I don't mind adding stuff to WebAPI for the web team, that's what it's there for,

Does SM contain O&O stations without a website? If not, we could do this:

{code}
1. Pull requested content items from pubsub
    a. Check for external_url, if present copy to "permalink" datapoint.
    b. Check for site manager record
        1. if exists copy canonical url to "permalink" datapoint.
        2. if missing either leave blank or generate an iheart.com link and add it to "permalink"
{code}

Then web can key off "permalink" always.
column88:
16/Mar/18 9:47 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;There are O&O stations that don't have a dedicated website, they currently have an SM site for purposes of populating the live profile on iHeart.com - but no user-facing website.  At the moment, SMT is used to cue iHeart.com to generate links to www.iheart.com/news.iheart.com to view content.

Example:

http://site-manager.radioedit.iheart.com/#/brands/site/4249acfb9a388f77eb7e46475e0e6089/Imported/general
http://stream-manager.radioedit.iheart.com/#/streams/4422
https://www.iheart.com/live/hit-nation-4422/

Could this maybe key off of whether a site is active/inactive?  If active, use the primary domain setup in Site Manager - if inactive, use www.iheart.com/news.iheart.com.  I THINK that mirrors the logic built on the local ticket to deactivate sites... SMT returns the site data regardless, and then fire looks for the active/inactive switch to know whether to show the site or redirect to iHeart.com.

column1: Pivot URL script
column23:
As an SMT manager ([~ccrnyc1mcr]), I want a script to automate the enabling and disabling of Pivot HLS urls, so that I don't have to manually do it.

Until we build a full blown solution in SMT for the long term, we need a script to provision and manage Pivot HLS urls in SMT for the short term.  Pivot Beta goes live *March 26*, so need a way to manage HLS urls for a list of streams, which [~kchoe] will provide.

Pivot HLS urls should be formatted as follows:

1.   Use this prefix: https://us.api.iheart.com/api/v3/adswizzhls/redirect.m3u8?url=  (if in stage, use:  http://us-stg.api.iheart.com/api/v3/adswizzhls/redirect.m3u8?url=)

2.  Take the stations existing HLS url, and URL encode it.  E.g.  https://c7.prod.playlists.ihrhls.com/2153/playlist.m3u8 would look like: https%3A%2F%2Fc7.prod.playlists.ihrhls.com%2F2153%2Fplaylist.m3u8

3.   Add #1 and #2 together to get: https://us.api.iheart.com/api/v3/adswizzhls/redirect.m3u8?url=https%3A%2F%2Fc7.prod.playlists.ihrhls.com%2F2153%2Fplaylist.m3u8

4.   Append the marketId.  E.g.  WBUT-FM is in market 210:  &marketId=210. The resulting final URL is:  https://us.api.iheart.com/api/v3/adswizzhls/redirect.m3u8?url=https%3A%2F%2Fc7.prod.playlists.ihrhls.com%2F2153%2Fplaylist.m3u8&marketId=210

The resulting Pivot HLS url should be saved to the pivot_hls_stream field in SMT.
column67:
# Script that takes a list of stream ids and creates/saves Pivot HLS urls in SMT

# Script takes a comma separated list of stream ids

column1: Prevent Users From Using Non-Licensed Assets Uploaded By Other Users
column23:
At the moment, all user-uploaded assets are accessible/usable by any permissioned user in the system.  This is causing some problems with the legal department as rogue employees continue to upload unlicensed assets into the system.... which other employees see in the tool as assume we own the rights to it.

How can we prevent OTHER users from seeing unlicensed assets uploaded by someone else and thinking that they are clear to use just because they are shown as available in the Assets tool?

16/Mar/18 10:08 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Original Description 

As the director of editorial content, I would like the ability to track which RE user deletes articles from the content system.  

Paul Miraldi provided these two case scenarios:

1 ‚Äì A piece of content that was written by one of our National Editors mysteriously disappeared from Radio Edit. We have no way of tracking who or why it was deleted.

2-An employee or DJ posts a piece of inappropriate content, perhaps there are complaints via social and they decide to delete it from RE. We have zero evidence that it ever existed.

column1: Paginate Artist Content in webapi

column83:
20/Feb/18 10:52 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;[~1114537], we need some additional information so this can be groomed/prioritized:  

* Please provide an example web api call where you want to have an offset value
* Is there a particular format you want to be able to pass the offset value as?
* Do any other web api calls currently offer this functionality that we could replicate?
* What will adding this allow us to do?  Which WebApp ticket does this block?
column84:
20/Feb/18 11:02 AM;ZackStayman@iheartmedia.com;right now when I query artists I can [do this|https://webapi.radioedit.iheart.com/graphiql?query=%7B%0A%20%20artist(artistId%3A%201648)%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20content(num%3A%2010)%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20summary%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20image%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%20%20%7D%0A%20%20%0A%20%20%7D%0A%7D%0A&operationName=null] to get back a list of articles. I would like an offset argument added alongside num so that I can paginate effectively.

The query functionality under content allows similar behavior.

As for format, an integer is fine. I can keep track of how many articles I want client-side, unless you'd like to implement a more sophisticated pagination strategy on your side.

it blocks part of AC#4 for https://jira.ihrint.com/browse/WEB-8363.

column1: Better management of fire cache prefix
column23: We have to change fire's cache prefix in code (fetch.py) every time a schema changes. Come up with a better way of managing this. Either put the prefix in the config, so auto-generate the prefix from the version id.

column1: SM refactor: figure out homepage query diffs from test results
column83: 02/Mar/18 9:59 AM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;The reason for the difference is that the new REST API isn't applying overrides, because the override query isn't finding them. Opening a new ticket to scrub overrides in general on the refactor branch

column1: SM refactor: old menu item data contains duplicate ids
column23: We need to update the migration scripts to guarantee unique menu item ids. Otherwise the new config merger will gobble up the dupes.

column1: SM refactor: migrated redirects don't merge properly
column23: The migrations assign a random id to each redirect, which causes a problem with merging, i.e. identical redirects (other than the new id field) will appear distinct.
column83: 28/Feb/18 4:24 PM;MattBrown@iheartmedia.com;We decided not to change anything here (other than updating tests to not compare redirect counts). The random ids are what we want, and if there's any duplication it can be resolved manually with the new tool.

column1: Kitchen sink test is flaky
column23: Resolve race condition on snapshot test

column1: Digital Strategy (AR)
Hide Site/Deactivate Cleanup
column23:
In IHRAR-3544, we added an option to make a site inactive.  This was added as a new tab of site manager, however, the functionality is very similar to that of the existing Hide Site option.

We need to make some updates to ensure the deactivate site option plays nicely with the rest of the Site Manager user experience:

# Change "Hide Site" page title and nav link to "Site Status"
# Add module title for existing Hide Site options to "Temporary Redirect"
# Change Hide Site tooltip to "Used to temporarily redirect users to an alternate destination. Contact Digital Support for assistance."
# Make URL redirect field a required field if hide site option is enabled
# Add new module with Deactivate Site functionality with title "Deactivate Site"
# Add tooltip to Deactivate module "Permanently disables this site.  Contact Digital Support for assistance"
# Verify/adjust the blue save hide settings button as appropriate so that it matches the new context of the page.
# On brands screen, do not include deactivated sites by default... add option at top to show Inactive sites (under "All Brand Types" dropdown?)

column1: Apple News: Suppress Byline if No Author Specified
column23:
If no author has been specified for an article, suppress the byline and the pipe character directly after it so just the date shows on that line.

 !image-2018-02-12-09-21-19-686.png|thumbnail!
column83: 27/Feb/18 12:27 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage using http://content.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/edit/5a959484822ddc42d1c3a4ea and looking at the apple json output.  Confirmed that the pipe character is no longer shown.

column1: Update fluentd logger to send logs to Atlas
column23: We need to change the connection string for fluentd to send logs to the new Atlas cluster. This *should* be as simple as changing the connection string and rebuilding the image.

column1: Update auth pymongo to 3.x to support connection via ssl to Atlas
column23: Auth currently uses pymongo 2.8. We need to upgrade to 3.x to support the ssl=true option on the connection string. ssl is required for Atlas.

column1: Update go apps to support connections to Mongo Atlas
column23:
Update go apps (objectdb, scheduler, proxyd, and searchd) to parse the mongo uri, look for the ssl flag, and use that to conditionally enable tls.Dial ala https://github.com/hashicorp/vault/blob/master/plugins/database/mongodb/connection_producer.go#L141

This is required because Atlas uses ssl connections exclusively. We need the fallback to support the existing cluster during transition.

column1: Apple News: Removing article from Apple dashboard causes fetch error in content tool
column23: As a user I want content tool to better handle errors from apple news if an article is removed for from apple dashboard instead of from within the content tool
column67:
Content fails gracefully if it receives an apple news error
User should be able to push removed content
column79:
Delete article from Apple Draft Dashboard
Open article in content tool
Error
column83:
27/Feb/18 12:33 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage using http://content.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/edit/5a959568822ddc42d1c3a4eb

Published article and sent to Apple News.  Confirmed article appeared in the draft folder.  Used takedown link in content tool and confirmed that the content was indeed removed from apple news and no errors were shown to users in the tool.

This looks good to me.

column1: Multi query with empty subscription lists causes timeouts in FiRE
column23: It's possible the empty queries are causing mongo to scan the whole collection of pubsub records. Or some other stupid effect.
column79:
1. Create a homepage with collection config that has 2 empty queries followed by a legit one
2. Watch the query take forever to clear pubsub.
column82:

column1: Spike - SEO Friendly Image URLs
column23:
*Best Practices from SEO Agency*

# Include keywords in the file name that best describe the image being optimized, while being as specific as possible.
#- For file names that include recognizable people (rather than stock characters), include their full name in the image, i.e.: ‚Äúbarack-obama.jpg‚Äù not ‚Äúobama.jpg.‚Äù EX: /pictures/barack-obama-1.jpg
#- The same principle applies to places, events, and products. EX: /uploads/2013/09/2013-dodge-durango-RT.jpg
# Use up to 5 words in addition to any numerical values used to identify the image. It is ok to include internal IDs at the end of the filename when necessary. EX: /downloads/tom-cruise-oscars-5284649274.jpg
# Separate multi-word filenames with hyphens as opposed to underscores.
#- Hyphens indicate to the engines that each element is an individual word, whereas elements separated by underscores are combined into one word.
column83: 20/Mar/18 9:08 AM;MattPena@iheartmedia.com;We will need to lay some ground work to require img keywords on upload or determine a process for scanning and identifying images before this can be done. I'll turn this into a spike to discuss best approach with the team.

column1: Mass update primary_domain field in SMT by streamId
column23: As a support manager I want to run a mass update to fix the primary_domain field in SMT for all streams that have sites hosted on FiRE so URLs generated on iheart.com use the correct site domain.
column67: # primary_domain field is updated by streamId based on the attached csv
column83:
07/Feb/18 10:22 AM;MarkEscott@iheartmedia.com;the issue is links are being generated from the website URL defined in SMT for the station. In this case "www.sportsradiokjr.com". The links are using https and we do not have ssl certs for all station website domains. This should be fixed in one of three ways:

1) update all streams in SMT to define their website using their actual iheart.com domain such as sportsradiokjr.iheart.com. https protocol works for those.
2) hard-code the links on the station's stream profile page to use http instead of https. FiRE and Fastly will handle all appropriate redirects to the secure station website from there, avoiding the browser's privacy warning message.
3) www.iheart.com should look up the station data by the connected RadioEdit brand in SMT and pull the primary station's URL from there. that would account for any domain changes the station makes in the future.

[~ccrnyc1rar]
column84:
08/Feb/18 12:01 AM;RobRowe@iheartmedia.com;This seems to be a direct result of ticket WEB-9415
Since that one came from [~ccrnyc2msw] I'm curious his thoughts on solutions.
column85:
08/Feb/18 8:26 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;It sounds like we have a stale data issue in SMT.  

I think the quick fix would be to do suggestion #1 above, a bulk import of all the current station primary domains and then ensure they get updated on an ongoing basis for future changes.

Long term, #3 is definitely the way to go.  We should only use a domain value provided in SMT if there is no associated FiRE site.

column1: SPIKE - cap collection offset at a reasonable number
column23:
Mongo support has been investigating slow queries and found that we have some with a {code}skip{code} of up to 1 million. Skip is very expensive because the cursor has to iterate through the result set. Skip should only be used by collection queries when the user clicks "Load More." Consider adding a hard cap on the number of pages return by load more.

ref: https://support.mongodb.com/case/00474102
column83: 12/Mar/19 12:26 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Is the idea to cap this on the client side?  Or should we do via validation in the tool?

column1: Rerecord fixtures to account for taxonomy change
Spike: Solve For Standard Publishing Workflows
column23:
As we move to distributing content to brand/market/genre/format tags rather than collection tags, here are the use cases for content distribution that need to be supported before we can move over to the new collection-powered topics.

Notes from Trey/Mike's chat on 2/15/18 in italics

*+Publishing content‚Ä¶ how do i‚Ä¶+*

# Publish to a homepage regardless of whether a station has subscribed to a particular topic _(Use @home placement in the distribution field in addition to the actual brands/segments)_
# Publish to a homepage only if a station has subscribed to a particular topic _(Select topics plus distribution)_
# Publish only to a microsite for all stations that the microsite has been distributed to? note: microsites don't currently have topic restrictions _(Brand is the microsite‚Ä¶ no topic needed)_
# Publish only to a microsite for a subset of stations that have the microsite _(Brand of microsite PLUS brand of parent sites that should get the content)_
# Publish to both the station homepage and the microsite homepage for all stations that have the microsite _(Need to give this some thought. No clear path at the moment)_
# Publish to both the station homepage and the microsite homepage for a subset of stations that have the microsite _(Ditto above, need to give it some thought)_
# Publish something that shouldn't appear on the site or microsite homepage (Solved by new content tool strategy- excluded from timeline)

*+Setup‚Ä¶ how do stations‚Ä¶+*

* Opt in/out of topic subscriptions? _(Need to give this some thought. How can stations select which topics they do or don't want  - eg. News talk stations that doesn't want soft news. How to do the queries in a way that doesn't kill site manager. Do we initially launch without topic selection on homepages? How would we weed out content rules that need a topic but shouldn't show up there?)_
* How do microsites get setup to accept the new content? _(If we ignore topics on microsite homepages, there may be no setup for users. Why are microsites inheriting a parent site's collection content? It should only be the right rail cume widget. See IHRAR-3713)_
column67:
# Engineering review of above workflows
# Adjustments to tools/APIs as needed to accomplish desired workflows
# Basic bullet point documentation of steps needed for each workflow in a format that can be translated by Digital Support for communication to users
column83:
07/Mar/18 5:51 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;We've come up with a way to solve all of these in a relatively simple way and improve query performance dramatically.

Downside: This will require a significant investment in engineering time to change publishing systems (content, pubsub, site-manager)
column84:
07/Mar/18 8:35 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;h3. Concept 
The concept on the surface is one of a "what" and a "where" model.

All items destined for publishing (source) will have zero or more "whats", and zero or more "wheres".

Whats are things like Topic/Category tags, possibly artist tags and any special tags we decide on for publishing use cases.

Wheres are things like Z100, NEWYORK or A_SEGMENT. They can be specific brands or any tag that represents a group.

Queries or Subscriptions defined in site manager (destination) will follow the same model of What and Where.

The Where tags will be able to be combined with boolean logic. For example, you could say "(Z100 and Ryan Seacrest) or WKTU".

h3. Implementation

Content will provide an updated What/Where based interface and a component that allows boolean expressions when selecting tags.

Pubsub will resolve any arbitrarily nested set of boolean expressions to a flat list of strings.

Pubsub will also expand any group tags that come in as the Where. For markets, this means expanding to all sites in that market, for segments it's the same thing. This can generate an enormous amount of possible destinations but since we're just storing it as a plain string array it shouldn't be bad even with several thousand sites.

Site manager will create a data sources editor which follows the same pattern of What/Where. 99% of SM queries should be one or two fixed concepts and require little in the way of change. Additionally, the search list should come down from 250+ to 2-3 which would essentially turbocharge the query system performance wise.

h3. Work

Significant changes to content, pubsub and site manager would be needed. Along with migrations and some new UI components.

column1: Update position box to only accept zero if national user (DL0)
column23:
Use form validation to make invalid any form with a position of 0 where the current user is not national. Do not permit saving, show validation error clearly.

---

We need a way to allow national editors to pin a dynamic lead to the first position.

Normally this is used for a "roadblock" for a national event announce, such as Festival or Awards.  It's also used for breaking news and for limited duration promotions of live video streams/broadcasts.  The goal is for this to be the first thing a listener sees when they come to the homepage, regardless of whatever else a station might have going on.

Nuances:
# The pinned national DL should be the very first one to show
# A local user should not be shown in the first position when a national pinned DL is live
# Only national editors should be able to add a DL here
# After said DL is shown, the remainder of the DL's should show in their normal order
# National pinned DL's should be targetable by segment

column1: Playlist Radio
(3) Toggle for Premium Playlists
column23: We want to add a toggle to the Playlists tool to allow users to mark playlists that are not optimal for DMCA compliant playback to be blocked as premium playlists. If a playlist is marked as "Premium," the playlist will appear inaccessible to Free users in the iHeartRadio app. If a playlist is not marked as "Premium," it will be accessible to Free users as Playlist Radio.
column67:
* Add a toggle to RE Playlists tool that allows curators to mark playlist as "Premium" or not
** Field is titled "Premium Playlist" with toggle defaulted to "No"
* Update all "Thumbs Up" playlists so that they are marked as Premium playlists (i.e., flip Premium toggle to "Yes" for existing Thumbs Up playlists)
* Pass this toggle field to amp along with curated playlist
column83: 24/Jan/18 9:45 AM;MattPena@iheartmedia.com;Hey [~1112284] can this be one checkbox rather than 2? It would just be checked = yes, unchecked = no
column84:
31/Jan/18 12:11 AM;LillianSu@iheartmedia.com;Hey [~1110204]! I put 2 checkboxes vs 1 so that the RE playlist tool user is forced to confirm whether the playlist is premium or not. I figured this approach demands more intent from the user than a singular box that defaults to "no" if user overlooks it and forgets to check it to mark the playlist as premium. I suppose the consequence of a user forgetting to check that box is just that a premium playlist will be made accessible to free users, and only a handful songs will be playable before playback stops. 

I'm not sure what the difference in LOE is between the 2 options, so I'll defer to you. Just wanted to explain the reasoning behind that choice. Let me know!
column85: 31/Jan/18 1:29 PM;GeorgeVilches@iHeartMedia.com;Why wouldn't we just use two radio buttons then?  Default it to "yes" if you're concerned about premium stations being set not premium.
column86: 31/Jan/18 1:30 PM;GeorgeVilches@iHeartMedia.com;Also, what would it mean if both boxes were checked?  Unchecked?  Two dependent checkboxes already have a UI concept, that's what radio buttons are for.  We could leave neither radio button selected if you want to force someone to have to pick one the first time.
column87:
31/Jan/18 1:51 PM;LillianSu@iheartmedia.com;If both are unchecked, I'd expect user not to be able to publish/save changes until one is. But again, was just explaining my thinking. Totally open to other ideas. Since [~1110204] is PM for RadioEdit, I'm fine with whatever he decides. 

AH I also just realized I used the wrong term. I meant radio buttons, not checkboxes. Sorry for the confusion! Have been working on mobile tickets and not web for too long. :)
column88:
07/Feb/18 2:08 PM;GeorgeVilches@iHeartMedia.com;UI-wise, having done the work, I don't like where this is headed.  

 !Screen Shot 2018-02-07 at 2.05.44 PM.png|thumbnail! 

It's the only boolean option that doesn't match the way we display all the other boolean options.  We let everything else have a reasonable default, whether on or off, and present it as a toggle.  If you're afraid of playlists being non-premium by default, then let's just make the default premium, which would prevent that issue from occurring.  As it stands, it makes for awkward UI.

I propose switching it to a toggle to match all the other toggles.  [~1110204] [~1112284] can you please comment?

column1: Autogenerate cache-key prefix as part of the build process
column23:
The cache key prefix in fetch.py needs to be changed every time a schema changes. This is tedious and several times we have forgotten to change it. It would be better to just always change it as part of the build process and not worry about the times when it isn't necessary.

Move the cache key generation to the build process or make it based on an environment variable (like version_id).

column1: Add primary site tag as controlling for microsite
column23: When someone creates a microsite or changes the primary site on an existing site, add the primary site as a controlling tag to the microsite's brand tag. This way, anyone with write access to the primary site can edit the microsite in Site Manager. This feature comes from the Spike IHRAR-3009.
column83:
12/Jun/18 8:45 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Tested on stage using svc-radioeditqa2.

THis user has permission to WHYN-FM and WKTU-FM.

The Microsite wendy-wild1 is owned by WKTU-FM (eg that it should have been hit by the migration script), however, it is does not show up in the site list.  *{color:red}It appears as though the migration script was not successful. {color}*

The microsite mikey-mike-2 was not previously owned by WKTU-FM, so I changed the ownership  to WKTU-FM using a sysadmin account and confirmed that it now shows up for the QA account.  *{color:#8eb021}This part looks fine. {color}*

Further tested by taking a microsite (sean-hollywood-hamilton) that was previously owned by WKTU-FM - upon change of that microsite's ownership to a different site, the permissions inherited from WKTU-FM are not removed.  *{color:red}Need to make sure if a microsite changes owners that the permissions are only inherited from the current parent site.{color}*

column1: SPIKE - Long caching for collection lookup on 404 page
column23: The 404 page does a collection lookup to display suggested content. This is an expensive query, and since 404s happen for any URL, they do not benefit as much from Fastly caching. Discuss how we can cache the collection lookup or the entire 404 for much longer than the default 15 minutes.

column1: Apple News Tracking Pixel
column23:
Adobe doesn't support integration with Apple news. Need to include a tracking pixel on AN articles to feed Adobe suite.

https://marketing.adobe.com/resources/help/en_US/sc/implement/implscwojs.html
column67:
Add tracking pixel to Apple News articles

**Pending tagging details**
column83:
09/Feb/18 9:14 AM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;Reviewed the example calls that Matt provided at https://gist.githubusercontent.com/mattucf/8f3b5eb45954c32f760ee180f0484f86/raw/0887c16c14af2a2d9db3c4c8136e6be9a730bdd8/sitecatalyst-applenews.txt

Offhand, seeing a number of props that are keying off of the origin value that should not be.  

http://content.dev-radioedit.ihrint.com/#/edit/5a6f3dae788046e78fa25417

The following props should always use IHM-IP related values since Apple News is served under the iHeartRadio brand.

Also seeing that h1 and h2 have colons separating the values, these should be commas.

{code:java}
    "c2": "mike.iheart.com",
    "c6": "MIKE-DV",
    "c7": "CORPORATE",
    "c8": "ROCKALTERNATIVE",
    "c25": "CORPORATE:MIKE-DV:ROCKALTERNATIVE",
    "c26": "CORPORATE:MIKE-DV:content",
    "c27": "CORPORATE:MIKE-DV:ROCKALTERNATIVE:content",
    "h1": "CORPORATE:MIKE-DV",
    "h2": "CORPORATE:ROCKALTERNATIVE",
    "v6": "MIKE-DV",
    "v7": "CORPORATE",
    "v8": "ROCKALTERNATIVE",
{code}

Expected values: (note, format-based values are stripped as IHM-IP does not have a format)

{code:java}
    "c2": "news.iheart.com",
    "c6": "IHM-IP",
    "c7": "CORPORATE",
    "c8": (OMIT!)
    "c25": "CORPORATE:IHM-IP:",
    "c26": "CORPORATE:IHM-IP:content",
    "c27": "CORPORATE:IHM-IP::content",
    "h1": "CORPORATE,IHM-IP",
    "h2": "CORPORATE,",
    "v6": "IHM-IP,
    "v7": "CORPORATE",
    "v8":  (OMIT!)
{code}

Note, C42 and C43 should continue to key off of the origin.

Comparison against FiRE calls: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VmDp1fAwB8wTn-ryJ1XbDk4xC0u5xJ7Wfx8iAQh1v7c/edit

10/Jan/18 3:27 PM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;use the purgey application in radioedit

submit surrogate keys to it.

surrogate keys are determined by mediaserver output, you can figure this out by sending an http request to the image with the header Fastly-Debug=1

surrogate keys are in the form "type/key" (e.g. stream/20301)

column1: Add data to fastly output within deliver to indicate the x-noads header is set
column23:
Fastly determines through IP ACL which properties to turn off ads with.

We need to send something from vcl_deliver that the client can key off of. JS doesn't allow access of initial response headers, so cookie might be the best option.
column83:
20/Feb/18 8:49 AM;TreyLong@iheartmedia.com;Staging FiRE VCL has been updated to send a cookie to the client called "no-ads", it will either be "0" or "1". 

In FiRE you should be able to use this on the client to determine whether or not to start ad calls.

column1: Swap ProductIDs in Dynamic Playlists
column23: As an Admin of playlist programming, I‚Äôd like to have a mechanism to swap one productID for another productID across all dynamic playlists so that I don‚Äôt have to manually update them in every single playing when the Mediabase matching chooses the wrong productID.
column67:
* a backend feature exists to swap one productID for another for Dynamic Playlists
* a UI element exists for Admin curators to click and add tracks to the swap list from the playlist tracklist
* a UI element exists for Admin curators to manage (add, update, remove) the full list of swaps 
* Swaps are for Dynamic playlists only
column83: 07/Mar/18 3:26 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;George has another large ticket this sprint which is a higher priority/time sensitive.  Leaving this one out of sprint 6 and at the top of the backlog - if george has time, he'll get a head start on this one.
column84:
30/Apr/18 9:20 AM;GeorgeVilches@iHeartMedia.com;A couple questions that have come up during development of this feature:

1) Are the swaps immediately applied to the dynamic playlist?  As in, the knowledge of the base track is gone, and only the swapped track is left, so there's no way to see that it is a swap?
2) If the answer to (1) is no, is there an expectation that the swap is somehow presented in the custom playlist, or only applied during AMP publish?
column85:
30/Apr/18 9:58 AM;GabeMiller@iheartmedia.com;Hey [~gvilches]

1.) I was hoping the track swap would be immediately applied to the dynamic playlist Track Builder window, and then be applied to the front-end upon playlist publication. 
2.) Not sure I fully understand this one, but as long as Admin Curators can manage (add, update, remove) the full list of swaps (AC #3) there doesn't need to be special presentation for the track swap in the track listing UI
column86: 30/Apr/18 10:26 AM;GeorgeVilches@iHeartMedia.com;Based on your answers, we're not going to keep a history of how the track got swapped, we're just going to swap it, and won't visually indicate to users that any swap actually occurred on the playlist in future views.  Let me know if that needs changing.
column87: 30/Apr/18 10:32 AM;GabeMiller@iheartmedia.com;Sounds acceptable to me!
column88: 07/May/18 4:12 PM;GabeMiller@iheartmedia.com;Adding a swap functionality is looking from the Swaps window (http://playlists.radioedit.ihrint.com/#/swaps). When adding the swap, it immediately updates the content in the track lists. However, when removing a swap I need to refresh my browser in order for the removal to take effect. Possible to look in that [~gvilches]?
column89:
08/May/18 11:29 AM;GeorgeVilches@iHeartMedia.com;That‚Äôs just a quirk of behavior in the UI not forcing swaps immediately.  If anything, swap deletion will result in the swap being left in place in the playlist if we were to make swap changes instantaneous.

Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs happening behind the scenes:
1) A swap is added to the swaps list
column90:
08/May/18 6:52 PM;GabeMiller@iheartmedia.com;I think I understand. I agree with the logic in the workflows you outlined, and definitely observed those in the case of adding swaps.

In the event that a swap was deleted and then all of the Dynamic Playlists were Bulk Published (most similar to Workflow B, I suppose) would the playlists published to users contain the deleted swap or not?
column91: 15/May/18 12:06 PM;GabeMiller@iheartmedia.com;Hey [~gvilches], anything else for me to review or test here?
column92: 15/May/18 5:43 PM;GabeMiller@iheartmedia.com;Hey [~gvilches], [~ccrnyc2msw] asked me to take a look at this since this is in PM review state now. Adding swap functionality still looks good, but I'm seeing a 401 on attempts to actual publish the changes. Can you take a look at that so I can test end to end?

This doesn't affect production, it's strictly a staging environment issue.  We can go to prod without it if needed.

column1: Content Description Increase to 300 Characters (Ingestion)
column23: Ingested content should pass up to 300 characters of the description to the corresponding field in the content item created.
column83:
12/Feb/18 1:38 PM;MikeWoodruff@iheartmedia.com;The 120 character max is intentional search engines and social media won't show an unlimited number of characters.  This limit parallels a limit set in the tool.  I think the problem is that they're trying to load the body into the description field when it should really be in content:encoded.  Please reference https://wiki.ihrint.com/display/PM/RadioEdit+Ingestion+XML+Specs+For+3rd+Parties for how the XML should be formatted.

+ [~1112062]

I'll work with both teams to keep this 120 or less..so it looks better on the front end.

column1: Microsite activation dates default to "now" which isn't stable
column23:
https://github.com/ihr-radioedit-apps/fire/blob/develop/fire/views.py#L510

The default range for the microsite activation date is now to now. Unfortunately, the calculate is done in the wrong order, so that by default, a microsite may appear expired unless the code executes so fast that two subsequent calls to "current_time" return the same value.

column1: Fix stream genre / market import script
column23:
With all the changes that stream genres and markets have gone through we need to update the migration script for pushing SMT which supports stream genre sorting.

Migration script should support:
# Migrating csv genres to stream
# Migrating old genres / markets to new structure

column1: See if we can run chromeless on CI without a proxy
column83: 12/Jan/18 8:37 AM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;I have a docker solution working. The only caveat is that communicating with the server requires the use of docker networking, so you're actually hitting http://web:8000 instead of localhost:5000. I've exposed this via an environment variable so you can easily switch between testing the dockerized server and the local server, and added the override to the travis config so we can test with docker on CI.
column84: 12/Jan/18 2:08 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;I saw this run successfully on CI. One test is currently failing, but a follow up issue has been opened to address that actual bug.

column1: International OD - RadioEdit
Resurrect CI tests and move to chromeless, add python unit tests to CI
column23:
The CI E2E tests for FiRE are in bad shape, let's fix them.

Refactor and improve the FiRE E2E test suite to make them easier to maintain, more understandable and to work on CI system consistently without random failures.

Additionally, research and possible swap webdriver.io for chromeless. Chromeless is typescript project (+1) and it has a sane API (+1) as well as claiming the ability to use headless chrome only through the debugger protocol.
column83: 05/Jan/18 5:48 PM;MarkCahill@iheartmedia.com;CI is f-ed because the docker image is non-operable. There's not actually anything listening on 5000 when you run the image locally. It's probably worth it to get that working again, because that's probably the best way to get the app working on CI. I may spend some time on that next week. When using the local version of the app (via fab run), the data is jacked because canonical_url and publish_origin are missing for the articles under test. Making those not required allows the pages to load, but the e2e tests still fail. We're going to attempt to record some test data from staging or prod instead on Monday.

column1: Add expires header to mediaserver URLs
column23:
As we are trying to speed up iHeart.com, we are using Google's preferred Speed Test website, webpagetest.org. Of all the factors, the only one that's getting a bad grade is "cache static content."
 !image-2018-01-02-16-59-47-602.png|thumbnail! 

Drilling into this category reveals the vast majority being i.iheart..com URLs:
https://www.webpagetest.org/performance_optimization.php?test=171227_D9_979ed887bab62e60818ffbeb5c526694&run=2#cache_static_content
 
{code}Leverage browser caching of static assets: 37/100
FAILED - (No max-age or expires) - https://i.iheart.com/v3/re/assets/images/2525.png
FAILED - (No max-age or expires) - https://i.iheart.com/v3/re/assets/images/45dc5aaa-3742-458d-a539-5e126553ade9.png
FAILED - (No max-age or expires) - https://i.iheart.com/v3/re/assets/images/45dc5aaa-3742-458d-a539-5e126553ade9.png
FAILED - (No max-age or expires) - https://i.iheart.com/v3/re/new_assets/2b9c5d03-9e7c-40a2-a960-125447f295ee
FAILED - (No max-age or expires) - https://i.iheart.com/v3/re/new_assets/41ac4c63-58d2-4fde-97fe-aa8107d3ae62?ops=fit(75%2C75)
FAILED - (No max-age or expires) - https://i.iheart.com/v3/re/new_assets/d6d243a8-e439-43cc-bf4d-77ccb1d8fd74
FAILED - (No max-age or expires) - https://i.iheart.com/v3/re/assets/images/4242.png{code}
column67:
# expires header added to i.iheart.com images
# webpagetest.org passes
column83: 19/Mar/18 5:02 PM;TravisTerry@iheartmedia.com;In media server we have two cache expirations. One controls how long fastly cached images before hitting the origin server. The other expiration is the public expiration given to browsers. This controls how long the browser will reuse an image before hitting fastly again. In media server, the fastly expiration is 14 days, and the public expiration is 6 hours. A browser will hit fastly every 6 hours looking for an update to the image, and fastly will continue returning the same image for 14 days before asking the origin. If we need to preemptively expire an image from fastly we can purge it. The maximum time a browser would continue to use the purged image is 6 hours.

column1: Targeting tool tips and updates
column23: As a user I want to know what is expected of me for each targeting field
column67:
Origin: Select a tag for the Site or Microsite which owns this content. i.e. XXXX-FM (required)

Primary Topic Set: Change this name to ‚ÄúPrimary Publishing Settings‚Äù

Categories: Select the Category pages where this content should display (optional)

Distribution: Select the Sites or Microsites where this content should display (required)

Additional Topic Sets (Feeds): Change this name to ‚ÄúAdditional Publishing Settings‚Äù. Tool Tip: Add additional Category/Distribution settings for this content

Exclusions: Select the Sites or Microsites where this content should NOT display (optional)
